104 using namespace clang::driver;
105 using namespace clang;
106 using namespace llvm::opt;
107 
108 static llvm::Optional<llvm::Triple>
109 getOffloadTargetTriple(const Driver &D, const ArgList &Args) {
110  auto OffloadTargets = Args.getAllArgValues(options::OPT_offload_EQ);
111  // Offload compilation flow does not support multiple targets for now. We
112  // need the HIPActionBuilder (and possibly the CudaActionBuilder{,Base}too)
113  // to support multiple tool chains first.
114  switch (OffloadTargets.size()) {
115  default:
116  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_only_one_offload_target_supported);
117  return llvm::None;
118  case 0:
119  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_invalid_or_unsupported_offload_target) << "";
120  return llvm::None;
121  case 1:
122  break;
123  }
124  return llvm::Triple(OffloadTargets[0]);
125 }
126 
127 static llvm::Optional<llvm::Triple>
128 getNVIDIAOffloadTargetTriple(const Driver &D, const ArgList &Args,
129  const llvm::Triple &HostTriple) {
130  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_offload_EQ)) {
131  return llvm::Triple(HostTriple.isArch64Bit() ? "nvptx64-nvidia-cuda"
132  : "nvptx-nvidia-cuda");
133  }
134  auto TT = getOffloadTargetTriple(D, Args);
135  if (TT && (TT->getArch() == llvm::Triple::spirv32 ||
136  TT->getArch() == llvm::Triple::spirv64)) {
137  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm))
138  return TT;
139  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_cuda_offload_only_emit_bc);
140  return llvm::None;
141  }
142  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_invalid_or_unsupported_offload_target) << TT->str();
143  return llvm::None;
144 }
145 static llvm::Optional<llvm::Triple>
146 getHIPOffloadTargetTriple(const Driver &D, const ArgList &Args) {
147  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_offload_EQ)) {
148  return llvm::Triple("amdgcn-amd-amdhsa"); // Default HIP triple.
149  }
150  auto TT = getOffloadTargetTriple(D, Args);
151  if (!TT)
152  return llvm::None;
153  if (TT->getArch() == llvm::Triple::amdgcn &&
154  TT->getVendor() == llvm::Triple::AMD &&
155  TT->getOS() == llvm::Triple::AMDHSA)
156  return TT;
157  if (TT->getArch() == llvm::Triple::spirv64)
158  return TT;
159  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_invalid_or_unsupported_offload_target) << TT->str();
160  return llvm::None;
161 }
162 
163 // static
164 std::string Driver::GetResourcesPath(StringRef BinaryPath,
165  StringRef CustomResourceDir) {
166  // Since the resource directory is embedded in the module hash, it's important
167  // that all places that need it call this function, so that they get the
168  // exact same string ("a/../b/" and "b/" get different hashes, for example).
169 
170  // Dir is bin/ or lib/, depending on where BinaryPath is.
171  std::string Dir = std::string(llvm::sys::path::parent_path(BinaryPath));
172 
173  SmallString<128> P(Dir);
174  if (CustomResourceDir != "") {
175  llvm::sys::path::append(P, CustomResourceDir);
176  } else {
177  // On Windows, libclang.dll is in bin/.
178  // On non-Windows, libclang.so/.dylib is in lib/.
179  // With a static-library build of libclang, LibClangPath will contain the
180  // path of the embedding binary, which for LLVM binaries will be in bin/.
181  // ../lib gets us to lib/ in both cases.
182  P = llvm::sys::path::parent_path(Dir);
183  llvm::sys::path::append(P, Twine("lib") + CLANG_LIBDIR_SUFFIX, "clang",
184  CLANG_VERSION_STRING);
185  }
186 
187  return std::string(P.str());
188 }
189 
190 Driver::Driver(StringRef ClangExecutable, StringRef TargetTriple,
191  DiagnosticsEngine &Diags, std::string Title,
192  IntrusiveRefCntPtr<llvm::vfs::FileSystem> VFS)
193  : Diags(Diags), VFS(std::move(VFS)), Mode(GCCMode),
194  SaveTemps(SaveTempsNone), BitcodeEmbed(EmbedNone), LTOMode(LTOK_None),
195  ClangExecutable(ClangExecutable), SysRoot(DEFAULT_SYSROOT),
196  DriverTitle(Title), CCCPrintBindings(false), CCPrintOptions(false),
197  CCPrintHeaders(false), CCLogDiagnostics(false), CCGenDiagnostics(false),
198  CCPrintProcessStats(false), TargetTriple(TargetTriple), Saver(Alloc),
199  CheckInputsExist(true), GenReproducer(false),
200  SuppressMissingInputWarning(false) {
201  // Provide a sane fallback if no VFS is specified.
202  if (!this->VFS)
203  this->VFS = llvm::vfs::getRealFileSystem();
204 
205  Name = std::string(llvm::sys::path::filename(ClangExecutable));
206  Dir = std::string(llvm::sys::path::parent_path(ClangExecutable));
207  InstalledDir = Dir; // Provide a sensible default installed dir.
208 
209  if ((!SysRoot.empty()) && llvm::sys::path::is_relative(SysRoot)) {
210  // Prepend InstalledDir if SysRoot is relative
211  SmallString<128> P(InstalledDir);
212  llvm::sys::path::append(P, SysRoot);
213  SysRoot = std::string(P);
214  }
215 
216 #if defined(CLANG_CONFIG_FILE_SYSTEM_DIR)
217  SystemConfigDir = CLANG_CONFIG_FILE_SYSTEM_DIR;
218 #endif
219 #if defined(CLANG_CONFIG_FILE_USER_DIR)
220  UserConfigDir = CLANG_CONFIG_FILE_USER_DIR;
221 #endif
222 
223  // Compute the path to the resource directory.
224  ResourceDir = GetResourcesPath(ClangExecutable, CLANG_RESOURCE_DIR);
225 }
226 
227 void Driver::setDriverMode(StringRef Value) {
228  static const std::string OptName =
229  getOpts().getOption(options::OPT_driver_mode).getPrefixedName();
230  if (auto M = llvm::StringSwitch<llvm::Optional<DriverMode>>(Value)
231  .Case("gcc", GCCMode)
232  .Case("g++", GXXMode)
233  .Case("cpp", CPPMode)
234  .Case("cl", CLMode)
235  .Case("flang", FlangMode)
236  .Default(None))
237  Mode = *M;
238  else
239  Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument) << OptName << Value;
240 }
241 
242 InputArgList Driver::ParseArgStrings(ArrayRef<const char *> ArgStrings,
243  bool IsClCompatMode,
244  bool &ContainsError) {
245  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Command line argument parsing");
246  ContainsError = false;
247 
248  unsigned IncludedFlagsBitmask;
249  unsigned ExcludedFlagsBitmask;
250  std::tie(IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask) =
251  getIncludeExcludeOptionFlagMasks(IsClCompatMode);
252 
253  // Make sure that Flang-only options don't pollute the Clang output
254  // TODO: Make sure that Clang-only options don't pollute Flang output
255  if (!IsFlangMode())
256  ExcludedFlagsBitmask |= options::FlangOnlyOption;
257 
258  unsigned MissingArgIndex, MissingArgCount;
259  InputArgList Args =
260  getOpts().ParseArgs(ArgStrings, MissingArgIndex, MissingArgCount,
261  IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask);
262 
263  // Check for missing argument error.
264  if (MissingArgCount) {
265  Diag(diag::err_drv_missing_argument)
266  << Args.getArgString(MissingArgIndex) << MissingArgCount;
267  ContainsError |=
268  Diags.getDiagnosticLevel(diag::err_drv_missing_argument,
269  SourceLocation()) > DiagnosticsEngine::Warning;
270  }
271 
272  // Check for unsupported options.
273  for (const Arg *A : Args) {
274  if (A->getOption().hasFlag(options::Unsupported)) {
275  unsigned DiagID;
276  auto ArgString = A->getAsString(Args);
277  std::string Nearest;
278  if (getOpts().findNearest(
279  ArgString, Nearest, IncludedFlagsBitmask,
280  ExcludedFlagsBitmask | options::Unsupported) > 1) {
281  DiagID = diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt;
282  Diag(DiagID) << ArgString;
283  } else {
284  DiagID = diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt_with_suggestion;
285  Diag(DiagID) << ArgString << Nearest;
286  }
287  ContainsError |= Diags.getDiagnosticLevel(DiagID, SourceLocation()) >
288  DiagnosticsEngine::Warning;
289  continue;
290  }
291 
292  // Warn about -mcpu= without an argument.
293  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_mcpu_EQ) && A->containsValue("")) {
294  Diag(diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument) << A->getAsString(Args);
295  ContainsError |= Diags.getDiagnosticLevel(
296  diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument,
297  SourceLocation()) > DiagnosticsEngine::Warning;
298  }
299  }
300 
301  for (const Arg *A : Args.filtered(options::OPT_UNKNOWN)) {
302  unsigned DiagID;
303  auto ArgString = A->getAsString(Args);
304  std::string Nearest;
305  if (getOpts().findNearest(
306  ArgString, Nearest, IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask) > 1) {
307  DiagID = IsCLMode() ? diag::warn_drv_unknown_argument_clang_cl
308  : diag::err_drv_unknown_argument;
309  Diags.Report(DiagID) << ArgString;
310  } else {
311  DiagID = IsCLMode()
312  ? diag::warn_drv_unknown_argument_clang_cl_with_suggestion
313  : diag::err_drv_unknown_argument_with_suggestion;
314  Diags.Report(DiagID) << ArgString << Nearest;
315  }
316  ContainsError |= Diags.getDiagnosticLevel(DiagID, SourceLocation()) >
317  DiagnosticsEngine::Warning;
318  }
319 
320  return Args;
321 }
322 
323 // Determine which compilation mode we are in. We look for options which
324 // affect the phase, starting with the earliest phases, and record which
325 // option we used to determine the final phase.
326 phases::ID Driver::getFinalPhase(const DerivedArgList &DAL,
327  Arg **FinalPhaseArg) const {
328  Arg *PhaseArg = nullptr;
329  phases::ID FinalPhase;
330 
331  // -{E,EP,P,M,MM} only run the preprocessor.
332  if (CCCIsCPP() || (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_E)) ||
333  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_EP)) ||
334  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_M, options::OPT_MM)) ||
335  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_P)) ||
336  CCGenDiagnostics) {
337  FinalPhase = phases::Preprocess;
338 
339  // --precompile only runs up to precompilation.
340  } else if ((PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT__precompile)) ||
341  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_extract_api))) {
342  FinalPhase = phases::Precompile;
343  // -{fsyntax-only,-analyze,emit-ast} only run up to the compiler.
344  } else if ((PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsyntax_only)) ||
345  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_print_supported_cpus)) ||
346  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_module_file_info)) ||
347  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_verify_pch)) ||
348  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_rewrite_objc)) ||
349  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_rewrite_legacy_objc)) ||
350  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT__migrate)) ||
351  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT__analyze)) ||
352  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_emit_ast))) {
353  FinalPhase = phases::Compile;
354 
355  // -S only runs up to the backend.
356  } else if ((PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_S)) ||
357  (PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_only))) {
358  FinalPhase = phases::Backend;
359 
360  // -c compilation only runs up to the assembler.
361  } else if ((PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_c))) {
362  FinalPhase = phases::Assemble;
363 
364  } else if ((PhaseArg = DAL.getLastArg(options::OPT_emit_interface_stubs))) {
365  FinalPhase = phases::IfsMerge;
366 
367  // Otherwise do everything.
368  } else
369  FinalPhase = phases::Link;
370 
371  if (FinalPhaseArg)
372  *FinalPhaseArg = PhaseArg;
373 
374  return FinalPhase;
375 }
376 
377 static Arg *MakeInputArg(DerivedArgList &Args, const OptTable &Opts,
378  StringRef Value, bool Claim = true) {
379  Arg *A = new Arg(Opts.getOption(options::OPT_INPUT), Value,
380  Args.getBaseArgs().MakeIndex(Value), Value.data());
381  Args.AddSynthesizedArg(A);
382  if (Claim)
383  A->claim();
384  return A;
385 }
386 
387 DerivedArgList *Driver::TranslateInputArgs(const InputArgList &Args) const {
388  const llvm::opt::OptTable &Opts = getOpts();
389  DerivedArgList *DAL = new DerivedArgList(Args);
390 
391  bool HasNostdlib = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_nostdlib);
392  bool HasNostdlibxx = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_nostdlibxx);
393  bool HasNodefaultlib = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_nodefaultlibs);
394  bool IgnoreUnused = false;
395  for (Arg *A : Args) {
396  if (IgnoreUnused)
397  A->claim();
398 
399  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_start_no_unused_arguments)) {
400  IgnoreUnused = true;
401  continue;
402  }
403  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_end_no_unused_arguments)) {
404  IgnoreUnused = false;
405  continue;
406  }
407 
408  // Unfortunately, we have to parse some forwarding options (-Xassembler,
409  // -Xlinker, -Xpreprocessor) because we either integrate their functionality
410  // (assembler and preprocessor), or bypass a previous driver ('collect2').
411 
412  // Rewrite linker options, to replace --no-demangle with a custom internal
413  // option.
414  if ((A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Wl_COMMA) ||
415  A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Xlinker)) &&
416  A->containsValue("--no-demangle")) {
417  // Add the rewritten no-demangle argument.
418  DAL->AddFlagArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_Z_Xlinker__no_demangle));
419 
420  // Add the remaining values as Xlinker arguments.
421  for (StringRef Val : A->getValues())
422  if (Val != "--no-demangle")
423  DAL->AddSeparateArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_Xlinker), Val);
424 
425  continue;
426  }
427 
428  // Rewrite preprocessor options, to replace -Wp,-MD,FOO which is used by
429  // some build systems. We don't try to be complete here because we don't
430  // care to encourage this usage model.
431  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Wp_COMMA) &&
432  (A->getValue(0) == StringRef("-MD") ||
433  A->getValue(0) == StringRef("-MMD"))) {
434  // Rewrite to -MD/-MMD along with -MF.
435  if (A->getValue(0) == StringRef("-MD"))
436  DAL->AddFlagArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_MD));
437  else
438  DAL->AddFlagArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_MMD));
439  if (A->getNumValues() == 2)
440  DAL->AddSeparateArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_MF), A->getValue(1));
441  continue;
442  }
443 
444  // Rewrite reserved library names.
445  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_l)) {
446  StringRef Value = A->getValue();
447 
448  // Rewrite unless -nostdlib is present.
449  if (!HasNostdlib && !HasNodefaultlib && !HasNostdlibxx &&
450  Value == "stdc++") {
451  DAL->AddFlagArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_Z_reserved_lib_stdcxx));
452  continue;
453  }
454 
455  // Rewrite unconditionally.
456  if (Value == "cc_kext") {
457  DAL->AddFlagArg(A, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_Z_reserved_lib_cckext));
458  continue;
459  }
460  }
461 
462  // Pick up inputs via the -- option.
463  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT__DASH_DASH)) {
464  A->claim();
465  for (StringRef Val : A->getValues())
466  DAL->append(MakeInputArg(*DAL, Opts, Val, false));
467  continue;
468  }
469 
470  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_offload_lib_Group)) {
471  if (!A->getNumValues()) {
472  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_unused_argument) << A->getSpelling();
473  continue;
474  }
475  }
476 
477  DAL->append(A);
478  }
479 
480  // Enforce -static if -miamcu is present.
481  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_miamcu, options::OPT_mno_iamcu, false))
482  DAL->AddFlagArg(nullptr, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_static));
483 
484  // Use of -fintelfpga implies -g
485  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fintelfpga)) {
486  // if any -gN option is provided, use that.
487  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_gN_Group))
488  DAL->append(A);
489  else
490  DAL->AddFlagArg(0, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_g_Flag));
491  }
492 
493 // Add a default value of -mlinker-version=, if one was given and the user
494 // didn't specify one.
495 #if defined(HOST_LINK_VERSION)
496  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_mlinker_version_EQ) &&
497  strlen(HOST_LINK_VERSION) > 0) {
498  DAL->AddJoinedArg(0, Opts.getOption(options::OPT_mlinker_version_EQ),
499  HOST_LINK_VERSION);
500  DAL->getLastArg(options::OPT_mlinker_version_EQ)->claim();
501  }
502 #endif
503 
504  return DAL;
505 }
506 
507 /// Compute target triple from args.
508 ///
509 /// This routine provides the logic to compute a target triple from various
510 /// args passed to the driver and the default triple string.
511 static llvm::Triple computeTargetTriple(const Driver &D,
512  StringRef TargetTriple,
513  const ArgList &Args,
514  StringRef DarwinArchName = "") {
515  // FIXME: Already done in Compilation *Driver::BuildCompilation
516  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_target))
517  TargetTriple = A->getValue();
518 
519  llvm::Triple Target(llvm::Triple::normalize(TargetTriple));
520 
521  // GNU/Hurd's triples should have been -hurd-gnu*, but were historically made
522  // -gnu* only, and we can not change this, so we have to detect that case as
523  // being the Hurd OS.
524  if (TargetTriple.contains("-unknown-gnu") || TargetTriple.contains("-pc-gnu"))
525  Target.setOSName("hurd");
526 
527  // Handle Apple-specific options available here.
528  if (Target.isOSBinFormatMachO()) {
529  // If an explicit Darwin arch name is given, that trumps all.
530  if (!DarwinArchName.empty()) {
531  tools::darwin::setTripleTypeForMachOArchName(Target, DarwinArchName);
532  return Target;
533  }
534 
535  // Handle the Darwin '-arch' flag.
536  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_arch)) {
537  StringRef ArchName = A->getValue();
538  tools::darwin::setTripleTypeForMachOArchName(Target, ArchName);
539  }
540  }
541 
542  // Handle pseudo-target flags '-mlittle-endian'/'-EL' and
543  // '-mbig-endian'/'-EB'.
544  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_mlittle_endian,
545  options::OPT_mbig_endian)) {
546  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_mlittle_endian)) {
547  llvm::Triple LE = Target.getLittleEndianArchVariant();
548  if (LE.getArch() != llvm::Triple::UnknownArch)
549  Target = std::move(LE);
550  } else {
551  llvm::Triple BE = Target.getBigEndianArchVariant();
552  if (BE.getArch() != llvm::Triple::UnknownArch)
553  Target = std::move(BE);
554  }
555  }
556 
557  // Skip further flag support on OSes which don't support '-m32' or '-m64'.
558  if (Target.getArch() == llvm::Triple::tce ||
559  Target.getOS() == llvm::Triple::Minix)
560  return Target;
561 
562  // On AIX, the env OBJECT_MODE may affect the resulting arch variant.
563  if (Target.isOSAIX()) {
564  if (Optional<std::string> ObjectModeValue =
565  llvm::sys::Process::GetEnv("OBJECT_MODE")) {
566  StringRef ObjectMode = *ObjectModeValue;
567  llvm::Triple::ArchType AT = llvm::Triple::UnknownArch;
568 
569  if (ObjectMode.equals("64")) {
570  AT = Target.get64BitArchVariant().getArch();
571  } else if (ObjectMode.equals("32")) {
572  AT = Target.get32BitArchVariant().getArch();
573  } else {
574  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_invalid_object_mode) << ObjectMode;
575  }
576 
577  if (AT != llvm::Triple::UnknownArch && AT != Target.getArch())
578  Target.setArch(AT);
579  }
580  }
581 
582  // Handle pseudo-target flags '-m64', '-mx32', '-m32' and '-m16'.
583  Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_m64, options::OPT_mx32,
584  options::OPT_m32, options::OPT_m16);
585  if (A) {
586  llvm::Triple::ArchType AT = llvm::Triple::UnknownArch;
587 
588  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_m64)) {
589  AT = Target.get64BitArchVariant().getArch();
590  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUX32)
591  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNU);
592  else if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::MuslX32)
593  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::Musl);
594  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_mx32) &&
595  Target.get64BitArchVariant().getArch() == llvm::Triple::x86_64) {
596  AT = llvm::Triple::x86_64;
597  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::Musl)
598  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::MuslX32);
599  else
600  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNUX32);
601  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_m32)) {
602  AT = Target.get32BitArchVariant().getArch();
603  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUX32)
604  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNU);
605  else if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::MuslX32)
606  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::Musl);
607  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_m16) &&
608  Target.get32BitArchVariant().getArch() == llvm::Triple::x86) {
609  AT = llvm::Triple::x86;
610  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::CODE16);
611  }
612 
613  if (AT != llvm::Triple::UnknownArch && AT != Target.getArch()) {
614  Target.setArch(AT);
615  if (Target.isWindowsGNUEnvironment())
616  toolchains::MinGW::fixTripleArch(D, Target, Args);
617  }
618  }
619 
620  // Handle -miamcu flag.
621  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_miamcu, options::OPT_mno_iamcu, false)) {
622  if (Target.get32BitArchVariant().getArch() != llvm::Triple::x86)
623  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt_for_target) << "-miamcu"
624  << Target.str();
625 
626  if (A && !A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_m32))
627  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_argument_not_allowed_with)
628  << "-miamcu" << A->getBaseArg().getAsString(Args);
629 
630  Target.setArch(llvm::Triple::x86);
631  Target.setArchName("i586");
632  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::UnknownEnvironment);
633  Target.setEnvironmentName("");
634  Target.setOS(llvm::Triple::ELFIAMCU);
635  Target.setVendor(llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor);
636  Target.setVendorName("intel");
637  }
638 
639  // If target is MIPS adjust the target triple
640  // accordingly to provided ABI name.
641  A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_mabi_EQ);
642  if (A && Target.isMIPS()) {
643  StringRef ABIName = A->getValue();
644  if (ABIName == "32") {
645  Target = Target.get32BitArchVariant();
646  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUABI64 ||
647  Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUABIN32)
648  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNU);
649  } else if (ABIName == "n32") {
650  Target = Target.get64BitArchVariant();
651  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNU ||
652  Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUABI64)
653  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNUABIN32);
654  } else if (ABIName == "64") {
655  Target = Target.get64BitArchVariant();
656  if (Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNU ||
657  Target.getEnvironment() == llvm::Triple::GNUABIN32)
658  Target.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::GNUABI64);
659  }
660  }
661 
662  // If target is RISC-V adjust the target triple according to
663  // provided architecture name
664  A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_march_EQ);
665  if (A && Target.isRISCV()) {
666  StringRef ArchName = A->getValue();
667  if (ArchName.startswith_insensitive("rv32"))
668  Target.setArch(llvm::Triple::riscv32);
669  else if (ArchName.startswith_insensitive("rv64"))
670  Target.setArch(llvm::Triple::riscv64);
671  }
672 
673  return Target;
674 }
675 
676 // Parse the LTO options and record the type of LTO compilation
677 // based on which -f(no-)?lto(=.*)? or -f(no-)?offload-lto(=.*)?
678 // option occurs last.
679 static driver::LTOKind parseLTOMode(Driver &D, const llvm::opt::ArgList &Args,
680  OptSpecifier OptEq, OptSpecifier OptNeg) {
681  if (!Args.hasFlag(OptEq, OptNeg, false))
682  return LTOK_None;
683 
684  const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(OptEq);
685  StringRef LTOName = A->getValue();
686 
687  driver::LTOKind LTOMode = llvm::StringSwitch<LTOKind>(LTOName)
688  .Case("full", LTOK_Full)
689  .Case("thin", LTOK_Thin)
690  .Default(LTOK_Unknown);
691 
692  if (LTOMode == LTOK_Unknown) {
693  D.Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument)
694  << A->getOption().getName() << A->getValue();
695  return LTOK_None;
696  }
697  return LTOMode;
698 }
699 
700 // Parse the LTO options.
701 void Driver::setLTOMode(const llvm::opt::ArgList &Args) {
702  LTOMode =
703  parseLTOMode(*this, Args, options::OPT_flto_EQ, options::OPT_fno_lto);
704 
705  OffloadLTOMode = parseLTOMode(*this, Args, options::OPT_foffload_lto_EQ,
706  options::OPT_fno_offload_lto);
707 }
708 
709 /// Compute the desired OpenMP runtime from the flags provided.
710 Driver::OpenMPRuntimeKind Driver::getOpenMPRuntime(const ArgList &Args) const {
711  StringRef RuntimeName(CLANG_DEFAULT_OPENMP_RUNTIME);
712 
713  const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_EQ);
714  if (A)
715  RuntimeName = A->getValue();
716 
717  auto RT = llvm::StringSwitch<OpenMPRuntimeKind>(RuntimeName)
718  .Case("libomp", OMPRT_OMP)
719  .Case("libgomp", OMPRT_GOMP)
720  .Case("libiomp5", OMPRT_IOMP5)
721  .Default(OMPRT_Unknown);
722 
723  if (RT == OMPRT_Unknown) {
724  if (A)
725  Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument)
726  << A->getOption().getName() << A->getValue();
727  else
728  // FIXME: We could use a nicer diagnostic here.
729  Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt) << "-fopenmp";
730  }
731 
732  return RT;
733 }
734 
735 static bool isValidSYCLTriple(llvm::Triple T) {
736  // NVPTX is valid for SYCL.
737  if (T.isNVPTX())
738  return true;
739 
740  // AMDGCN is valid for SYCL
741  if (T.isAMDGCN())
742  return true;
743 
744  // Check for invalid SYCL device triple values.
745  // Non-SPIR arch.
746  if (!T.isSPIR())
747  return false;
748  // SPIR arch, but has invalid SubArch for AOT.
749  StringRef A(T.getArchName());
750  if (T.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::NoSubArch &&
751  ((T.getArch() == llvm::Triple::spir && !A.equals("spir")) ||
752  (T.getArch() == llvm::Triple::spir64 && !A.equals("spir64"))))
753  return false;
754  return true;
755 }
756 
757 static const char *getDefaultSYCLArch(Compilation &C) {
758  if (C.getDefaultToolChain().getTriple().getArch() == llvm::Triple::x86)
759  return "spir";
760  return "spir64";
761 }
762 
763 static bool addSYCLDefaultTriple(Compilation &C,
764  SmallVectorImpl<llvm::Triple> &SYCLTriples) {
765  /// Returns true if a triple is added to SYCLTriples, false otherwise
766  if (!C.getDriver().isSYCLDefaultTripleImplied())
767  return false;
768  for (const auto &SYCLTriple : SYCLTriples) {
769  if (SYCLTriple.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::NoSubArch &&
770  SYCLTriple.isSPIR())
771  return false;
772  // If we encounter a known non-spir* target, do not add the default triple.
773  if (SYCLTriple.isNVPTX() || SYCLTriple.isAMDGCN())
774  return false;
775  }
776  // Add the default triple as it was not found.
777  llvm::Triple DefaultTriple =
778  C.getDriver().MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(getDefaultSYCLArch(C));
779  SYCLTriples.insert(SYCLTriples.begin(), DefaultTriple);
780  return true;
781 }
782 
783 void Driver::CreateOffloadingDeviceToolChains(Compilation &C,
784  InputList &Inputs) {
785 
786  //
787  // CUDA/HIP
788  //
789  // We need to generate a CUDA/HIP toolchain if any of the inputs has a CUDA
790  // or HIP type. However, mixed CUDA/HIP compilation is not supported.
791  bool IsCuda =
792  llvm::any_of(Inputs, [](std::pair<types::ID, const llvm::opt::Arg *> &I) {
793  return types::isCuda(I.first);
794  });
795  bool IsHIP =
796  llvm::any_of(Inputs,
797  [](std::pair<types::ID, const llvm::opt::Arg *> &I) {
798  return types::isHIP(I.first);
799  }) ||
800  C.getInputArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_hip_link);
801  if (IsCuda && IsHIP) {
802  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_mix_cuda_hip);
803  return;
804  }
805  if (IsCuda) {
806  const ToolChain *HostTC = C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>();
807  const llvm::Triple &HostTriple = HostTC->getTriple();
808  auto OFK = Action::OFK_Cuda;
809  auto CudaTriple =
810  getNVIDIAOffloadTargetTriple(*this, C.getInputArgs(), HostTriple);
811  if (!CudaTriple)
812  return;
813  // Use the CUDA and host triples as the key into the
814  // getOffloadingDeviceToolChain, because the device toolchain we
815  // create depends on both.
816  auto CudaTC = &getOffloadingDeviceToolChain(C.getInputArgs(), *CudaTriple,
817  *HostTC, OFK);
818  C.addOffloadDeviceToolChain(CudaTC, OFK);
819  } else if (IsHIP) {
820  if (auto *OMPTargetArg =
821  C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_targets_EQ)) {
822  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt_for_language_mode)
823  << OMPTargetArg->getSpelling() << "HIP";
824  return;
825  }
826  const ToolChain *HostTC = C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>();
827  auto OFK = Action::OFK_HIP;
828  auto HIPTriple = getHIPOffloadTargetTriple(*this, C.getInputArgs());
829  if (!HIPTriple)
830  return;
831  auto *HIPTC = &getOffloadingDeviceToolChain(C.getInputArgs(), *HIPTriple,
832  *HostTC, OFK);
833  assert(HIPTC && "Could not create offloading device tool chain.");
834  C.addOffloadDeviceToolChain(HIPTC, OFK);
835  }
836 
837  //
838  // OpenMP
839  //
840  // We need to generate an OpenMP toolchain if the user specified targets with
841  // the -fopenmp-targets option.
842  if (Arg *OpenMPTargets =
843  C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_targets_EQ)) {
844  if (OpenMPTargets->getNumValues()) {
845  // We expect that -fopenmp-targets is always used in conjunction with the
846  // option -fopenmp specifying a valid runtime with offloading support,
847  // i.e. libomp or libiomp.
848  bool HasValidOpenMPRuntime = C.getInputArgs().hasFlag(
849  options::OPT_fopenmp, options::OPT_fopenmp_EQ,
850  options::OPT_fno_openmp, false);
851  if (HasValidOpenMPRuntime) {
852  OpenMPRuntimeKind OpenMPKind = getOpenMPRuntime(C.getInputArgs());
853  HasValidOpenMPRuntime =
854  OpenMPKind == OMPRT_OMP || OpenMPKind == OMPRT_IOMP5;
855  }
856 
857  if (HasValidOpenMPRuntime) {
858  llvm::StringMap<const char *> FoundNormalizedTriples;
859  for (const char *Val : OpenMPTargets->getValues()) {
860  llvm::Triple TT(ToolChain::getOpenMPTriple(Val));
861  std::string NormalizedName = TT.normalize();
862 
863  // Make sure we don't have a duplicate triple.
864  auto Duplicate = FoundNormalizedTriples.find(NormalizedName);
865  if (Duplicate != FoundNormalizedTriples.end()) {
866  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_omp_offload_target_duplicate)
867  << Val << Duplicate->second;
868  continue;
869  }
870 
871  // Store the current triple so that we can check for duplicates in the
872  // following iterations.
873  FoundNormalizedTriples[NormalizedName] = Val;
874 
875  // If the specified target is invalid, emit a diagnostic.
876  if (TT.getArch() == llvm::Triple::UnknownArch)
877  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_omp_target) << Val;
878  else {
879  const ToolChain *TC;
880  // Device toolchains have to be selected differently. They pair host
881  // and device in their implementation.
882  if (TT.isNVPTX() || TT.isAMDGCN()) {
883  const ToolChain *HostTC =
884  C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>();
885  assert(HostTC && "Host toolchain should be always defined.");
886  auto &DeviceTC =
887  ToolChains[TT.str() + "/" + HostTC->getTriple().normalize()];
888  if (!DeviceTC) {
889  if (TT.isNVPTX())
890  DeviceTC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CudaToolChain>(
891  *this, TT, *HostTC, C.getInputArgs(), Action::OFK_OpenMP);
892  else if (TT.isAMDGCN())
893  DeviceTC =
894  std::make_unique<toolchains::AMDGPUOpenMPToolChain>(
895  *this, TT, *HostTC, C.getInputArgs());
896  else
897  assert(DeviceTC && "Device toolchain not defined.");
898  }
899 
900  TC = DeviceTC.get();
901  } else
902  TC = &getToolChain(C.getInputArgs(), TT);
903  C.addOffloadDeviceToolChain(TC, Action::OFK_OpenMP);
904  }
905  }
906  } else
907  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_expecting_fopenmp_with_fopenmp_targets);
908  } else
909  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument)
910  << OpenMPTargets->getAsString(C.getInputArgs());
911  }
912 
913  //
914  // SYCL
915  //
916  // We need to generate a SYCL toolchain if the user specified targets with
917  // the -fsycl-targets, -fsycl-add-targets or -fsycl-link-targets option.
918  // If -fsycl is supplied without any of these we will assume SPIR-V.
919  // Use of -fsycl-device-only overrides -fsycl.
920  bool HasValidSYCLRuntime =
921  C.getInputArgs().hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl,
922  false) ||
923  C.getInputArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_only);
924 
925  // A mechanism for retrieving SYCL-specific options, erroring out
926  // if SYCL offloading wasn't enabled prior to that
927  auto getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime = [&](OptSpecifier OptId) -> Arg * {
928  Arg *SYCLArg = C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(OptId);
929  if (SYCLArg && !HasValidSYCLRuntime) {
930  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_expecting_fsycl_with_sycl_opt)
931  // Dropping the '=' symbol, which would otherwise pollute
932  // the diagnostics for the most of options
933  << SYCLArg->getSpelling().split('=').first;
934  return nullptr;
935  }
936  return SYCLArg;
937  };
938 
939  Arg *SYCLTargets = getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime(options::OPT_fsycl_targets_EQ);
940  Arg *SYCLLinkTargets =
941  getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime(options::OPT_fsycl_link_targets_EQ);
942  Arg *SYCLAddTargets =
943  getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime(options::OPT_fsycl_add_targets_EQ);
944  Arg *SYCLLink = getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ);
945  Arg *SYCLfpga = getArgRequiringSYCLRuntime(options::OPT_fintelfpga);
946 
947  // -fsycl-targets cannot be used with -fsycl-link-targets
948  if (SYCLTargets && SYCLLinkTargets)
949  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_option_conflict)
950  << SYCLTargets->getSpelling() << SYCLLinkTargets->getSpelling();
951  // -fsycl-link-targets and -fsycl-add-targets cannot be used together
952  if (SYCLLinkTargets && SYCLAddTargets)
953  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_option_conflict)
954  << SYCLLinkTargets->getSpelling() << SYCLAddTargets->getSpelling();
955  // -fsycl-link-targets is not allowed with -fsycl-link
956  if (SYCLLinkTargets && SYCLLink)
957  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_option_conflict)
958  << SYCLLink->getSpelling() << SYCLLinkTargets->getSpelling();
959  // -fsycl-targets cannot be used with -fintelfpga
960  if (SYCLTargets && SYCLfpga)
961  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_option_conflict)
962  << SYCLTargets->getSpelling() << SYCLfpga->getSpelling();
963 
964  auto argSYCLIncompatible = [&](OptSpecifier OptId) {
965  if (!HasValidSYCLRuntime)
966  return;
967  if (Arg *IncompatArg = C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(OptId))
968  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_fsycl_unsupported_with_opt)
969  << IncompatArg->getSpelling();
970  };
971  // -static-libstdc++ is not compatible with -fsycl.
972  argSYCLIncompatible(options::OPT_static_libstdcxx);
973  // -ffreestanding cannot be used with -fsycl
974  argSYCLIncompatible(options::OPT_ffreestanding);
975 
976  // Diagnose incorrect inputs to SYCL options.
977  // FIXME: Since the option definition includes the list of possible values,
978  // the validation must be automatic, not requiring separate disjointed code
979  // blocks accross the driver code. Long-term, the detection of incorrect
980  // values must happen at the level of TableGen and Arg class design, with
981  // Compilation/Driver class constructors handling the driver-specific
982  // diagnostic output.
983  auto checkSingleArgValidity = [&](Arg *A,
984  SmallVector<StringRef, 4> AllowedValues) {
985  if (!A)
986  return;
987  const char *ArgValue = A->getValue();
988  for (const StringRef AllowedValue : AllowedValues)
989  if (AllowedValue.equals(ArgValue))
990  return;
991  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_argument_to_option)
992  << ArgValue << A->getOption().getName();
993  };
994  checkSingleArgValidity(SYCLLink, {"early", "image"});
995  checkSingleArgValidity(
996  C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_code_split_EQ),
997  {"per_kernel", "per_source", "auto", "off"});
998 
999  bool HasSYCLTargetsOption = SYCLTargets || SYCLLinkTargets || SYCLAddTargets;
1000  llvm::StringMap<StringRef> FoundNormalizedTriples;
1001  llvm::SmallVector<llvm::Triple, 4> UniqueSYCLTriplesVec;
1002  if (HasSYCLTargetsOption) {
1003  // At this point, we know we have a valid combination
1004  // of -fsycl*target options passed
1005  Arg *SYCLTargetsValues = SYCLTargets ? SYCLTargets : SYCLLinkTargets;
1006  if (SYCLTargetsValues) {
1007  if (SYCLTargetsValues->getNumValues()) {
1008  for (StringRef Val : SYCLTargetsValues->getValues()) {
1009  llvm::Triple TT(MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(Val));
1010  if (!isValidSYCLTriple(TT)) {
1011  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_sycl_target) << Val;
1012  continue;
1013  }
1014  std::string NormalizedName = TT.normalize();
1015 
1016  // Make sure we don't have a duplicate triple.
1017  auto Duplicate = FoundNormalizedTriples.find(NormalizedName);
1018  if (Duplicate != FoundNormalizedTriples.end()) {
1019  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_sycl_offload_target_duplicate)
1020  << Val << Duplicate->second;
1021  continue;
1022  }
1023 
1024  // Warn about deprecated `sycldevice` environment component.
1025  if (TT.getEnvironmentName() == "sycldevice") {
1026  // Build a string with suggested target triple.
1027  std::string SuggestedTriple = TT.getArchName().str();
1028  if (TT.getOS() != llvm::Triple::UnknownOS) {
1029  SuggestedTriple += '-';
1030  if (TT.getVendor() != llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor)
1031  SuggestedTriple += TT.getVendorName();
1032  SuggestedTriple += Twine("-" + TT.getOSName()).str();
1033  } else if (TT.getVendor() != llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor)
1034  SuggestedTriple += Twine("-" + TT.getVendorName()).str();
1035  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_deprecated_arg)
1036  << TT.str() << SuggestedTriple;
1037  // Drop environment component.
1038  std::string EffectiveTriple =
1039  Twine(TT.getArchName() + "-" + TT.getVendorName() + "-" +
1040  TT.getOSName())
1041  .str();
1042  TT.setTriple(EffectiveTriple);
1043  }
1044 
1045  // Store the current triple so that we can check for duplicates in
1046  // the following iterations.
1047  FoundNormalizedTriples[NormalizedName] = Val;
1048  UniqueSYCLTriplesVec.push_back(TT);
1049  }
1050  addSYCLDefaultTriple(C, UniqueSYCLTriplesVec);
1051  } else
1052  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument)
1053  << SYCLTargetsValues->getAsString(C.getInputArgs());
1054  }
1055  // -fsycl-add-targets is a list of paired items (Triple and file) which are
1056  // gathered and used to be linked into the final device binary. This can
1057  // be used with -fsycl-targets to put together the final conglomerate binary
1058  if (SYCLAddTargets) {
1059  if (SYCLAddTargets->getNumValues()) {
1060  // Use of -fsycl-add-targets adds additional files to the SYCL device
1061  // link step. Regular offload processing occurs below
1062  for (StringRef Val : SYCLAddTargets->getValues()) {
1063  // Parse out the Triple and Input (triple:binary) and create a
1064  // ToolChain for each entry.
1065  // The expected format is 'triple:file', any other format will
1066  // not be accepted.
1067  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> I = Val.split(':');
1068  if (!I.first.empty() && !I.second.empty()) {
1069  llvm::Triple TT(I.first);
1070  if (!isValidSYCLTriple(TT)) {
1071  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_sycl_target) << I.first;
1072  continue;
1073  }
1074  std::string NormalizedName = TT.normalize();
1075 
1076  // Make sure we don't have a duplicate triple.
1077  auto Duplicate = FoundNormalizedTriples.find(NormalizedName);
1078  if (Duplicate != FoundNormalizedTriples.end())
1079  // The toolchain for this triple was already created
1080  continue;
1081 
1082  // Store the current triple so that we can check for duplicates in
1083  // the following iterations.
1084  FoundNormalizedTriples[NormalizedName] = Val;
1085  UniqueSYCLTriplesVec.push_back(TT);
1086  } else {
1087  // No colon found, do not use the input
1088  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument)
1089  << SYCLAddTargets->getOption().getName() << Val;
1090  }
1091  }
1092  } else
1093  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument)
1094  << SYCLAddTargets->getAsString(C.getInputArgs());
1095  }
1096  } else {
1097  // If -fsycl is supplied without -fsycl-*targets we will assume SPIR-V
1098  // unless -fintelfpga is supplied, which uses SPIR-V with fpga AOT.
1099  // For -fsycl-device-only, we also setup the implied triple as needed.
1100  if (HasValidSYCLRuntime) {
1101  StringRef SYCLTargetArch = getDefaultSYCLArch(C);
1102  if (SYCLfpga)
1103  // Triple for -fintelfpga is spir64_fpga.
1104  SYCLTargetArch = "spir64_fpga";
1105  UniqueSYCLTriplesVec.push_back(MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(SYCLTargetArch));
1106  addSYCLDefaultTriple(C, UniqueSYCLTriplesVec);
1107  }
1108  }
1109  // We'll need to use the SYCL and host triples as the key into
1110  // getOffloadingDeviceToolChain, because the device toolchains we're
1111  // going to create will depend on both.
1112  const ToolChain *HostTC = C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>();
1113  for (auto &TT : UniqueSYCLTriplesVec) {
1114  auto SYCLTC = &getOffloadingDeviceToolChain(C.getInputArgs(), TT, *HostTC,
1115  Action::OFK_SYCL);
1116  C.addOffloadDeviceToolChain(SYCLTC, Action::OFK_SYCL);
1117  }
1118 
1119  //
1120  // TODO: Add support for other offloading programming models here.
1121  //
1122 }
1123 
1124 /// Looks the given directories for the specified file.
1125 ///
1126 /// \param[out] FilePath File path, if the file was found.
1127 /// \param[in] Dirs Directories used for the search.
1128 /// \param[in] FileName Name of the file to search for.
1129 /// \return True if file was found.
1130 ///
1131 /// Looks for file specified by FileName sequentially in directories specified
1132 /// by Dirs.
1133 ///
1134 static bool searchForFile(SmallVectorImpl<char> &FilePath,
1135  ArrayRef<StringRef> Dirs, StringRef FileName) {
1136  SmallString<128> WPath;
1137  for (const StringRef &Dir : Dirs) {
1138  if (Dir.empty())
1139  continue;
1140  WPath.clear();
1141  llvm::sys::path::append(WPath, Dir, FileName);
1142  llvm::sys::path::native(WPath);
1143  if (llvm::sys::fs::is_regular_file(WPath)) {
1144  FilePath = std::move(WPath);
1145  return true;
1146  }
1147  }
1148  return false;
1149 }
1150 
1151 bool Driver::readConfigFile(StringRef FileName) {
1152  // Try reading the given file.
1153  SmallVector<const char *, 32> NewCfgArgs;
1154  if (!llvm::cl::readConfigFile(FileName, Saver, NewCfgArgs)) {
1155  Diag(diag::err_drv_cannot_read_config_file) << FileName;
1156  return true;
1157  }
1158 
1159  // Read options from config file.
1160  llvm::SmallString<128> CfgFileName(FileName);
1161  llvm::sys::path::native(CfgFileName);
1162  ConfigFile = std::string(CfgFileName);
1163  bool ContainErrors;
1164  CfgOptions = std::make_unique<InputArgList>(
1165  ParseArgStrings(NewCfgArgs, IsCLMode(), ContainErrors));
1166  if (ContainErrors) {
1167  CfgOptions.reset();
1168  return true;
1169  }
1170 
1171  if (CfgOptions->hasArg(options::OPT_config)) {
1172  CfgOptions.reset();
1173  Diag(diag::err_drv_nested_config_file);
1174  return true;
1175  }
1176 
1177  // Claim all arguments that come from a configuration file so that the driver
1178  // does not warn on any that is unused.
1179  for (Arg *A : *CfgOptions)
1180  A->claim();
1181  return false;
1182 }
1183 
1184 bool Driver::loadConfigFile() {
1185  std::string CfgFileName;
1186  bool FileSpecifiedExplicitly = false;
1187 
1188  // Process options that change search path for config files.
1189  if (CLOptions) {
1190  if (CLOptions->hasArg(options::OPT_config_system_dir_EQ)) {
1191  SmallString<128> CfgDir;
1192  CfgDir.append(
1193  CLOptions->getLastArgValue(options::OPT_config_system_dir_EQ));
1194  if (!CfgDir.empty()) {
1195  if (llvm::sys::fs::make_absolute(CfgDir).value() != 0)
1196  SystemConfigDir.clear();
1197  else
1198  SystemConfigDir = std::string(CfgDir.begin(), CfgDir.end());
1199  }
1200  }
1201  if (CLOptions->hasArg(options::OPT_config_user_dir_EQ)) {
1202  SmallString<128> CfgDir;
1203  CfgDir.append(
1204  CLOptions->getLastArgValue(options::OPT_config_user_dir_EQ));
1205  if (!CfgDir.empty()) {
1206  if (llvm::sys::fs::make_absolute(CfgDir).value() != 0)
1207  UserConfigDir.clear();
1208  else
1209  UserConfigDir = std::string(CfgDir.begin(), CfgDir.end());
1210  }
1211  }
1212  }
1213 
1214  // First try to find config file specified in command line.
1215  if (CLOptions) {
1216  std::vector<std::string> ConfigFiles =
1217  CLOptions->getAllArgValues(options::OPT_config);
1218  if (ConfigFiles.size() > 1) {
1219  if (!llvm::all_of(ConfigFiles, [ConfigFiles](const std::string &s) {
1220  return s == ConfigFiles[0];
1221  })) {
1222  Diag(diag::err_drv_duplicate_config);
1223  return true;
1224  }
1225  }
1226 
1227  if (!ConfigFiles.empty()) {
1228  CfgFileName = ConfigFiles.front();
1229  assert(!CfgFileName.empty());
1230 
1231  // If argument contains directory separator, treat it as a path to
1232  // configuration file.
1233  if (llvm::sys::path::has_parent_path(CfgFileName)) {
1234  SmallString<128> CfgFilePath;
1235  if (llvm::sys::path::is_relative(CfgFileName))
1236  llvm::sys::fs::current_path(CfgFilePath);
1237  llvm::sys::path::append(CfgFilePath, CfgFileName);
1238  if (!llvm::sys::fs::is_regular_file(CfgFilePath)) {
1239  Diag(diag::err_drv_config_file_not_exist) << CfgFilePath;
1240  return true;
1241  }
1242  return readConfigFile(CfgFilePath);
1243  }
1244 
1245  FileSpecifiedExplicitly = true;
1246  }
1247  }
1248 
1249  // If config file is not specified explicitly, try to deduce configuration
1250  // from executable name. For instance, an executable 'armv7l-clang' will
1251  // search for config file 'armv7l-clang.cfg'.
1252  if (CfgFileName.empty() && !ClangNameParts.TargetPrefix.empty())
1253  CfgFileName = ClangNameParts.TargetPrefix + '-' + ClangNameParts.ModeSuffix;
1254 
1255  if (CfgFileName.empty())
1256  return false;
1257 
1258  // Determine architecture part of the file name, if it is present.
1259  StringRef CfgFileArch = CfgFileName;
1260  size_t ArchPrefixLen = CfgFileArch.find('-');
1261  if (ArchPrefixLen == StringRef::npos)
1262  ArchPrefixLen = CfgFileArch.size();
1263  llvm::Triple CfgTriple;
1264  CfgFileArch = CfgFileArch.take_front(ArchPrefixLen);
1265  CfgTriple = llvm::Triple(llvm::Triple::normalize(CfgFileArch));
1266  if (CfgTriple.getArch() == llvm::Triple::ArchType::UnknownArch)
1267  ArchPrefixLen = 0;
1268 
1269  if (!StringRef(CfgFileName).endswith(".cfg"))
1270  CfgFileName += ".cfg";
1271 
1272  // If config file starts with architecture name and command line options
1273  // redefine architecture (with options like -m32 -LE etc), try finding new
1274  // config file with that architecture.
1275  SmallString<128> FixedConfigFile;
1276  size_t FixedArchPrefixLen = 0;
1277  if (ArchPrefixLen) {
1278  // Get architecture name from config file name like 'i386.cfg' or
1279  // 'armv7l-clang.cfg'.
1280  // Check if command line options changes effective triple.
1281  llvm::Triple EffectiveTriple = computeTargetTriple(*this,
1282  CfgTriple.getTriple(), *CLOptions);
1283  if (CfgTriple.getArch() != EffectiveTriple.getArch()) {
1284  FixedConfigFile = EffectiveTriple.getArchName();
1285  FixedArchPrefixLen = FixedConfigFile.size();
1286  // Append the rest of original file name so that file name transforms
1287  // like: i386-clang.cfg -> x86_64-clang.cfg.
1288  if (ArchPrefixLen < CfgFileName.size())
1289  FixedConfigFile += CfgFileName.substr(ArchPrefixLen);
1290  }
1291  }
1292 
1293  // Prepare list of directories where config file is searched for.
1294  StringRef CfgFileSearchDirs[] = {UserConfigDir, SystemConfigDir, Dir};
1295 
1296  // Try to find config file. First try file with corrected architecture.
1297  llvm::SmallString<128> CfgFilePath;
1298  if (!FixedConfigFile.empty()) {
1299  if (searchForFile(CfgFilePath, CfgFileSearchDirs, FixedConfigFile))
1300  return readConfigFile(CfgFilePath);
1301  // If 'x86_64-clang.cfg' was not found, try 'x86_64.cfg'.
1302  FixedConfigFile.resize(FixedArchPrefixLen);
1303  FixedConfigFile.append(".cfg");
1304  if (searchForFile(CfgFilePath, CfgFileSearchDirs, FixedConfigFile))
1305  return readConfigFile(CfgFilePath);
1306  }
1307 
1308  // Then try original file name.
1309  if (searchForFile(CfgFilePath, CfgFileSearchDirs, CfgFileName))
1310  return readConfigFile(CfgFilePath);
1311 
1312  // Finally try removing driver mode part: 'x86_64-clang.cfg' -> 'x86_64.cfg'.
1313  if (!ClangNameParts.ModeSuffix.empty() &&
1314  !ClangNameParts.TargetPrefix.empty()) {
1315  CfgFileName.assign(ClangNameParts.TargetPrefix);
1316  CfgFileName.append(".cfg");
1317  if (searchForFile(CfgFilePath, CfgFileSearchDirs, CfgFileName))
1318  return readConfigFile(CfgFilePath);
1319  }
1320 
1321  // Report error but only if config file was specified explicitly, by option
1322  // --config. If it was deduced from executable name, it is not an error.
1323  if (FileSpecifiedExplicitly) {
1324  Diag(diag::err_drv_config_file_not_found) << CfgFileName;
1325  for (const StringRef &SearchDir : CfgFileSearchDirs)
1326  if (!SearchDir.empty())
1327  Diag(diag::note_drv_config_file_searched_in) << SearchDir;
1328  return true;
1329  }
1330 
1331  return false;
1332 }
1333 
1334 Compilation *Driver::BuildCompilation(ArrayRef<const char *> ArgList) {
1335  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Compilation construction");
1336 
1337  // FIXME: Handle environment options which affect driver behavior, somewhere
1338  // (client?). GCC_EXEC_PREFIX, LPATH, CC_PRINT_OPTIONS.
1339 
1340  // We look for the driver mode option early, because the mode can affect
1341  // how other options are parsed.
1342 
1343  auto DriverMode = getDriverMode(ClangExecutable, ArgList.slice(1));
1344  if (!DriverMode.empty())
1345  setDriverMode(DriverMode);
1346 
1347  // FIXME: What are we going to do with -V and -b?
1348 
1349  // Arguments specified in command line.
1350  bool ContainsError;
1351  CLOptions = std::make_unique<InputArgList>(
1352  ParseArgStrings(ArgList.slice(1), IsCLMode(), ContainsError));
1353 
1354  // Try parsing configuration file.
1355  if (!ContainsError)
1356  ContainsError = loadConfigFile();
1357  bool HasConfigFile = !ContainsError && (CfgOptions.get() != nullptr);
1358 
1359  // All arguments, from both config file and command line.
1360  InputArgList Args = std::move(HasConfigFile ? std::move(*CfgOptions)
1361  : std::move(*CLOptions));
1362 
1363  // The args for config files or /clang: flags belong to different InputArgList
1364  // objects than Args. This copies an Arg from one of those other InputArgLists
1365  // to the ownership of Args.
1366  auto appendOneArg = [&Args](const Arg *Opt, const Arg *BaseArg) {
1367  unsigned Index = Args.MakeIndex(Opt->getSpelling());
1368  Arg *Copy = new llvm::opt::Arg(Opt->getOption(), Args.getArgString(Index),
1369  Index, BaseArg);
1370  Copy->getValues() = Opt->getValues();
1371  if (Opt->isClaimed())
1372  Copy->claim();
1373  Copy->setOwnsValues(Opt->getOwnsValues());
1374  Opt->setOwnsValues(false);
1375  Args.append(Copy);
1376  };
1377 
1378  if (HasConfigFile)
1379  for (auto *Opt : *CLOptions) {
1380  if (Opt->getOption().matches(options::OPT_config))
1381  continue;
1382  const Arg *BaseArg = &Opt->getBaseArg();
1383  if (BaseArg == Opt)
1384  BaseArg = nullptr;
1385  appendOneArg(Opt, BaseArg);
1386  }
1387 
1388  // In CL mode, look for any pass-through arguments
1389  if (IsCLMode() && !ContainsError) {
1390  SmallVector<const char *, 16> CLModePassThroughArgList;
1391  for (const auto *A : Args.filtered(options::OPT__SLASH_clang)) {
1392  A->claim();
1393  CLModePassThroughArgList.push_back(A->getValue());
1394  }
1395 
1396  if (!CLModePassThroughArgList.empty()) {
1397  // Parse any pass through args using default clang processing rather
1398  // than clang-cl processing.
1399  auto CLModePassThroughOptions = std::make_unique<InputArgList>(
1400  ParseArgStrings(CLModePassThroughArgList, false, ContainsError));
1401 
1402  if (!ContainsError)
1403  for (auto *Opt : *CLModePassThroughOptions) {
1404  appendOneArg(Opt, nullptr);
1405  }
1406  }
1407  }
1408 
1409  // Check for working directory option before accessing any files
1410  if (Arg *WD = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_working_directory))
1411  if (VFS->setCurrentWorkingDirectory(WD->getValue()))
1412  Diag(diag::err_drv_unable_to_set_working_directory) << WD->getValue();
1413 
1414  // FIXME: This stuff needs to go into the Compilation, not the driver.
1415  bool CCCPrintPhases;
1416 
1417  // Silence driver warnings if requested
1418  Diags.setIgnoreAllWarnings(Args.hasArg(options::OPT_w));
1419 
1420  // -canonical-prefixes, -no-canonical-prefixes are used very early in main.
1421  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_canonical_prefixes);
1422  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_no_canonical_prefixes);
1423 
1424  // f(no-)integated-cc1 is also used very early in main.
1425  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_fintegrated_cc1);
1426  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_fno_integrated_cc1);
1427 
1428  // Ignore -pipe.
1429  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_pipe);
1430 
1431  // Extract -ccc args.
1432  //
1433  // FIXME: We need to figure out where this behavior should live. Most of it
1434  // should be outside in the client; the parts that aren't should have proper
1435  // options, either by introducing new ones or by overloading gcc ones like -V
1436  // or -b.
1437  CCCPrintPhases = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_ccc_print_phases);
1438  CCCPrintBindings = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_ccc_print_bindings);
1439  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_ccc_gcc_name))
1440  CCCGenericGCCName = A->getValue();
1441  GenReproducer = Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_gen_reproducer,
1442  options::OPT_fno_crash_diagnostics,
1443  !!::getenv("FORCE_CLANG_DIAGNOSTICS_CRASH"));
1444 
1445  // Process -fproc-stat-report options.
1446  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fproc_stat_report_EQ)) {
1447  CCPrintProcessStats = true;
1448  CCPrintStatReportFilename = A->getValue();
1449  }
1450  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fproc_stat_report))
1451  CCPrintProcessStats = true;
1452 
1453  // FIXME: TargetTriple is used by the target-prefixed calls to as/ld
1454  // and getToolChain is const.
1455  if (IsCLMode()) {
1456  // clang-cl targets MSVC-style Win32.
1457  llvm::Triple T(TargetTriple);
1458  T.setOS(llvm::Triple::Win32);
1459  T.setVendor(llvm::Triple::PC);
1460  T.setEnvironment(llvm::Triple::MSVC);
1461  T.setObjectFormat(llvm::Triple::COFF);
1462  TargetTriple = T.str();
1463  }
1464  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_target))
1465  TargetTriple = A->getValue();
1466  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_ccc_install_dir))
1467  Dir = InstalledDir = A->getValue();
1468  for (const Arg *A : Args.filtered(options::OPT_B)) {
1469  A->claim();
1470  PrefixDirs.push_back(A->getValue(0));
1471  }
1472  if (Optional<std::string> CompilerPathValue =
1473  llvm::sys::Process::GetEnv("COMPILER_PATH")) {
1474  StringRef CompilerPath = *CompilerPathValue;
1475  while (!CompilerPath.empty()) {
1476  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> Split =
1477  CompilerPath.split(llvm::sys::EnvPathSeparator);
1478  PrefixDirs.push_back(std::string(Split.first));
1479  CompilerPath = Split.second;
1480  }
1481  }
1482  if (const Arg *A =
1483  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__overlay_platform_toolchain_EQ)) {
1484  OverlayToolChainPath = A->getValue();
1485  DyldPrefix = A->getValue();
1486  }
1487  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__sysroot_EQ))
1488  SysRoot = A->getValue();
1489  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__dyld_prefix_EQ))
1490  DyldPrefix = A->getValue();
1491 
1492  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_resource_dir))
1493  ResourceDir = A->getValue();
1494 
1495  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_save_temps_EQ)) {
1496  SaveTemps = llvm::StringSwitch<SaveTempsMode>(A->getValue())
1497  .Case("cwd", SaveTempsCwd)
1498  .Case("obj", SaveTempsObj)
1499  .Default(SaveTempsCwd);
1500  }
1501 
1502  setLTOMode(Args);
1503 
1504  // Process -fembed-bitcode= flags.
1505  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fembed_bitcode_EQ)) {
1506  StringRef Name = A->getValue();
1507  unsigned Model = llvm::StringSwitch<unsigned>(Name)
1508  .Case("off", EmbedNone)
1509  .Case("all", EmbedBitcode)
1510  .Case("bitcode", EmbedBitcode)
1511  .Case("marker", EmbedMarker)
1512  .Default(~0U);
1513  if (Model == ~0U) {
1514  Diags.Report(diag::err_drv_invalid_value) << A->getAsString(Args)
1515  << Name;
1516  } else
1517  BitcodeEmbed = static_cast<BitcodeEmbedMode>(Model);
1518  }
1519 
1520  std::unique_ptr<llvm::opt::InputArgList> UArgs =
1521  std::make_unique<InputArgList>(std::move(Args));
1522 
1523  // Perform the default argument translations.
1524  DerivedArgList *TranslatedArgs = TranslateInputArgs(*UArgs);
1525 
1526  // Owned by the host.
1527  const ToolChain &TC = getToolChain(
1528  *UArgs, computeTargetTriple(*this, TargetTriple, *UArgs));
1529 
1530  // The compilation takes ownership of Args.
1531  Compilation *C = new Compilation(*this, TC, UArgs.release(), TranslatedArgs,
1532  ContainsError);
1533 
1534  if (!HandleImmediateArgs(*C))
1535  return C;
1536 
1537  // Construct the list of inputs.
1538  InputList Inputs;
1539  BuildInputs(C->getDefaultToolChain(), *TranslatedArgs, Inputs);
1540 
1541  // Determine if there are any offload static libraries.
1542  if (checkForOffloadStaticLib(*C, *TranslatedArgs))
1543  setOffloadStaticLibSeen();
1544 
1545  // Check for any objects/archives that need to be compiled with the default
1546  // triple.
1547  if (checkForSYCLDefaultDevice(*C, *TranslatedArgs))
1548  setSYCLDefaultTriple(true);
1549 
1550  // Populate the tool chains for the offloading devices, if any.
1551  CreateOffloadingDeviceToolChains(*C, Inputs);
1552 
1553  // Determine FPGA emulation status.
1554  if (C->hasOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_SYCL>()) {
1555  auto SYCLTCRange = C->getOffloadToolChains<Action::OFK_SYCL>();
1556  for (auto TI = SYCLTCRange.first, TE = SYCLTCRange.second; TI != TE; ++TI) {
1557  if (TI->second->getTriple().getSubArch() !=
1558  llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga)
1559  continue;
1560  ArgStringList TargetArgs;
1561  const toolchains::SYCLToolChain *FPGATC =
1562  static_cast<const toolchains::SYCLToolChain *>(TI->second);
1563  FPGATC->TranslateBackendTargetArgs(FPGATC->getTriple(), *TranslatedArgs,
1564  TargetArgs);
1565  for (StringRef ArgString : TargetArgs) {
1566  if (ArgString.equals("-hardware") || ArgString.equals("-simulation")) {
1567  setFPGAEmulationMode(false);
1568  break;
1569  }
1570  }
1571  break;
1572  }
1573  }
1574 
1575  // Construct the list of abstract actions to perform for this compilation. On
1576  // MachO targets this uses the driver-driver and universal actions.
1577  if (TC.getTriple().isOSBinFormatMachO())
1578  BuildUniversalActions(*C, C->getDefaultToolChain(), Inputs);
1579  else
1580  BuildActions(*C, C->getArgs(), Inputs, C->getActions());
1581 
1582  if (CCCPrintPhases) {
1583  PrintActions(*C);
1584  return C;
1585  }
1586 
1587  BuildJobs(*C);
1588 
1589  return C;
1590 }
1591 
1592 static void printArgList(raw_ostream &OS, const llvm::opt::ArgList &Args) {
1593  llvm::opt::ArgStringList ASL;
1594  for (const auto *A : Args) {
1595  // Use user's original spelling of flags. For example, use
1596  // `/source-charset:utf-8` instead of `-finput-charset=utf-8` if the user
1597  // wrote the former.
1598  while (A->getAlias())
1599  A = A->getAlias();
1600  A->render(Args, ASL);
1601  }
1602 
1603  for (auto I = ASL.begin(), E = ASL.end(); I != E; ++I) {
1604  if (I != ASL.begin())
1605  OS << ' ';
1606  llvm::sys::printArg(OS, *I, true);
1607  }
1608  OS << '\n';
1609 }
1610 
1611 bool Driver::getCrashDiagnosticFile(StringRef ReproCrashFilename,
1612  SmallString<128> &CrashDiagDir) {
1613  using namespace llvm::sys;
1614  assert(llvm::Triple(llvm::sys::getProcessTriple()).isOSDarwin() &&
1615  "Only knows about .crash files on Darwin");
1616 
1617  // The .crash file can be found on at ~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/
1618  // (or /Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports for root) and has the filename pattern
1619  // clang-<VERSION>_<YYYY-MM-DD-HHMMSS>_<hostname>.crash.
1620  path::home_directory(CrashDiagDir);
1621  if (CrashDiagDir.startswith("/var/root"))
1622  CrashDiagDir = "/";
1623  path::append(CrashDiagDir, "Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports");
1624  int PID =
1625 #if LLVM_ON_UNIX
1626  getpid();
1627 #else
1628  0;
1629 #endif
1630  std::error_code EC;
1631  fs::file_status FileStatus;
1632  TimePoint<> LastAccessTime;
1633  SmallString<128> CrashFilePath;
1634  // Lookup the .crash files and get the one generated by a subprocess spawned
1635  // by this driver invocation.
1636  for (fs::directory_iterator File(CrashDiagDir, EC), FileEnd;
1637  File != FileEnd && !EC; File.increment(EC)) {
1638  StringRef FileName = path::filename(File->path());
1639  if (!FileName.startswith(Name))
1640  continue;
1641  if (fs::status(File->path(), FileStatus))
1642  continue;
1643  llvm::ErrorOr<std::unique_ptr<llvm::MemoryBuffer>> CrashFile =
1644  llvm::MemoryBuffer::getFile(File->path());
1645  if (!CrashFile)
1646  continue;
1647  // The first line should start with "Process:", otherwise this isn't a real
1648  // .crash file.
1649  StringRef Data = CrashFile.get()->getBuffer();
1650  if (!Data.startswith("Process:"))
1651  continue;
1652  // Parse parent process pid line, e.g: "Parent Process: clang-4.0 [79141]"
1653  size_t ParentProcPos = Data.find("Parent Process:");
1654  if (ParentProcPos == StringRef::npos)
1655  continue;
1656  size_t LineEnd = Data.find_first_of("\n", ParentProcPos);
1657  if (LineEnd == StringRef::npos)
1658  continue;
1659  StringRef ParentProcess = Data.slice(ParentProcPos+15, LineEnd).trim();
1660  int OpenBracket = -1, CloseBracket = -1;
1661  for (size_t i = 0, e = ParentProcess.size(); i < e; ++i) {
1662  if (ParentProcess[i] == '[')
1663  OpenBracket = i;
1664  if (ParentProcess[i] == ']')
1665  CloseBracket = i;
1666  }
1667  // Extract the parent process PID from the .crash file and check whether
1668  // it matches this driver invocation pid.
1669  int CrashPID;
1670  if (OpenBracket < 0 || CloseBracket < 0 ||
1671  ParentProcess.slice(OpenBracket + 1, CloseBracket)
1672  .getAsInteger(10, CrashPID) || CrashPID != PID) {
1673  continue;
1674  }
1675 
1676  // Found a .crash file matching the driver pid. To avoid getting an older
1677  // and misleading crash file, continue looking for the most recent.
1678  // FIXME: the driver can dispatch multiple cc1 invocations, leading to
1679  // multiple crashes poiting to the same parent process. Since the driver
1680  // does not collect pid information for the dispatched invocation there's
1681  // currently no way to distinguish among them.
1682  const auto FileAccessTime = FileStatus.getLastModificationTime();
1683  if (FileAccessTime > LastAccessTime) {
1684  CrashFilePath.assign(File->path());
1685  LastAccessTime = FileAccessTime;
1686  }
1687  }
1688 
1689  // If found, copy it over to the location of other reproducer files.
1690  if (!CrashFilePath.empty()) {
1691  EC = fs::copy_file(CrashFilePath, ReproCrashFilename);
1692  if (EC)
1693  return false;
1694  return true;
1695  }
1696 
1697  return false;
1698 }
1699 
1700 // When clang crashes, produce diagnostic information including the fully
1701 // preprocessed source file(s). Request that the developer attach the
1702 // diagnostic information to a bug report.
1703 void Driver::generateCompilationDiagnostics(
1704  Compilation &C, const Command &FailingCommand,
1705  StringRef AdditionalInformation, CompilationDiagnosticReport *Report) {
1706  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fno_crash_diagnostics))
1707  return;
1708 
1709  // Don't try to generate diagnostics for link or dsymutil jobs.
1710  if (FailingCommand.getCreator().isLinkJob() ||
1711  FailingCommand.getCreator().isDsymutilJob())
1712  return;
1713 
1714  // Print the version of the compiler.
1715  PrintVersion(C, llvm::errs());
1716 
1717  // Suppress driver output and emit preprocessor output to temp file.
1718  CCGenDiagnostics = true;
1719 
1720  // Save the original job command(s).
1721  Command Cmd = FailingCommand;
1722 
1723  // Keep track of whether we produce any errors while trying to produce
1724  // preprocessed sources.
1725  DiagnosticErrorTrap Trap(Diags);
1726 
1727  // Suppress tool output.
1728  C.initCompilationForDiagnostics();
1729 
1730  // Construct the list of inputs.
1731  InputList Inputs;
1732  BuildInputs(C.getDefaultToolChain(), C.getArgs(), Inputs);
1733 
1734  for (InputList::iterator it = Inputs.begin(), ie = Inputs.end(); it != ie;) {
1735  bool IgnoreInput = false;
1736 
1737  // Ignore input from stdin or any inputs that cannot be preprocessed.
1738  // Check type first as not all linker inputs have a value.
1739  if (types::getPreprocessedType(it->first) == types::TY_INVALID) {
1740  IgnoreInput = true;
1741  } else if (!strcmp(it->second->getValue(), "-")) {
1742  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1743  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s) - "
1744  "ignoring input from stdin.";
1745  IgnoreInput = true;
1746  }
1747 
1748  if (IgnoreInput) {
1749  it = Inputs.erase(it);
1750  ie = Inputs.end();
1751  } else {
1752  ++it;
1753  }
1754  }
1755 
1756  if (Inputs.empty()) {
1757  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1758  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s) - "
1759  "no preprocessable inputs.";
1760  return;
1761  }
1762 
1763  // Don't attempt to generate preprocessed files if multiple -arch options are
1764  // used, unless they're all duplicates.
1765  llvm::StringSet<> ArchNames;
1766  for (const Arg *A : C.getArgs()) {
1767  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_arch)) {
1768  StringRef ArchName = A->getValue();
1769  ArchNames.insert(ArchName);
1770  }
1771  }
1772  if (ArchNames.size() > 1) {
1773  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1774  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s) - cannot generate "
1775  "preprocessed source with multiple -arch options.";
1776  return;
1777  }
1778 
1779  // Construct the list of abstract actions to perform for this compilation. On
1780  // Darwin OSes this uses the driver-driver and builds universal actions.
1781  const ToolChain &TC = C.getDefaultToolChain();
1782  if (TC.getTriple().isOSBinFormatMachO())
1783  BuildUniversalActions(C, TC, Inputs);
1784  else
1785  BuildActions(C, C.getArgs(), Inputs, C.getActions());
1786 
1787  BuildJobs(C);
1788 
1789  // If there were errors building the compilation, quit now.
1790  if (Trap.hasErrorOccurred()) {
1791  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1792  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s).";
1793  return;
1794  }
1795 
1796  // Generate preprocessed output.
1797  SmallVector<std::pair<int, const Command *>, 4> FailingCommands;
1798  C.ExecuteJobs(C.getJobs(), FailingCommands);
1799 
1800  // If any of the preprocessing commands failed, clean up and exit.
1801  if (!FailingCommands.empty()) {
1802  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1803  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s).";
1804  return;
1805  }
1806 
1807  const TempFileList &TempFiles = C.getTempFiles();
1808  if (TempFiles.empty()) {
1809  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1810  << "Error generating preprocessed source(s).";
1811  return;
1812  }
1813 
1814  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1815  << "\n********************\n\n"
1816  "PLEASE ATTACH THE FOLLOWING FILES TO THE BUG REPORT:\n"
1817  "Preprocessed source(s) and associated run script(s) are located at:";
1818 
1819  SmallString<128> VFS;
1820  SmallString<128> ReproCrashFilename;
1821  for (auto &TempFile : TempFiles) {
1822  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg) << TempFile.first;
1823  if (Report)
1824  Report->TemporaryFiles.push_back(TempFile.first);
1825  if (ReproCrashFilename.empty()) {
1826  ReproCrashFilename = TempFile.first;
1827  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(ReproCrashFilename, ".crash");
1828  }
1829  if (StringRef(TempFile.first).endswith(".cache")) {
1830  // In some cases (modules) we'll dump extra data to help with reproducing
1831  // the crash into a directory next to the output.
1832  VFS = llvm::sys::path::filename(TempFile.first);
1833  llvm::sys::path::append(VFS, "vfs", "vfs.yaml");
1834  }
1835  }
1836 
1837  // Assume associated files are based off of the first temporary file.
1838  CrashReportInfo CrashInfo(TempFiles[0].first, VFS);
1839 
1840  llvm::SmallString<128> Script(CrashInfo.Filename);
1841  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(Script, "sh");
1842  std::error_code EC;
1843  llvm::raw_fd_ostream ScriptOS(Script, EC, llvm::sys::fs::CD_CreateNew,
1844  llvm::sys::fs::FA_Write,
1845  llvm::sys::fs::OF_Text);
1846  if (EC) {
1847  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1848  << "Error generating run script: " << Script << " " << EC.message();
1849  } else {
1850  ScriptOS << "# Crash reproducer for " << getClangFullVersion() << "\n"
1851  << "# Driver args: ";
1852  printArgList(ScriptOS, C.getInputArgs());
1853  ScriptOS << "# Original command: ";
1854  Cmd.Print(ScriptOS, "\n", /*Quote=*/true);
1855  Cmd.Print(ScriptOS, "\n", /*Quote=*/true, &CrashInfo);
1856  if (!AdditionalInformation.empty())
1857  ScriptOS << "\n# Additional information: " << AdditionalInformation
1858  << "\n";
1859  if (Report)
1860  Report->TemporaryFiles.push_back(std::string(Script.str()));
1861  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg) << Script;
1862  }
1863 
1864  // On darwin, provide information about the .crash diagnostic report.
1865  if (llvm::Triple(llvm::sys::getProcessTriple()).isOSDarwin()) {
1866  SmallString<128> CrashDiagDir;
1867  if (getCrashDiagnosticFile(ReproCrashFilename, CrashDiagDir)) {
1868  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1869  << ReproCrashFilename.str();
1870  } else { // Suggest a directory for the user to look for .crash files.
1871  llvm::sys::path::append(CrashDiagDir, Name);
1872  CrashDiagDir += "_<YYYY-MM-DD-HHMMSS>_<hostname>.crash";
1873  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1874  << "Crash backtrace is located in";
1875  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1876  << CrashDiagDir.str();
1877  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1878  << "(choose the .crash file that corresponds to your crash)";
1879  }
1880  }
1881 
1882  for (const auto &A : C.getArgs().filtered(options::OPT_frewrite_map_file_EQ))
1883  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg) << A->getValue();
1884 
1885  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg)
1886  << "\n\n********************";
1887 }
1888 
1889 void Driver::setUpResponseFiles(Compilation &C, Command &Cmd) {
1890  // Since commandLineFitsWithinSystemLimits() may underestimate system's
1891  // capacity if the tool does not support response files, there is a chance/
1892  // that things will just work without a response file, so we silently just
1893  // skip it.
1894  if (Cmd.getResponseFileSupport().ResponseKind ==
1895  ResponseFileSupport::RF_None ||
1896  llvm::sys::commandLineFitsWithinSystemLimits(Cmd.getExecutable(),
1897  Cmd.getArguments()))
1898  return;
1899 
1900  std::string TmpName = GetTemporaryPath("response", "txt");
1901  Cmd.setResponseFile(C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpName)));
1902 }
1903 
1904 int Driver::ExecuteCompilation(
1905  Compilation &C,
1906  SmallVectorImpl<std::pair<int, const Command *>> &FailingCommands) {
1907  // Just print if -### was present.
1908  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__HASH_HASH_HASH)) {
1909  C.getJobs().Print(llvm::errs(), "\n", true);
1910  return 0;
1911  }
1912 
1913  // If there were errors building the compilation, quit now.
1914  if (Diags.hasErrorOccurred())
1915  return 1;
1916 
1917  // Set up response file names for each command, if necessary.
1918  for (auto &Job : C.getJobs())
1919  setUpResponseFiles(C, Job);
1920 
1921  C.ExecuteJobs(C.getJobs(), FailingCommands);
1922 
1923  // If the command succeeded, we are done.
1924  if (FailingCommands.empty())
1925  return 0;
1926 
1927  // Otherwise, remove result files and print extra information about abnormal
1928  // failures.
1929  int Res = 0;
1930  for (const auto &CmdPair : FailingCommands) {
1931  int CommandRes = CmdPair.first;
1932  const Command *FailingCommand = CmdPair.second;
1933 
1934  // Remove result files if we're not saving temps.
1935  if (!isSaveTempsEnabled()) {
1936  const JobAction *JA = cast<JobAction>(&FailingCommand->getSource());
1937  C.CleanupFileMap(C.getResultFiles(), JA, true);
1938 
1939  // Failure result files are valid unless we crashed.
1940  if (CommandRes < 0)
1941  C.CleanupFileMap(C.getFailureResultFiles(), JA, true);
1942  }
1943 
1944 #if LLVM_ON_UNIX
1945  // llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc will exit with a special return code
1946  // for SIGPIPE. Do not print diagnostics for this case.
1947  if (CommandRes == EX_IOERR) {
1948  Res = CommandRes;
1949  continue;
1950  }
1951 #endif
1952 
1953  // Print extra information about abnormal failures, if possible.
1954  //
1955  // This is ad-hoc, but we don't want to be excessively noisy. If the result
1956  // status was 1, assume the command failed normally. In particular, if it
1957  // was the compiler then assume it gave a reasonable error code. Failures
1958  // in other tools are less common, and they generally have worse
1959  // diagnostics, so always print the diagnostic there.
1960  const Tool &FailingTool = FailingCommand->getCreator();
1961 
1962  if (!FailingTool.hasGoodDiagnostics() || CommandRes != 1) {
1963  // FIXME: See FIXME above regarding result code interpretation.
1964  if (CommandRes < 0)
1965  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_command_signalled)
1966  << FailingTool.getShortName();
1967  else
1968  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_command_failed)
1969  << FailingTool.getShortName() << CommandRes;
1970  }
1971 
1972  auto CustomDiag = FailingCommand->getDiagForErrorCode(CommandRes);
1973  if (!CustomDiag.empty())
1974  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_command_failed_diag_msg) << CustomDiag;
1975  }
1976  return Res;
1977 }
1978 
1979 void Driver::PrintHelp(bool ShowHidden) const {
1980  unsigned IncludedFlagsBitmask;
1981  unsigned ExcludedFlagsBitmask;
1982  std::tie(IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask) =
1983  getIncludeExcludeOptionFlagMasks(IsCLMode());
1984 
1985  ExcludedFlagsBitmask |= options::NoDriverOption;
1986  if (!ShowHidden)
1987  ExcludedFlagsBitmask |= HelpHidden;
1988 
1989  if (IsFlangMode())
1990  IncludedFlagsBitmask |= options::FlangOption;
1991  else
1992  ExcludedFlagsBitmask |= options::FlangOnlyOption;
1993 
1994  std::string Usage = llvm::formatv("{0} [options] file...", Name).str();
1995  getOpts().printHelp(llvm::outs(), Usage.c_str(), DriverTitle.c_str(),
1996  IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask,
1997  /*ShowAllAliases=*/false);
1998 }
1999 
2000 llvm::Triple Driver::MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(StringRef TargetArch) const {
2001  SmallVector<StringRef, 5> SYCLAlias = {"spir", "spir64", "spir64_fpga",
2002  "spir64_x86_64", "spir64_gen"};
2003  if (std::find(SYCLAlias.begin(), SYCLAlias.end(), TargetArch) !=
2004  SYCLAlias.end()) {
2005  llvm::Triple TT;
2006  TT.setArchName(TargetArch);
2007  TT.setVendor(llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor);
2008  TT.setOS(llvm::Triple::UnknownOS);
2009  return TT;
2010  }
2011  return llvm::Triple(TargetArch);
2012 }
2013 
2014 // Print the help from any of the given tools which are used for AOT
2015 // compilation for SYCL
2016 void Driver::PrintSYCLToolHelp(const Compilation &C) const {
2017  SmallVector<std::tuple<llvm::Triple, StringRef, StringRef, StringRef>, 4>
2018  HelpArgs;
2019  // Populate the vector with the tools and help options
2020  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_help_EQ)) {
2021  StringRef AV(A->getValue());
2022  llvm::Triple T;
2023  if (AV == "gen" || AV == "all")
2024  HelpArgs.push_back(std::make_tuple(MakeSYCLDeviceTriple("spir64_gen"),
2025  "ocloc", "--help", ""));
2026  if (AV == "fpga" || AV == "all")
2027  HelpArgs.push_back(std::make_tuple(MakeSYCLDeviceTriple("spir64_fpga"),
2028  "aoc", "-help", "-sycl"));
2029  if (AV == "x86_64" || AV == "all")
2030  HelpArgs.push_back(std::make_tuple(MakeSYCLDeviceTriple("spir64_x86_64"),
2031  "opencl-aot", "--help", ""));
2032  if (HelpArgs.empty()) {
2033  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument)
2034  << A->getOption().getName() << AV;
2035  return;
2036  }
2037  }
2038 
2039  // Go through the args and emit the help information for each.
2040  for (auto &HA : HelpArgs) {
2041  llvm::outs() << "Emitting help information for " << std::get<1>(HA) << '\n'
2042  << "Use triple of '" << std::get<0>(HA).normalize() <<
2043  "' to enable ahead of time compilation\n";
2044  // Flush out the buffer before calling the external tool.
2045  llvm::outs().flush();
2046  std::vector<StringRef> ToolArgs = {std::get<1>(HA), std::get<2>(HA),
2047  std::get<3>(HA)};
2048  SmallString<128> ExecPath(
2049  C.getDefaultToolChain().GetProgramPath(std::get<1>(HA).data()));
2050  // do not run the tools with -###.
2051  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__HASH_HASH_HASH)) {
2052  llvm::errs() << "\"" << ExecPath << "\" \"" << ToolArgs[1] << "\"";
2053  if (!ToolArgs[2].empty())
2054  llvm::errs() << " \"" << ToolArgs[2] << "\"";
2055  llvm::errs() << "\n";
2056  continue;
2057  }
2058  auto ToolBinary = llvm::sys::findProgramByName(ExecPath);
2059  if (ToolBinary.getError()) {
2060  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_command_failure) << ExecPath;
2061  continue;
2062  }
2063  // Run the Tool.
2064  llvm::sys::ExecuteAndWait(ToolBinary.get(), ToolArgs);
2065  }
2066 }
2067 
2068 void Driver::PrintVersion(const Compilation &C, raw_ostream &OS) const {
2069  if (IsFlangMode()) {
2070  OS << getClangToolFullVersion("flang-new") << '\n';
2071  } else {
2072  // FIXME: The following handlers should use a callback mechanism, we don't
2073  // know what the client would like to do.
2074  OS << getClangFullVersion() << '\n';
2075  }
2076  const ToolChain &TC = C.getDefaultToolChain();
2077  OS << "Target: " << TC.getTripleString() << '\n';
2078 
2079  // Print the threading model.
2080  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_mthread_model)) {
2081  // Don't print if the ToolChain would have barfed on it already
2082  if (TC.isThreadModelSupported(A->getValue()))
2083  OS << "Thread model: " << A->getValue();
2084  } else
2085  OS << "Thread model: " << TC.getThreadModel();
2086  OS << '\n';
2087 
2088  // Print out the install directory.
2089  OS << "InstalledDir: " << InstalledDir << '\n';
2090 
2091  // If configuration file was used, print its path.
2092  if (!ConfigFile.empty())
2093  OS << "Configuration file: " << ConfigFile << '\n';
2094 }
2095 
2096 /// PrintDiagnosticCategories - Implement the --print-diagnostic-categories
2097 /// option.
2098 static void PrintDiagnosticCategories(raw_ostream &OS) {
2099  // Skip the empty category.
2100  for (unsigned i = 1, max = DiagnosticIDs::getNumberOfCategories(); i != max;
2101  ++i)
2102  OS << i << ',' << DiagnosticIDs::getCategoryNameFromID(i) << '\n';
2103 }
2104 
2105 void Driver::HandleAutocompletions(StringRef PassedFlags) const {
2106  if (PassedFlags == "")
2107  return;
2108  // Print out all options that start with a given argument. This is used for
2109  // shell autocompletion.
2110  std::vector<std::string> SuggestedCompletions;
2111  std::vector<std::string> Flags;
2112 
2113  unsigned int DisableFlags =
2114  options::NoDriverOption | options::Unsupported | options::Ignored;
2115 
2116  // Make sure that Flang-only options don't pollute the Clang output
2117  // TODO: Make sure that Clang-only options don't pollute Flang output
2118  if (!IsFlangMode())
2119  DisableFlags |= options::FlangOnlyOption;
2120 
2121  // Distinguish "--autocomplete=-someflag" and "--autocomplete=-someflag,"
2122  // because the latter indicates that the user put space before pushing tab
2123  // which should end up in a file completion.
2124  const bool HasSpace = PassedFlags.endswith(",");
2125 
2126  // Parse PassedFlags by "," as all the command-line flags are passed to this
2127  // function separated by ","
2128  StringRef TargetFlags = PassedFlags;
2129  while (TargetFlags != "") {
2130  StringRef CurFlag;
2131  std::tie(CurFlag, TargetFlags) = TargetFlags.split(",");
2132  Flags.push_back(std::string(CurFlag));
2133  }
2134 
2135  // We want to show cc1-only options only when clang is invoked with -cc1 or
2136  // -Xclang.
2137  if (llvm::is_contained(Flags, "-Xclang") || llvm::is_contained(Flags, "-cc1"))
2138  DisableFlags &= ~options::NoDriverOption;
2139 
2140  const llvm::opt::OptTable &Opts = getOpts();
2141  StringRef Cur;
2142  Cur = Flags.at(Flags.size() - 1);
2143  StringRef Prev;
2144  if (Flags.size() >= 2) {
2145  Prev = Flags.at(Flags.size() - 2);
