2146  SuggestedCompletions = Opts.suggestValueCompletions(Prev, Cur);
2147  }
2148 
2149  if (SuggestedCompletions.empty())
2150  SuggestedCompletions = Opts.suggestValueCompletions(Cur, "");
2151 
2152  // If Flags were empty, it means the user typed `clang [tab]` where we should
2153  // list all possible flags. If there was no value completion and the user
2154  // pressed tab after a space, we should fall back to a file completion.
2155  // We're printing a newline to be consistent with what we print at the end of
2156  // this function.
2157  if (SuggestedCompletions.empty() && HasSpace && !Flags.empty()) {
2158  llvm::outs() << '\n';
2159  return;
2160  }
2161 
2162  // When flag ends with '=' and there was no value completion, return empty
2163  // string and fall back to the file autocompletion.
2164  if (SuggestedCompletions.empty() && !Cur.endswith("=")) {
2165  // If the flag is in the form of "--autocomplete=-foo",
2166  // we were requested to print out all option names that start with "-foo".
2167  // For example, "--autocomplete=-fsyn" is expanded to "-fsyntax-only".
2168  SuggestedCompletions = Opts.findByPrefix(Cur, DisableFlags);
2169 
2170  // We have to query the -W flags manually as they're not in the OptTable.
2171  // TODO: Find a good way to add them to OptTable instead and them remove
2172  // this code.
2173  for (StringRef S : DiagnosticIDs::getDiagnosticFlags())
2174  if (S.startswith(Cur))
2175  SuggestedCompletions.push_back(std::string(S));
2176  }
2177 
2178  // Sort the autocomplete candidates so that shells print them out in a
2179  // deterministic order. We could sort in any way, but we chose
2180  // case-insensitive sorting for consistency with the -help option
2181  // which prints out options in the case-insensitive alphabetical order.
2182  llvm::sort(SuggestedCompletions, [](StringRef A, StringRef B) {
2183  if (int X = A.compare_insensitive(B))
2184  return X < 0;
2185  return A.compare(B) > 0;
2186  });
2187 
2188  llvm::outs() << llvm::join(SuggestedCompletions, "\n") << '\n';
2189 }
2190 
2191 bool Driver::HandleImmediateArgs(const Compilation &C) {
2192  // The order these options are handled in gcc is all over the place, but we
2193  // don't expect inconsistencies w.r.t. that to matter in practice.
2194 
2195  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_dumpmachine)) {
2196  llvm::outs() << C.getDefaultToolChain().getTripleString() << '\n';
2197  return false;
2198  }
2199 
2200  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_dumpversion)) {
2201  // Since -dumpversion is only implemented for pedantic GCC compatibility, we
2202  // return an answer which matches our definition of __VERSION__.
2203  llvm::outs() << CLANG_VERSION_STRING << "\n";
2204  return false;
2205  }
2206 
2207  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__print_diagnostic_categories)) {
2208  PrintDiagnosticCategories(llvm::outs());
2209  return false;
2210  }
2211 
2212  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_help) ||
2213  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__help_hidden)) {
2214  PrintHelp(C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__help_hidden));
2215  return false;
2216  }
2217 
2218  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_help_EQ)) {
2219  PrintSYCLToolHelp(C);
2220  return false;
2221  }
2222 
2223  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__version)) {
2224  // Follow gcc behavior and use stdout for --version and stderr for -v.
2225  PrintVersion(C, llvm::outs());
2226  return false;
2227  }
2228 
2229  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_v) ||
2230  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__HASH_HASH_HASH) ||
2231  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_supported_cpus)) {
2232  PrintVersion(C, llvm::errs());
2233  SuppressMissingInputWarning = true;
2234  }
2235 
2236  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_v)) {
2237  if (!SystemConfigDir.empty())
2238  llvm::errs() << "System configuration file directory: "
2239  << SystemConfigDir << "\n";
2240  if (!UserConfigDir.empty())
2241  llvm::errs() << "User configuration file directory: "
2242  << UserConfigDir << "\n";
2243  }
2244 
2245  const ToolChain &TC = C.getDefaultToolChain();
2246 
2247  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_v))
2248  TC.printVerboseInfo(llvm::errs());
2249 
2250  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_resource_dir)) {
2251  llvm::outs() << ResourceDir << '\n';
2252  return false;
2253  }
2254 
2255  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_search_dirs)) {
2256  llvm::outs() << "programs: =";
2257  bool separator = false;
2258  // Print -B and COMPILER_PATH.
2259  for (const std::string &Path : PrefixDirs) {
2260  if (separator)
2261  llvm::outs() << llvm::sys::EnvPathSeparator;
2262  llvm::outs() << Path;
2263  separator = true;
2264  }
2265  for (const std::string &Path : TC.getProgramPaths()) {
2266  if (separator)
2267  llvm::outs() << llvm::sys::EnvPathSeparator;
2268  llvm::outs() << Path;
2269  separator = true;
2270  }
2271  llvm::outs() << "\n";
2272  llvm::outs() << "libraries: =" << ResourceDir;
2273 
2274  StringRef sysroot = C.getSysRoot();
2275 
2276  for (const std::string &Path : TC.getFilePaths()) {
2277  // Always print a separator. ResourceDir was the first item shown.
2278  llvm::outs() << llvm::sys::EnvPathSeparator;
2279  // Interpretation of leading '=' is needed only for NetBSD.
2280  if (Path[0] == '=')
2281  llvm::outs() << sysroot << Path.substr(1);
2282  else
2283  llvm::outs() << Path;
2284  }
2285  llvm::outs() << "\n";
2286  return false;
2287  }
2288 
2289  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_runtime_dir)) {
2290  std::string RuntimePath;
2291  // Get the first existing path, if any.
2292  for (auto Path : TC.getRuntimePaths()) {
2293  if (getVFS().exists(Path)) {
2294  RuntimePath = Path;
2295  break;
2296  }
2297  }
2298  if (!RuntimePath.empty())
2299  llvm::outs() << RuntimePath << '\n';
2300  else
2301  llvm::outs() << TC.getCompilerRTPath() << '\n';
2302  return false;
2303  }
2304 
2305  // FIXME: The following handlers should use a callback mechanism, we don't
2306  // know what the client would like to do.
2307  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_print_file_name_EQ)) {
2308  llvm::outs() << GetFilePath(A->getValue(), TC) << "\n";
2309  return false;
2310  }
2311 
2312  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_print_prog_name_EQ)) {
2313  StringRef ProgName = A->getValue();
2314 
2315  // Null program name cannot have a path.
2316  if (! ProgName.empty())
2317  llvm::outs() << GetProgramPath(ProgName, TC);
2318 
2319  llvm::outs() << "\n";
2320  return false;
2321  }
2322 
2323  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_autocomplete)) {
2324  StringRef PassedFlags = A->getValue();
2325  HandleAutocompletions(PassedFlags);
2326  return false;
2327  }
2328 
2329  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_libgcc_file_name)) {
2330  ToolChain::RuntimeLibType RLT = TC.GetRuntimeLibType(C.getArgs());
2331  const llvm::Triple Triple(TC.ComputeEffectiveClangTriple(C.getArgs()));
2332  RegisterEffectiveTriple TripleRAII(TC, Triple);
2333  switch (RLT) {
2334  case ToolChain::RLT_CompilerRT:
2335  llvm::outs() << TC.getCompilerRT(C.getArgs(), "builtins") << "\n";
2336  break;
2337  case ToolChain::RLT_Libgcc:
2338  llvm::outs() << GetFilePath("libgcc.a", TC) << "\n";
2339  break;
2340  }
2341  return false;
2342  }
2343 
2344  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_multi_lib)) {
2345  for (const Multilib &Multilib : TC.getMultilibs())
2346  llvm::outs() << Multilib << "\n";
2347  return false;
2348  }
2349 
2350  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_multi_directory)) {
2351  const Multilib &Multilib = TC.getMultilib();
2352  if (Multilib.gccSuffix().empty())
2353  llvm::outs() << ".\n";
2354  else {
2355  StringRef Suffix(Multilib.gccSuffix());
2356  assert(Suffix.front() == '/');
2357  llvm::outs() << Suffix.substr(1) << "\n";
2358  }
2359  return false;
2360  }
2361 
2362  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_target_triple)) {
2363  llvm::outs() << TC.getTripleString() << "\n";
2364  return false;
2365  }
2366 
2367  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_effective_triple)) {
2368  const llvm::Triple Triple(TC.ComputeEffectiveClangTriple(C.getArgs()));
2369  llvm::outs() << Triple.getTriple() << "\n";
2370  return false;
2371  }
2372 
2373  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_multiarch)) {
2374  llvm::outs() << TC.getMultiarchTriple(*this, TC.getTriple(), SysRoot)
2375  << "\n";
2376  return false;
2377  }
2378 
2379  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_print_targets)) {
2380  llvm::TargetRegistry::printRegisteredTargetsForVersion(llvm::outs());
2381  return false;
2382  }
2383 
2384  return true;
2385 }
2386 
2387 enum {
2388  TopLevelAction = 0,
2389  HeadSibAction = 1,
2390  OtherSibAction = 2,
2391 };
2392 
2393 // Display an action graph human-readably. Action A is the "sink" node
2394 // and latest-occuring action. Traversal is in pre-order, visiting the
2395 // inputs to each action before printing the action itself.
2396 static unsigned PrintActions1(const Compilation &C, Action *A,
2397  std::map<Action *, unsigned> &Ids,
2398  Twine Indent = {}, int Kind = TopLevelAction) {
2399  if (Ids.count(A)) // A was already visited.
2400  return Ids[A];
2401 
2402  std::string str;
2403  llvm::raw_string_ostream os(str);
2404 
2405  auto getSibIndent = [](int K) -> Twine {
2406  return (K == HeadSibAction) ? " " : (K == OtherSibAction) ? "| " : "";
2407  };
2408 
2409  Twine SibIndent = Indent + getSibIndent(Kind);
2410  int SibKind = HeadSibAction;
2411  os << Action::getClassName(A->getKind()) << ", ";
2412  if (InputAction *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(A)) {
2413  os << "\"" << IA->getInputArg().getValue() << "\"";
2414  } else if (BindArchAction *BIA = dyn_cast<BindArchAction>(A)) {
2415  os << '"' << BIA->getArchName() << '"' << ", {"
2416  << PrintActions1(C, *BIA->input_begin(), Ids, SibIndent, SibKind) << "}";
2417  } else if (OffloadAction *OA = dyn_cast<OffloadAction>(A)) {
2418  bool IsFirst = true;
2419  OA->doOnEachDependence(
2420  [&](Action *A, const ToolChain *TC, const char *BoundArch) {
2421  assert(TC && "Unknown host toolchain");
2422  // E.g. for two CUDA device dependences whose bound arch is sm_20 and
2423  // sm_35 this will generate:
2424  // "cuda-device" (nvptx64-nvidia-cuda:sm_20) {#ID}, "cuda-device"
2425  // (nvptx64-nvidia-cuda:sm_35) {#ID}
2426  if (!IsFirst)
2427  os << ", ";
2428  os << '"';
2429  os << A->getOffloadingKindPrefix();
2430  os << " (";
2431  os << TC->getTriple().normalize();
2432  if (BoundArch)
2433  os << ":" << BoundArch;
2434  os << ")";
2435  os << '"';
2436  os << " {" << PrintActions1(C, A, Ids, SibIndent, SibKind) << "}";
2437  IsFirst = false;
2438  SibKind = OtherSibAction;
2439  });
2440  } else {
2441  const ActionList *AL = &A->getInputs();
2442 
2443  if (AL->size()) {
2444  const char *Prefix = "{";
2445  for (Action *PreRequisite : *AL) {
2446  os << Prefix << PrintActions1(C, PreRequisite, Ids, SibIndent, SibKind);
2447  Prefix = ", ";
2448  SibKind = OtherSibAction;
2449  }
2450  os << "}";
2451  } else
2452  os << "{}";
2453  }
2454 
2455  // Append offload info for all options other than the offloading action
2456  // itself (e.g. (cuda-device, sm_20) or (cuda-host)).
2457  std::string offload_str;
2458  llvm::raw_string_ostream offload_os(offload_str);
2459  if (!isa<OffloadAction>(A)) {
2460  auto S = A->getOffloadingKindPrefix();
2461  if (!S.empty()) {
2462  offload_os << ", (" << S;
2463  if (A->getOffloadingArch())
2464  offload_os << ", " << A->getOffloadingArch();
2465  offload_os << ")";
2466  }
2467  }
2468 
2469  auto getSelfIndent = [](int K) -> Twine {
2470  return (K == HeadSibAction) ? "+- " : (K == OtherSibAction) ? "|- " : "";
2471  };
2472 
2473  unsigned Id = Ids.size();
2474  Ids[A] = Id;
2475  llvm::errs() << Indent + getSelfIndent(Kind) << Id << ": " << os.str() << ", "
2476  << types::getTypeName(A->getType()) << offload_os.str() << "\n";
2477 
2478  return Id;
2479 }
2480 
2481 // Print the action graphs in a compilation C.
2482 // For example "clang -c file1.c file2.c" is composed of two subgraphs.
2483 void Driver::PrintActions(const Compilation &C) const {
2484  std::map<Action *, unsigned> Ids;
2485  for (Action *A : C.getActions())
2486  PrintActions1(C, A, Ids);
2487 }
2488 
2489 /// Check whether the given input tree contains any compilation or
2490 /// assembly actions.
2491 static bool ContainsCompileOrAssembleAction(const Action *A) {
2492  if (isa<CompileJobAction>(A) || isa<BackendJobAction>(A) ||
2493  isa<AssembleJobAction>(A))
2494  return true;
2495 
2496  return llvm::any_of(A->inputs(), ContainsCompileOrAssembleAction);
2497 }
2498 
2499 void Driver::BuildUniversalActions(Compilation &C, const ToolChain &TC,
2500  const InputList &BAInputs) const {
2501  DerivedArgList &Args = C.getArgs();
2502  ActionList &Actions = C.getActions();
2503  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Building universal build actions");
2504  // Collect the list of architectures. Duplicates are allowed, but should only
2505  // be handled once (in the order seen).
2506  llvm::StringSet<> ArchNames;
2507  SmallVector<const char *, 4> Archs;
2508  for (Arg *A : Args) {
2509  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_arch)) {
2510  // Validate the option here; we don't save the type here because its
2511  // particular spelling may participate in other driver choices.
2512  llvm::Triple::ArchType Arch =
2513  tools::darwin::getArchTypeForMachOArchName(A->getValue());
2514  if (Arch == llvm::Triple::UnknownArch) {
2515  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_arch_name) << A->getAsString(Args);
2516  continue;
2517  }
2518 
2519  A->claim();
2520  if (ArchNames.insert(A->getValue()).second)
2521  Archs.push_back(A->getValue());
2522  }
2523  }
2524 
2525  // When there is no explicit arch for this platform, make sure we still bind
2526  // the architecture (to the default) so that -Xarch_ is handled correctly.
2527  if (!Archs.size())
2528  Archs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(TC.getDefaultUniversalArchName()));
2529 
2530  ActionList SingleActions;
2531  BuildActions(C, Args, BAInputs, SingleActions);
2532 
2533  // Add in arch bindings for every top level action, as well as lipo and
2534  // dsymutil steps if needed.
2535  for (Action* Act : SingleActions) {
2536  // Make sure we can lipo this kind of output. If not (and it is an actual
2537  // output) then we disallow, since we can't create an output file with the
2538  // right name without overwriting it. We could remove this oddity by just
2539  // changing the output names to include the arch, which would also fix
2540  // -save-temps. Compatibility wins for now.
2541 
2542  if (Archs.size() > 1 && !types::canLipoType(Act->getType()))
2543  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_invalid_output_with_multiple_archs)
2544  << types::getTypeName(Act->getType());
2545 
2546  ActionList Inputs;
2547  for (unsigned i = 0, e = Archs.size(); i != e; ++i)
2548  Inputs.push_back(C.MakeAction<BindArchAction>(Act, Archs[i]));
2549 
2550  // Lipo if necessary, we do it this way because we need to set the arch flag
2551  // so that -Xarch_ gets overwritten.
2552  if (Inputs.size() == 1 || Act->getType() == types::TY_Nothing)
2553  Actions.append(Inputs.begin(), Inputs.end());
2554  else
2555  Actions.push_back(C.MakeAction<LipoJobAction>(Inputs, Act->getType()));
2556 
2557  // Handle debug info queries.
2558  Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_g_Group);
2559  bool enablesDebugInfo = A && !A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_g0) &&
2560  !A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_gstabs);
2561  if ((enablesDebugInfo || willEmitRemarks(Args)) &&
2562  ContainsCompileOrAssembleAction(Actions.back())) {
2563 
2564  // Add a 'dsymutil' step if necessary, when debug info is enabled and we
2565  // have a compile input. We need to run 'dsymutil' ourselves in such cases
2566  // because the debug info will refer to a temporary object file which
2567  // will be removed at the end of the compilation process.
2568  if (Act->getType() == types::TY_Image) {
2569  ActionList Inputs;
2570  Inputs.push_back(Actions.back());
2571  Actions.pop_back();
2572  Actions.push_back(
2573  C.MakeAction<DsymutilJobAction>(Inputs, types::TY_dSYM));
2574  }
2575 
2576  // Verify the debug info output.
2577  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_verify_debug_info)) {
2578  Action* LastAction = Actions.back();
2579  Actions.pop_back();
2580  Actions.push_back(C.MakeAction<VerifyDebugInfoJobAction>(
2581  LastAction, types::TY_Nothing));
2582  }
2583  }
2584  }
2585 }
2586 
2587 bool Driver::DiagnoseInputExistence(const DerivedArgList &Args, StringRef Value,
2588  types::ID Ty, bool TypoCorrect) const {
2589  if (!getCheckInputsExist())
2590  return true;
2591 
2592  // stdin always exists.
2593  if (Value == "-")
2594  return true;
2595 
2596  if (getVFS().exists(Value))
2597  return true;
2598 
2599  if (TypoCorrect) {
2600  // Check if the filename is a typo for an option flag. OptTable thinks
2601  // that all args that are not known options and that start with / are
2602  // filenames, but e.g. `/diagnostic:caret` is more likely a typo for
2603  // the option `/diagnostics:caret` than a reference to a file in the root
2604  // directory.
2605  unsigned IncludedFlagsBitmask;
2606  unsigned ExcludedFlagsBitmask;
2607  std::tie(IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask) =
2608  getIncludeExcludeOptionFlagMasks(IsCLMode());
2609  std::string Nearest;
2610  if (getOpts().findNearest(Value, Nearest, IncludedFlagsBitmask,
2611  ExcludedFlagsBitmask) <= 1) {
2612  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_no_such_file_with_suggestion)
2613  << Value << Nearest;
2614  return false;
2615  }
2616  }
2617 
2618  // In CL mode, don't error on apparently non-existent linker inputs, because
2619  // they can be influenced by linker flags the clang driver might not
2620  // understand.
2621  // Examples:
2622  // - `clang-cl main.cc ole32.lib` in a a non-MSVC shell will make the driver
2623  // module look for an MSVC installation in the registry. (We could ask
2624  // the MSVCToolChain object if it can find `ole32.lib`, but the logic to
2625  // look in the registry might move into lld-link in the future so that
2626  // lld-link invocations in non-MSVC shells just work too.)
2627  // - `clang-cl ... /link ...` can pass arbitrary flags to the linker,
2628  // including /libpath:, which is used to find .lib and .obj files.
2629  // So do not diagnose this on the driver level. Rely on the linker diagnosing
2630  // it. (If we don't end up invoking the linker, this means we'll emit a
2631  // "'linker' input unused [-Wunused-command-line-argument]" warning instead
2632  // of an error.)
2633  //
2634  // Only do this skip after the typo correction step above. `/Brepo` is treated
2635  // as TY_Object, but it's clearly a typo for `/Brepro`. It seems fine to emit
2636  // an error if we have a flag that's within an edit distance of 1 from a
2637  // flag. (Users can use `-Wl,` or `/linker` to launder the flag past the
2638  // driver in the unlikely case they run into this.)
2639  //
2640  // Don't do this for inputs that start with a '/', else we'd pass options
2641  // like /libpath: through to the linker silently.
2642  //
2643  // Emitting an error for linker inputs can also cause incorrect diagnostics
2644  // with the gcc driver. The command
2645  // clang -fuse-ld=lld -Wl,--chroot,some/dir /file.o
2646  // will make lld look for some/dir/file.o, while we will diagnose here that
2647  // `/file.o` does not exist. However, configure scripts check if
2648  // `clang /GR-` compiles without error to see if the compiler is cl.exe,
2649  // so we can't downgrade diagnostics for `/GR-` from an error to a warning
2650  // in cc mode. (We can in cl mode because cl.exe itself only warns on
2651  // unknown flags.)
2652  if (IsCLMode() && Ty == types::TY_Object && !Value.startswith("/"))
2653  return true;
2654 
2655  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_no_such_file) << Value;
2656  return false;
2657 }
2658 
2659 // Construct a the list of inputs and their types.
2660 void Driver::BuildInputs(const ToolChain &TC, DerivedArgList &Args,
2661  InputList &Inputs) const {
2662  const llvm::opt::OptTable &Opts = getOpts();
2663  // Track the current user specified (-x) input. We also explicitly track the
2664  // argument used to set the type; we only want to claim the type when we
2665  // actually use it, so we warn about unused -x arguments.
2666  types::ID InputType = types::TY_Nothing;
2667  Arg *InputTypeArg = nullptr;
2668  bool IsSYCL =
2669  Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false) ||
2670  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_only);
2671 
2672  // The last /TC or /TP option sets the input type to C or C++ globally.
2673  if (Arg *TCTP = Args.getLastArgNoClaim(options::OPT__SLASH_TC,
2674  options::OPT__SLASH_TP)) {
2675  InputTypeArg = TCTP;
2676  InputType = TCTP->getOption().matches(options::OPT__SLASH_TC) && !IsSYCL
2677  ? types::TY_C
2678  : types::TY_CXX;
2679 
2680  Arg *Previous = nullptr;
2681  bool ShowNote = false;
2682  for (Arg *A :
2683  Args.filtered(options::OPT__SLASH_TC, options::OPT__SLASH_TP)) {
2684  if (Previous) {
2685  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_overriding_flag_option)
2686  << Previous->getSpelling() << A->getSpelling();
2687  ShowNote = true;
2688  }
2689  Previous = A;
2690  }
2691  if (ShowNote)
2692  Diag(clang::diag::note_drv_t_option_is_global);
2693 
2694  // No driver mode exposes -x and /TC or /TP; we don't support mixing them.
2695  assert(!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_x) && "-x and /TC or /TP is not allowed");
2696  }
2697 
2698  // Warn -x after last input file has no effect
2699  {
2700  Arg *LastXArg = Args.getLastArgNoClaim(options::OPT_x);
2701  Arg *LastInputArg = Args.getLastArgNoClaim(options::OPT_INPUT);
2702  if (LastXArg && LastInputArg && LastInputArg->getIndex() < LastXArg->getIndex())
2703  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_unused_x) << LastXArg->getValue();
2704  }
2705 
2706  for (Arg *A : Args) {
2707  if (A->getOption().getKind() == Option::InputClass) {
2708  const char *Value = A->getValue();
2709  types::ID Ty = types::TY_INVALID;
2710 
2711  // Infer the input type if necessary.
2712  if (InputType == types::TY_Nothing) {
2713  // If there was an explicit arg for this, claim it.
2714  if (InputTypeArg)
2715  InputTypeArg->claim();
2716 
2717  types::ID CType = types::TY_C;
2718  // For SYCL, all source file inputs are considered C++.
2719  if (IsSYCL)
2720  CType = types::TY_CXX;
2721 
2722  // stdin must be handled specially.
2723  if (memcmp(Value, "-", 2) == 0) {
2724  if (IsFlangMode()) {
2725  Ty = types::TY_Fortran;
2726  } else {
2727  // If running with -E, treat as a C input (this changes the
2728  // builtin macros, for example). This may be overridden by -ObjC
2729  // below.
2730  //
2731  // Otherwise emit an error but still use a valid type to avoid
2732  // spurious errors (e.g., no inputs).
2733  assert(!CCGenDiagnostics && "stdin produces no crash reproducer");
2734  if (!Args.hasArgNoClaim(options::OPT_E) && !CCCIsCPP())
2735  Diag(IsCLMode() ? clang::diag::err_drv_unknown_stdin_type_clang_cl
2736  : clang::diag::err_drv_unknown_stdin_type);
2737  Ty = types::TY_C;
2738  }
2739  } else {
2740  // Otherwise lookup by extension.
2741  // Fallback is C if invoked as C preprocessor, C++ if invoked with
2742  // clang-cl /E, or Object otherwise.
2743  // We use a host hook here because Darwin at least has its own
2744  // idea of what .s is.
2745  if (const char *Ext = strrchr(Value, '.'))
2746  Ty = TC.LookupTypeForExtension(Ext + 1);
2747 
2748  // For SYCL, convert C-type sources to C++-type sources.
2749  if (IsSYCL) {
2750  types::ID OldTy = Ty;
2751  switch (Ty) {
2752  case types::TY_C:
2753  Ty = types::TY_CXX;
2754  break;
2755  case types::TY_CHeader:
2756  Ty = types::TY_CXXHeader;
2757  break;
2758  case types::TY_PP_C:
2759  Ty = types::TY_PP_CXX;
2760  break;
2761  case types::TY_PP_CHeader:
2762  Ty = types::TY_PP_CXXHeader;
2763  break;
2764  default:
2765  break;
2766  }
2767  if (OldTy != Ty) {
2768  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_fsycl_with_c_type)
2769  << getTypeName(OldTy) << getTypeName(Ty);
2770  }
2771  }
2772 
2773  if (Ty == types::TY_INVALID) {
2774  if (IsCLMode() && (Args.hasArgNoClaim(options::OPT_E) || CCGenDiagnostics))
2775  Ty = types::TY_CXX;
2776  else if (CCCIsCPP() || CCGenDiagnostics)
2777  Ty = CType;
2778  else
2779  Ty = types::TY_Object;
2780  }
2781 
2782  // If the driver is invoked as C++ compiler (like clang++ or c++) it
2783  // should autodetect some input files as C++ for g++ compatibility.
2784  if (CCCIsCXX()) {
2785  types::ID OldTy = Ty;
2786  Ty = types::lookupCXXTypeForCType(Ty);
2787 
2788  if (Ty != OldTy)
2789  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_treating_input_as_cxx)
2790  << getTypeName(OldTy) << getTypeName(Ty);
2791  }
2792 
2793  // If running with -fthinlto-index=, extensions that normally identify
2794  // native object files actually identify LLVM bitcode files.
2795  if (Args.hasArgNoClaim(options::OPT_fthinlto_index_EQ) &&
2796  Ty == types::TY_Object)
2797  Ty = types::TY_LLVM_BC;
2798  }
2799 
2800  // -ObjC and -ObjC++ override the default language, but only for "source
2801  // files". We just treat everything that isn't a linker input as a
2802  // source file.
2803  //
2804  // FIXME: Clean this up if we move the phase sequence into the type.
2805  if (Ty != types::TY_Object) {
2806  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_ObjC))
2807  Ty = types::TY_ObjC;
2808  else if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_ObjCXX))
2809  Ty = types::TY_ObjCXX;
2810  }
2811  } else {
2812  assert(InputTypeArg && "InputType set w/o InputTypeArg");
2813  if (!InputTypeArg->getOption().matches(options::OPT_x)) {
2814  // If emulating cl.exe, make sure that /TC and /TP don't affect input
2815  // object files.
2816  const char *Ext = strrchr(Value, '.');
2817  if (Ext && TC.LookupTypeForExtension(Ext + 1) == types::TY_Object)
2818  Ty = types::TY_Object;
2819  }
2820  if (Ty == types::TY_INVALID) {
2821  Ty = InputType;
2822  InputTypeArg->claim();
2823  }
2824  }
2825 
2826  if (DiagnoseInputExistence(Args, Value, Ty, /*TypoCorrect=*/true))
2827  Inputs.push_back(std::make_pair(Ty, A));
2828 
2829  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT__SLASH_Tc)) {
2830  StringRef Value = A->getValue();
2831  if (DiagnoseInputExistence(Args, Value, types::TY_C,
2832  /*TypoCorrect=*/false)) {
2833  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, A->getValue());
2834  Inputs.push_back(
2835  std::make_pair(IsSYCL ? types::TY_CXX : types::TY_C, InputArg));
2836  }
2837  A->claim();
2838  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT__SLASH_Tp)) {
2839  StringRef Value = A->getValue();
2840  if (DiagnoseInputExistence(Args, Value, types::TY_CXX,
2841  /*TypoCorrect=*/false)) {
2842  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, A->getValue());
2843  Inputs.push_back(std::make_pair(types::TY_CXX, InputArg));
2844  }
2845  A->claim();
2846  } else if (A->getOption().hasFlag(options::LinkerInput)) {
2847  // Just treat as object type, we could make a special type for this if
2848  // necessary.
2849  Inputs.push_back(std::make_pair(types::TY_Object, A));
2850 
2851  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_x)) {
2852  InputTypeArg = A;
2853  InputType = types::lookupTypeForTypeSpecifier(A->getValue());
2854  A->claim();
2855 
2856  // Follow gcc behavior and treat as linker input for invalid -x
2857  // options. Its not clear why we shouldn't just revert to unknown; but
2858  // this isn't very important, we might as well be bug compatible.
2859  if (!InputType) {
2860  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_unknown_language) << A->getValue();
2861  InputType = types::TY_Object;
2862  }
2863  // Emit an error if c-compilation is forced in -fsycl mode
2864  if (IsSYCL && (InputType == types::TY_C || InputType == types::TY_PP_C ||
2865  InputType == types::TY_CHeader))
2866  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_fsycl_with_c_type) << A->getAsString(Args);
2867 
2868  } else if (A->getOption().getID() == options::OPT_U) {
2869  assert(A->getNumValues() == 1 && "The /U option has one value.");
2870  StringRef Val = A->getValue(0);
2871  if (Val.find_first_of("/\\") != StringRef::npos) {
2872  // Warn about e.g. "/Users/me/myfile.c".
2873  Diag(diag::warn_slash_u_filename) << Val;
2874  Diag(diag::note_use_dashdash);
2875  }
2876  }
2877  // TODO: remove when -foffload-static-lib support is dropped.
2878  else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_offload_lib_Group)) {
2879  // Add the foffload-static-lib library to the command line to allow
2880  // processing when no source or object is supplied as well as proper
2881  // host link.
2882  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, A->getValue());
2883  Inputs.push_back(std::make_pair(types::TY_Object, InputArg));
2884  A->claim();
2885  // Use of -foffload-static-lib and -foffload-whole-static-lib are
2886  // deprecated with the updated functionality to scan the static libs.
2887  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_deprecated_option)
2888  << A->getAsString(Args) << A->getValue();
2889  }
2890  }
2891  if (CCCIsCPP() && Inputs.empty()) {
2892  // If called as standalone preprocessor, stdin is processed
2893  // if no other input is present.
2894  Arg *A = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, "-");
2895  Inputs.push_back(std::make_pair(types::TY_C, A));
2896  }
2897 }
2898 
2899 static bool runBundler(const SmallVectorImpl<StringRef> &BundlerArgs,
2900  Compilation &C) {
2901  // Find bundler.
2902  StringRef ExecPath(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(C.getDriver().Dir));
2903  llvm::ErrorOr<std::string> BundlerBinary =
2904  llvm::sys::findProgramByName("clang-offload-bundler", ExecPath);
2905  // Since this is run in real time and not in the toolchain, output the
2906  // command line if requested.
2907  bool OutputOnly = C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__HASH_HASH_HASH);
2908  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_v) || OutputOnly) {
2909  for (StringRef A : BundlerArgs)
2910  if (OutputOnly)
2911  llvm::errs() << "\"" << A << "\" ";
2912  else
2913  llvm::errs() << A << " ";
2914  llvm::errs() << '\n';
2915  }
2916  if (BundlerBinary.getError())
2917  return false;
2918 
2919  return !llvm::sys::ExecuteAndWait(BundlerBinary.get(), BundlerArgs);
2920 }
2921 
2922 static bool hasFPGABinary(Compilation &C, std::string Object, types::ID Type) {
2923  assert(types::isFPGA(Type) && "unexpected Type for FPGA binary check");
2924  // Do not do the check if the file doesn't exist
2925  if (!llvm::sys::fs::exists(Object))
2926  return false;
2927 
2928  // Only static archives are valid FPGA Binaries for unbundling.
2929  if (!isStaticArchiveFile(Object))
2930  return false;
2931 
2932  // Temporary names for the output.
2933  llvm::Triple TT;
2934  TT.setArchName(types::getTypeName(Type));
2935  TT.setVendorName("intel");
2936  TT.setOS(llvm::Triple::UnknownOS);
2937 
2938  // Checking uses -check-section option with the input file, no output
2939  // file and the target triple being looked for.
2940  const char *Targets =
2941  C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Twine("-targets=sycl-") + TT.str());
2942  const char *Inputs = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Twine("-inputs=") + Object);
2943  // Always use -type=ao for aocx/aocr bundle checking. The 'bundles' are
2944  // actually archives.
2945  SmallVector<StringRef, 6> BundlerArgs = {"clang-offload-bundler", "-type=ao",
2946  Targets, Inputs, "-check-section"};
2947  return runBundler(BundlerArgs, C);
2948 }
2949 
2950 static bool hasSYCLDefaultSection(Compilation &C, const StringRef &File) {
2951  // Do not do the check if the file doesn't exist
2952  if (!llvm::sys::fs::exists(File))
2953  return false;
2954 
2955  bool IsArchive = isStaticArchiveFile(File);
2956  if (!(IsArchive || isObjectFile(File.str())))
2957  return false;
2958 
2959  llvm::Triple TT(C.getDriver().MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(getDefaultSYCLArch(C)));
2960  // Checking uses -check-section option with the input file, no output
2961  // file and the target triple being looked for.
2962  const char *Targets =
2963  C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Twine("-targets=sycl-") + TT.str());
2964  const char *Inputs =
2965  C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Twine("-inputs=") + File.str());
2966  // Always use -type=ao for bundle checking. The 'bundles' are
2967  // actually archives.
2968  SmallVector<StringRef, 6> BundlerArgs = {"clang-offload-bundler",
2969  IsArchive ? "-type=ao" : "-type=o",
2970  Targets, Inputs, "-check-section"};
2971  return runBundler(BundlerArgs, C);
2972 }
2973 
2974 static bool hasOffloadSections(Compilation &C, const StringRef &Archive,
2975  DerivedArgList &Args) {
2976  // Do not do the check if the file doesn't exist
2977  if (!llvm::sys::fs::exists(Archive))
2978  return false;
2979 
2980  llvm::Triple TT(C.getDefaultToolChain().getTriple());
2981  // Checking uses -check-section option with the input file, no output
2982  // file and the target triple being looked for.
2983  // TODO - Improve checking to check for explicit offload target instead
2984  // of the generic host availability.
2985  const char *Targets = Args.MakeArgString(Twine("-targets=host-") + TT.str());
2986  const char *Inputs = Args.MakeArgString(Twine("-inputs=") + Archive.str());
2987  // Always use -type=ao for bundle checking. The 'bundles' are
2988  // actually archives.
2989  SmallVector<StringRef, 6> BundlerArgs = {"clang-offload-bundler", "-type=ao",
2990  Targets, Inputs, "-check-section"};
2991  return runBundler(BundlerArgs, C);
2992 }
2993 
2994 // Simple helper function for Linker options, where the option is valid if
2995 // it has '-' or '--' as the designator.
2996 static bool optionMatches(const std::string &Option,
2997  const std::string &OptCheck) {
2998  return (Option == OptCheck || ("-" + Option) == OptCheck);
2999 }
3000 
3001 // Process linker inputs for use with offload static libraries. We are only
3002 // handling options and explicitly named static archives as these need to be
3003 // partially linked.
3004 static SmallVector<const char *, 16>
3005 getLinkerArgs(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args, bool IncludeObj = false) {
3006  SmallVector<const char *, 16> LibArgs;
3007  SmallVector<std::string, 8> LibPaths;
3008  bool IsMSVC = C.getDefaultToolChain().getTriple().isWindowsMSVCEnvironment();
3009  // Add search directories from LIBRARY_PATH/LIB env variable
3010  llvm::Optional<std::string> LibPath =
3011  llvm::sys::Process::GetEnv(IsMSVC ? "LIB" : "LIBRARY_PATH");
3012  if (LibPath) {
3013  SmallVector<StringRef, 8> SplitPaths;
3014  const char EnvPathSeparatorStr[] = {llvm::sys::EnvPathSeparator, '\0'};
3015  llvm::SplitString(*LibPath, SplitPaths, EnvPathSeparatorStr);
3016  for (StringRef Path : SplitPaths)
3017  LibPaths.emplace_back(Path.trim());
3018  }
3019  // Add directories from user-specified -L options
3020  for (std::string LibDirs : Args.getAllArgValues(options::OPT_L))
3021  LibPaths.emplace_back(LibDirs);
3022 
3023  // Do processing for any -l<arg> options passed and see if any static
3024  // libraries representing the name exists. If so, convert the name and
3025  // use that inline with the rest of the libraries.
3026  // TODO: The static archive processing for SYCL is done in a different
3027  // manner than the OpenMP processing. We should try and refactor this
3028  // to use the OpenMP flow (adding -l<name> to the llvm-link step)
3029  auto resolveStaticLib = [&](StringRef LibName, bool IsStatic) -> bool {
3030  if (!LibName.startswith("-l"))
3031  return false;
3032  for (auto LPath : LibPaths) {
3033  if (!IsStatic) {
3034  // Current linking state is dynamic. We will first check for the
3035  // shared object and not pull in the static library if it is found.
3036  SmallString<128> SoLibName(LPath);
3037  llvm::sys::path::append(SoLibName,
3038  Twine("lib" + LibName.substr(2) + ".so").str());
3039  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(SoLibName))
3040  return false;
3041  }
3042  SmallString<128> FullName(LPath);
3043  llvm::sys::path::append(FullName,
3044  Twine("lib" + LibName.substr(2) + ".a").str());
3045  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(FullName)) {
3046  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(FullName));
3047  return true;
3048  }
3049  }
3050  return false;
3051  };
3052  for (const auto *A : Args) {
3053  std::string FileName = A->getAsString(Args);
3054  static bool IsLinkStateStatic(Args.hasArg(options::OPT_static));
3055  auto addLibArg = [&](StringRef LibName) -> bool {
3056  if (isStaticArchiveFile(LibName) ||
3057  (IncludeObj && isObjectFile(LibName.str()))) {
3058  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(LibName));
3059  return true;
3060  }
3061  return false;
3062  };
3063  if (A->getOption().getKind() == Option::InputClass) {
3064  if (addLibArg(FileName))
3065  continue;
3066  }
3067  // Evaluate any libraries passed along after /link. These are typically
3068  // ignored by the driver and sent directly to the linker. When performing
3069  // offload, we should evaluate them at the driver level.
3070  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT__SLASH_link)) {
3071  for (const std::string &Value : A->getValues()) {
3072  // Add any libpath values.
3073  StringRef OptCheck(Value);
3074  if (OptCheck.startswith_insensitive("-libpath:") ||
3075  OptCheck.startswith_insensitive("/libpath:"))
3076  LibPaths.emplace_back(Value.substr(std::string("-libpath:").size()));
3077  if (addLibArg(Value))
3078  continue;
3079  for (auto LPath : LibPaths) {
3080  SmallString<128> FullLib(LPath);
3081  llvm::sys::path::append(FullLib, Value);
3082  if (addLibArg(FullLib))
3083  continue;
3084  }
3085  }
3086  }
3087  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Wl_COMMA) ||
3088  A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Xlinker)) {
3089  // Parse through additional linker arguments that are meant to go
3090  // directly to the linker.
3091  // Keep the previous arg even if it is a new argument, for example:
3092  // -Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker <dir>.
3093  // Without this history, we do not know that <dir> was assocated with
3094  // -rpath and is processed incorrectly.
3095  static std::string PrevArg;
3096  for (const std::string &Value : A->getValues()) {
3097  auto addKnownValues = [&](const StringRef &V) {
3098  // Only add named static libs objects and --whole-archive options.
3099  if (optionMatches("-whole-archive", V.str()) ||
3100  optionMatches("-no-whole-archive", V.str()) ||
3101  isStaticArchiveFile(V) || (IncludeObj && isObjectFile(V.str()))) {
3102  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(V));
3103  return;
3104  }
3105  // Probably not the best way to handle this, but there are options
3106  // that take arguments which we should not add to the known values.
3107  // Handle -z and -rpath for now - can be expanded if/when usage shows
3108  // the need.
3109  if (PrevArg != "-z" && PrevArg != "-rpath" && V[0] != '-' &&
3110  isObjectFile(V.str())) {
3111  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(V));
3112  return;
3113  }
3114  if (optionMatches("-Bstatic", V.str()) ||
3115  optionMatches("-dn", V.str()) ||
3116  optionMatches("-non_shared", V.str()) ||
3117  optionMatches("-static", V.str())) {
3118  IsLinkStateStatic = true;
3119  return;
3120  }
3121  if (optionMatches("-Bdynamic", V.str()) ||
3122  optionMatches("-dy", V.str()) ||
3123  optionMatches("-call_shared", V.str())) {
3124  IsLinkStateStatic = false;
3125  return;
3126  }
3127  resolveStaticLib(V, IsLinkStateStatic);
3128  };
3129  if (Value[0] == '@') {
3130  // Found a response file, we want to expand contents to try and
3131  // discover more libraries and options.
3132  SmallVector<const char *, 20> ExpandArgs;
3133  ExpandArgs.push_back(Value.c_str());
3134 
3135  llvm::BumpPtrAllocator A;
3136  llvm::StringSaver S(A);
3137  llvm::cl::ExpandResponseFiles(
3138  S,
3139  IsMSVC ? llvm::cl::TokenizeWindowsCommandLine
3140  : llvm::cl::TokenizeGNUCommandLine,
3141  ExpandArgs);
3142  for (StringRef EA : ExpandArgs)
3143  addKnownValues(EA);
3144  } else
3145  addKnownValues(Value);
3146  PrevArg = Value;
3147  }
3148  continue;
3149  }
3150  // Use of -foffload-static-lib and -foffload-whole-static-lib is
3151  // considered deprecated. Usage should move to passing in the static
3152  // library name on the command line, encapsulating with
3153  // -Wl,--whole-archive <lib> -Wl,--no-whole-archive as needed.
3154  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_foffload_static_lib_EQ)) {
3155  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(A->getValue()));
3156  continue;
3157  }
3158  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_foffload_whole_static_lib_EQ)) {
3159  // For -foffload-whole-static-lib, we add the --whole-archive wrap
3160  // around the library which will be used during the partial link step.
3161  LibArgs.push_back("--whole-archive");
3162  LibArgs.push_back(Args.MakeArgString(A->getValue()));
3163  LibArgs.push_back("--no-whole-archive");
3164  continue;
3165  }
3166  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_l))
3167  resolveStaticLib(A->getAsString(Args), IsLinkStateStatic);
3168  }
3169  return LibArgs;
3170 }
3171 
3172 static bool IsSYCLDeviceLibObj(std::string ObjFilePath, bool isMSVCEnv) {
3173  StringRef ObjFileName = llvm::sys::path::filename(ObjFilePath);
3174  StringRef ObjSuffix = isMSVCEnv ? ".obj" : ".o";
3175  bool Ret =
3176  (ObjFileName.startswith("libsycl-") && ObjFileName.endswith(ObjSuffix))
3177  ? true
3178  : false;
3179  return Ret;
3180 }
3181 
3182 // Goes through all of the arguments, including inputs expected for the
3183 // linker directly, to determine if we need to potentially add the SYCL
3184 // default triple.
3185 bool Driver::checkForSYCLDefaultDevice(Compilation &C,
3186  DerivedArgList &Args) const {
3187  // Check only if enabled with -fsycl
3188  if (!Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false))
3189  return false;
3190 
3191  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fno_sycl_link_spirv))
3192  return false;
3193 
3194  // Do not do the check if the default device is passed in -fsycl-targets
3195  // or if -fsycl-targets isn't passed (that implies default device)
3196  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_targets_EQ)) {
3197  for (const char *Val : A->getValues()) {
3198  llvm::Triple TT(C.getDriver().MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(Val));
3199  if (TT.isSPIR() && TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::NoSubArch)
3200  // Default triple found
3201  return false;
3202  }
3203  } else if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fintelfpga))
3204  return false;
3205 
3206  SmallVector<const char *, 16> AllArgs(getLinkerArgs(C, Args, true));
3207  for (StringRef Arg : AllArgs) {
3208  if (hasSYCLDefaultSection(C, Arg))
3209  return true;
3210  }
3211  return false;
3212 }
3213 
3214 // Goes through all of the arguments, including inputs expected for the
3215 // linker directly, to determine if we need to perform additional work for
3216 // static offload libraries.
3217 bool Driver::checkForOffloadStaticLib(Compilation &C,
3218  DerivedArgList &Args) const {
3219  // Check only if enabled with -fsycl or -fopenmp-targets
3220  if (!Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false) &&
3221  !Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_targets_EQ))
3222  return false;
3223 
3224  // Right off the bat, assume the presence of -foffload-static-lib means
3225  // the need to perform linking steps for fat static archive offloading.
3226  // TODO: remove when -foffload-static-lib support is dropped.
3227  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_offload_lib_Group))
3228  return true;
3229  SmallVector<const char *, 16> OffloadLibArgs(getLinkerArgs(C, Args));
3230  for (StringRef OLArg : OffloadLibArgs)
3231  if (isStaticArchiveFile(OLArg) && hasOffloadSections(C, OLArg, Args)) {
3232  // FPGA binaries with AOCX or AOCR sections are not considered fat
3233  // static archives.
3234  return !(hasFPGABinary(C, OLArg.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCR) ||
3235  hasFPGABinary(C, OLArg.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCX));
3236  }
3237  return false;
3238 }
3239 
3240 /// Check whether the given input tree contains any clang-offload-dependency
3241 /// actions.
3242 static bool ContainsOffloadDepsAction(const Action *A) {
3243  if (isa<OffloadDepsJobAction>(A))
3244  return true;
3245  return llvm::any_of(A->inputs(), ContainsOffloadDepsAction);
3246 }
3247 
3248 namespace {
3249 /// Provides a convenient interface for different programming models to generate
3250 /// the required device actions.
3251 class OffloadingActionBuilder final {
3252  /// Flag used to trace errors in the builder.
3253  bool IsValid = false;
3254 
3255  /// The compilation that is using this builder.
3256  Compilation &C;
3257 
3258  /// Map between an input argument and the offload kinds used to process it.
3259  std::map<const Arg *, unsigned> InputArgToOffloadKindMap;
3260 
3261  /// Map between a host action and its originating input argument.
3262  std::map<Action *, const Arg *> HostActionToInputArgMap;
3263 
3264  /// Builder interface. It doesn't build anything or keep any state.
3265  class DeviceActionBuilder {
3266  public:
3267  typedef const llvm::SmallVectorImpl<phases::ID> PhasesTy;
3268 
3269  enum ActionBuilderReturnCode {
3270  // The builder acted successfully on the current action.
3271  ABRT_Success,
3272  // The builder didn't have to act on the current action.
3273  ABRT_Inactive,
3274  // The builder was successful and requested the host action to not be
3275  // generated.
3276  ABRT_Ignore_Host,
3277  };
3278 
3279  protected:
3280  /// Compilation associated with this builder.
3281  Compilation &C;
3282 
3283  /// Tool chains associated with this builder. The same programming
3284  /// model may have associated one or more tool chains.
3285  SmallVector<const ToolChain *, 2> ToolChains;
3286 
3287  /// The derived arguments associated with this builder.
3288  DerivedArgList &Args;
3289 
3290  /// The inputs associated with this builder.
3291  const Driver::InputList &Inputs;
3292 
3293  /// The associated offload kind.
3294  Action::OffloadKind AssociatedOffloadKind = Action::OFK_None;
3295 
3296  public:
3297  DeviceActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
3298  const Driver::InputList &Inputs,
3299  Action::OffloadKind AssociatedOffloadKind)
3300  : C(C), Args(Args), Inputs(Inputs),
3301  AssociatedOffloadKind(AssociatedOffloadKind) {}
3302  virtual ~DeviceActionBuilder() {}
3303 
3304  /// Fill up the array \a DA with all the device dependences that should be
3305  /// added to the provided host action \a HostAction. By default it is
3306  /// inactive.
3307  virtual ActionBuilderReturnCode
3308  getDeviceDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA,
3309  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
3310  PhasesTy &Phases) {
3311  return ABRT_Inactive;
3312  }
3313 
3314  /// Update the state to include the provided host action \a HostAction as a
3315  /// dependency of the current device action. By default it is inactive.
3316  virtual ActionBuilderReturnCode addDeviceDepences(Action *HostAction) {
3317  return ABRT_Inactive;
3318  }
3319 
3320  /// Append top level actions generated by the builder.
3321  virtual void appendTopLevelActions(ActionList &AL) {}
3322 
3323  /// Append top level actions specific for certain link situations.
3324  virtual void appendTopLevelLinkAction(ActionList &AL) {}
3325 
3326  /// Append linker device actions generated by the builder.
3327  virtual void appendLinkDeviceActions(ActionList &AL) {}
3328 
3329  /// Append linker host action generated by the builder.
3330  virtual Action* appendLinkHostActions(ActionList &AL) { return nullptr; }
3331 
3332  /// Append linker actions generated by the builder.
3333  virtual void appendLinkDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA) {}
3334 
3335  /// Append linker actions generated by the builder.
3336  virtual void addDeviceLinkDependencies(OffloadDepsJobAction *DA) {}
3337 
3338  /// Initialize the builder. Return true if any initialization errors are
3339  /// found.
3340  virtual bool initialize() { return false; }
3341 
3342  /// Return true if the builder can use bundling/unbundling.
3343  virtual bool canUseBundlerUnbundler() const { return false; }
3344 
3345  /// Return true if this builder is valid. We have a valid builder if we have
3346  /// associated device tool chains.
3347  bool isValid() { return !ToolChains.empty(); }
3348 
3349  /// Return the associated offload kind.
3350  Action::OffloadKind getAssociatedOffloadKind() {
3351  return AssociatedOffloadKind;
3352  }
3353  };
3354 
3355  /// Base class for CUDA/HIP action builder. It injects device code in
3356  /// the host backend action.
3357  class CudaActionBuilderBase : public DeviceActionBuilder {
3358  protected:
3359  /// Flags to signal if the user requested host-only or device-only
3360  /// compilation.
3361  bool CompileHostOnly = false;
3362  bool CompileDeviceOnly = false;
3363  bool EmitLLVM = false;
3364  bool EmitAsm = false;
3365 
3366  /// ID to identify each device compilation. For CUDA it is simply the
3367  /// GPU arch string. For HIP it is either the GPU arch string or GPU
3368  /// arch string plus feature strings delimited by a plus sign, e.g.
3369  /// gfx906+xnack.
3370  struct TargetID {
3371  /// Target ID string which is persistent throughout the compilation.
3372  const char *ID;
3373  TargetID(CudaArch Arch) { ID = CudaArchToString(Arch); }
3374  TargetID(const char *ID) : ID(ID) {}
3375  operator const char *() { return ID; }
3376  operator StringRef() { return StringRef(ID); }
3377  };
3378  /// List of GPU architectures to use in this compilation.
3379  SmallVector<TargetID, 4> GpuArchList;
3380 
3381  /// The CUDA actions for the current input.
3382  ActionList CudaDeviceActions;
3383 
3384  /// The CUDA fat binary if it was generated for the current input.
3385  Action *CudaFatBinary = nullptr;
3386 
3387  /// Flag that is set to true if this builder acted on the current input.
3388  bool IsActive = false;
3389 
3390  /// Flag for -fgpu-rdc.
3391  bool Relocatable = false;
3392 
3393  /// Default GPU architecture if there's no one specified.
3394  CudaArch DefaultCudaArch = CudaArch::UNKNOWN;
3395 
3396  /// Method to generate compilation unit ID specified by option
3397  /// '-fuse-cuid='.
3398  enum UseCUIDKind { CUID_Hash, CUID_Random, CUID_None, CUID_Invalid };
3399  UseCUIDKind UseCUID = CUID_Hash;
3400 
3401  /// Compilation unit ID specified by option '-cuid='.
3402  StringRef FixedCUID;
3403 
3404  public:
3405  CudaActionBuilderBase(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
3406  const Driver::InputList &Inputs,
3407  Action::OffloadKind OFKind)
3408  : DeviceActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs, OFKind) {}
3409 
3410  ActionBuilderReturnCode addDeviceDepences(Action *HostAction) override {
3411  // While generating code for CUDA, we only depend on the host input action
3412  // to trigger the creation of all the CUDA device actions.
3413 
3414  // If we are dealing with an input action, replicate it for each GPU
3415  // architecture. If we are in host-only mode we return 'success' so that
3416  // the host uses the CUDA offload kind.
3417  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(HostAction)) {
3418  assert(!GpuArchList.empty() &&
3419  "We should have at least one GPU architecture.");
3420 
3421  // If the host input is not CUDA or HIP, we don't need to bother about
3422  // this input.
3423  if (!(IA->getType() == types::TY_CUDA ||
3424  IA->getType() == types::TY_HIP ||
3425  IA->getType() == types::TY_PP_HIP)) {
3426  // The builder will ignore this input.
3427  IsActive = false;
3428  return ABRT_Inactive;
3429  }
3430 
3431  // Set the flag to true, so that the builder acts on the current input.
3432  IsActive = true;
3433 
3434  if (CompileHostOnly)
3435  return ABRT_Success;
3436 
3437  // Replicate inputs for each GPU architecture.
3438  auto Ty = IA->getType() == types::TY_HIP ? types::TY_HIP_DEVICE
3439  : types::TY_CUDA_DEVICE;
3440  std::string CUID = FixedCUID.str();
3441  if (CUID.empty()) {
3442  if (UseCUID == CUID_Random)
3443  CUID = llvm::utohexstr(llvm::sys::Process::GetRandomNumber(),
3444  /*LowerCase=*/true);
3445  else if (UseCUID == CUID_Hash) {
3446  llvm::MD5 Hasher;
3447  llvm::MD5::MD5Result Hash;
3448  SmallString<256> RealPath;
3449  llvm::sys::fs::real_path(IA->getInputArg().getValue(), RealPath,
3450  /*expand_tilde=*/true);
3451  Hasher.update(RealPath);
3452  for (auto *A : Args) {
3453  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_INPUT))
3454  continue;
3455  Hasher.update(A->getAsString(Args));
3456  }
3457  Hasher.final(Hash);
3458  CUID = llvm::utohexstr(Hash.low(), /*LowerCase=*/true);
3459  }
3460  }
3461  IA->setId(CUID);
3462 
3463  for (unsigned I = 0, E = GpuArchList.size(); I != E; ++I) {
3464  CudaDeviceActions.push_back(
3465  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(IA->getInputArg(), Ty, IA->getId()));
3466  }
3467 
3468  return ABRT_Success;
3469  }
3470 
3471  // If this is an unbundling action use it as is for each CUDA toolchain.
3472  if (auto *UA = dyn_cast<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(HostAction)) {
3473 
3474  // If -fgpu-rdc is disabled, should not unbundle since there is no
3475  // device code to link.
3476  if (UA->getType() == types::TY_Object && !Relocatable)
3477  return ABRT_Inactive;
3478 
3479  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3480  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(UA->getInputs().back())) {
3481  std::string FileName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
3482  // Check if the type of the file is the same as the action. Do not
3483  // unbundle it if it is not. Do not unbundle .so files, for example,
3484  // which are not object files.
3485  if (IA->getType() == types::TY_Object &&
3486  (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(FileName) ||
3487  types::lookupTypeForExtension(
3488  llvm::sys::path::extension(FileName).drop_front()) !=
3489  types::TY_Object))
3490  return ABRT_Inactive;
3491  }
3492 
3493  for (auto Arch : GpuArchList) {
3494  CudaDeviceActions.push_back(UA);
3495  UA->registerDependentActionInfo(ToolChains[0], Arch,
3496  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3497  }
3498  IsActive = true;
3499  return ABRT_Success;
3500  }
3501 
3502  return IsActive ? ABRT_Success : ABRT_Inactive;
3503  }
3504 
3505  void appendTopLevelActions(ActionList &AL) override {
3506  // Utility to append actions to the top level list.
3507  auto AddTopLevel = [&](Action *A, TargetID TargetID) {
3508  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences Dep;
3509  Dep.add(*A, *ToolChains.front(), TargetID, AssociatedOffloadKind);
3510  AL.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(Dep, A->getType()));
3511  };
3512 
3513  // If we have a fat binary, add it to the list.
3514  if (CudaFatBinary) {
3515  AddTopLevel(CudaFatBinary, CudaArch::UNUSED);
3516  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3517  CudaFatBinary = nullptr;
3518  return;
3519  }
3520 
3521  if (CudaDeviceActions.empty())
3522  return;
3523 
3524  // If we have CUDA actions at this point, that's because we have a have
3525  // partial compilation, so we should have an action for each GPU
3526  // architecture.
3527  assert(CudaDeviceActions.size() == GpuArchList.size() &&
3528  "Expecting one action per GPU architecture.");
3529  assert(ToolChains.size() == 1 &&
3530  "Expecting to have a single CUDA toolchain.");
3531  for (unsigned I = 0, E = GpuArchList.size(); I != E; ++I)
3532  AddTopLevel(CudaDeviceActions[I], GpuArchList[I]);
3533 
3534  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3535  }
3536 
3537  /// Get canonicalized offload arch option. \returns empty StringRef if the
3538  /// option is invalid.
3539  virtual StringRef getCanonicalOffloadArch(StringRef Arch) = 0;
3540 
3541  virtual llvm::Optional<std::pair<llvm::StringRef, llvm::StringRef>>
3542  getConflictOffloadArchCombination(const std::set<StringRef> &GpuArchs) = 0;
3543 
3544  bool initialize() override {
3545  assert(AssociatedOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Cuda ||
3546  AssociatedOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP);
3547 
3548  // We don't need to support CUDA.
3549  if (AssociatedOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Cuda &&
3550  !C.hasOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Cuda>())
3551  return false;
3552 
3553  // We don't need to support HIP.
3554  if (AssociatedOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP &&
3555  !C.hasOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_HIP>())
3556  return false;
3557 
3558  Relocatable = Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fgpu_rdc,
3559  options::OPT_fno_gpu_rdc, /*Default=*/false);
3560 
3561  const ToolChain *HostTC = C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>();
3562  assert(HostTC && "No toolchain for host compilation.");
3563  if (HostTC->getTriple().isNVPTX() ||
3564  HostTC->getTriple().getArch() == llvm::Triple::amdgcn) {
3565  // We do not support targeting NVPTX/AMDGCN for host compilation. Throw
3566  // an error and abort pipeline construction early so we don't trip
3567  // asserts that assume device-side compilation.
3568  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_cuda_host_arch)
3569  << HostTC->getTriple().getArchName();
3570  return true;
3571  }
3572 
3573  ToolChains.push_back(
3574  AssociatedOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Cuda
3575  ? C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Cuda>()
3576  : C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_HIP>());
3577 
3578  Arg *PartialCompilationArg = Args.getLastArg(
3579  options::OPT_cuda_host_only, options::OPT_cuda_device_only,
3580  options::OPT_cuda_compile_host_device);
3581  CompileHostOnly = PartialCompilationArg &&
3582  PartialCompilationArg->getOption().matches(
3583  options::OPT_cuda_host_only);
3584  CompileDeviceOnly = PartialCompilationArg &&
3585  PartialCompilationArg->getOption().matches(
3586  options::OPT_cuda_device_only);
3587  EmitLLVM = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm);
3588  EmitAsm = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_S);
3589  FixedCUID = Args.getLastArgValue(options::OPT_cuid_EQ);
3590  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fuse_cuid_EQ)) {
3591  StringRef UseCUIDStr = A->getValue();
3592  UseCUID = llvm::StringSwitch<UseCUIDKind>(UseCUIDStr)
3593  .Case("hash", CUID_Hash)
3594  .Case("random", CUID_Random)
3595  .Case("none", CUID_None)
3596  .Default(CUID_Invalid);
3597  if (UseCUID == CUID_Invalid) {
3598  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_invalid_value)
3599  << A->getAsString(Args) << UseCUIDStr;
3600  C.setContainsError();
3601  return true;
3602  }
3603  }
3604 
3605  // --offload and --offload-arch options are mutually exclusive.
3606  if (Args.hasArgNoClaim(options::OPT_offload_EQ) &&
3607  Args.hasArgNoClaim(options::OPT_offload_arch_EQ,
3608  options::OPT_no_offload_arch_EQ)) {
3609  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_opt_not_valid_with_opt) << "--offload-arch"
3610  << "--offload";
3611  }
3612 
3613  // Collect all cuda_gpu_arch parameters, removing duplicates.
3614  std::set<StringRef> GpuArchs;
3615  bool Error = false;
3616  for (Arg *A : Args) {
3617  if (!(A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_offload_arch_EQ) ||
3618  A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_no_offload_arch_EQ)))
3619  continue;
3620  A->claim();
3621 
3622  StringRef ArchStr = A->getValue();
3623  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_no_offload_arch_EQ) &&
3624  ArchStr == "all") {
3625  GpuArchs.clear();
3626  continue;
3627  }
3628  ArchStr = getCanonicalOffloadArch(ArchStr);
3629  if (ArchStr.empty()) {
3630  Error = true;
3631  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_offload_arch_EQ))
3632  GpuArchs.insert(ArchStr);
3633  else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_no_offload_arch_EQ))
3634  GpuArchs.erase(ArchStr);
3635  else
3636  llvm_unreachable("Unexpected option.");
3637  }
3638 
3639  auto &&ConflictingArchs = getConflictOffloadArchCombination(GpuArchs);
3640  if (ConflictingArchs) {
3641  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_bad_offload_arch_combo)
3642  << ConflictingArchs.getValue().first
3643  << ConflictingArchs.getValue().second;
3644  C.setContainsError();
3645  return true;
3646  }
3647 
3648  // Collect list of GPUs remaining in the set.
3649  for (auto Arch : GpuArchs)
3650  GpuArchList.push_back(Arch.data());
3651 
3652  // Default to sm_20 which is the lowest common denominator for
3653  // supported GPUs. sm_20 code should work correctly, if
3654  // suboptimally, on all newer GPUs.
3655  if (GpuArchList.empty()) {
3656  if (ToolChains.front()->getTriple().isSPIRV())
3657  GpuArchList.push_back(CudaArch::Generic);
3658  else
3659  GpuArchList.push_back(DefaultCudaArch);
3660  }
3661 
3662  return Error;
3663  }
3664  };
3665 
3666  /// \brief CUDA action builder. It injects device code in the host backend
3667  /// action.
3668  class CudaActionBuilder final : public CudaActionBuilderBase {
3669  public:
3670  CudaActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
3671  const Driver::InputList &Inputs)
3672  : CudaActionBuilderBase(C, Args, Inputs, Action::OFK_Cuda) {
3673  DefaultCudaArch = CudaArch::SM_35;
3674  }
3675 
3676  StringRef getCanonicalOffloadArch(StringRef ArchStr) override {
3677  CudaArch Arch = StringToCudaArch(ArchStr);
3678  if (Arch == CudaArch::UNKNOWN || !IsNVIDIAGpuArch(Arch)) {
3679  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_cuda_bad_gpu_arch) << ArchStr;
3680  return StringRef();
3681  }
3682  return CudaArchToString(Arch);
3683  }
3684 
3685  llvm::Optional<std::pair<llvm::StringRef, llvm::StringRef>>
3686  getConflictOffloadArchCombination(
3687  const std::set<StringRef> &GpuArchs) override {
3688  return llvm::None;
3689  }
3690 
3691  ActionBuilderReturnCode
3692  getDeviceDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA,
3693  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
3694  PhasesTy &Phases) override {
3695  if (!IsActive)
3696  return ABRT_Inactive;
3697 
3698  // If we don't have more CUDA actions, we don't have any dependences to
3699  // create for the host.
3700  if (CudaDeviceActions.empty())
3701  return ABRT_Success;
3702 
3703  assert(CudaDeviceActions.size() == GpuArchList.size() &&
3704  "Expecting one action per GPU architecture.");
3705  assert(!CompileHostOnly &&
3706  "Not expecting CUDA actions in host-only compilation.");
3707 
3708  // If we are generating code for the device or we are in a backend phase,
3709  // we attempt to generate the fat binary. We compile each arch to ptx and
3710  // assemble to cubin, then feed the cubin *and* the ptx into a device
3711  // "link" action, which uses fatbinary to combine these cubins into one
3712  // fatbin. The fatbin is then an input to the host action if not in
3713  // device-only mode.
3714  if (CompileDeviceOnly || CurPhase == phases::Backend) {
3715  ActionList DeviceActions;
3716  for (unsigned I = 0, E = GpuArchList.size(); I != E; ++I) {
3717  // Produce the device action from the current phase up to the assemble
3718  // phase.
3719  for (auto Ph : Phases) {
3720  // Skip the phases that were already dealt with.
3721  if (Ph < CurPhase)
3722  continue;
3723  // We have to be consistent with the host final phase.
3724  if (Ph > FinalPhase)
3725  break;
3726 
3727  CudaDeviceActions[I] = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
3728  C, Args, Ph, CudaDeviceActions[I], Action::OFK_Cuda);
3729 
3730  if (Ph == phases::Assemble)
3731  break;
3732  }
3733 
3734  // If we didn't reach the assemble phase, we can't generate the fat
3735  // binary. We don't need to generate the fat binary if we are not in
3736  // device-only mode.
3737  if (!isa<AssembleJobAction>(CudaDeviceActions[I]) ||
3738  CompileDeviceOnly)
3739  continue;
3740 
3741  Action *AssembleAction = CudaDeviceActions[I];
3742  assert(AssembleAction->getType() == types::TY_Object);
3743  assert(AssembleAction->getInputs().size() == 1);
3744 
3745  Action *BackendAction = AssembleAction->getInputs()[0];
3746  assert(BackendAction->getType() == types::TY_PP_Asm);
3747 
3748  for (auto &A : {AssembleAction, BackendAction}) {
3749  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDep;
3750  DDep.add(*A, *ToolChains.front(), GpuArchList[I], Action::OFK_Cuda);
3751  DeviceActions.push_back(
3752  C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(DDep, A->getType()));
3753  }
3754  }
3755 
3756  // We generate the fat binary if we have device input actions.
3757  if (!DeviceActions.empty()) {
3758  CudaFatBinary =
3759  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(DeviceActions, types::TY_CUDA_FATBIN);
3760 
3761  if (!CompileDeviceOnly) {
3762  DA.add(*CudaFatBinary, *ToolChains.front(), /*BoundArch=*/nullptr,
3763  Action::OFK_Cuda);
3764  // Clear the fat binary, it is already a dependence to an host
3765  // action.
3766  CudaFatBinary = nullptr;
3767  }
3768 
3769  // Remove the CUDA actions as they are already connected to an host
3770  // action or fat binary.
3771  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3772  }
3773 
3774  // We avoid creating host action in device-only mode.
3775  return CompileDeviceOnly ? ABRT_Ignore_Host : ABRT_Success;
3776  } else if (CurPhase > phases::Backend) {
3777  // If we are past the backend phase and still have a device action, we
3778  // don't have to do anything as this action is already a device
3779  // top-level action.
3780  return ABRT_Success;
3781  }
3782 
3783  assert(CurPhase < phases::Backend && "Generating single CUDA "
3784  "instructions should only occur "
3785  "before the backend phase!");
3786 
3787  // By default, we produce an action for each device arch.
3788  for (Action *&A : CudaDeviceActions)
3789  A = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, CurPhase, A);
3790 
3791  return ABRT_Success;
3792  }
3793  };
3794  /// \brief HIP action builder. It injects device code in the host backend
3795  /// action.
3796  class HIPActionBuilder final : public CudaActionBuilderBase {
3797  /// The linker inputs obtained for each device arch.
3798  SmallVector<ActionList, 8> DeviceLinkerInputs;
3799  // The default bundling behavior depends on the type of output, therefore
3800  // BundleOutput needs to be tri-value: None, true, or false.
3801  // Bundle code objects except --no-gpu-output is specified for device
3802  // only compilation. Bundle other type of output files only if
3803  // --gpu-bundle-output is specified for device only compilation.
3804  Optional<bool> BundleOutput;
3805 
3806  public:
3807  HIPActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
3808  const Driver::InputList &Inputs)
3809  : CudaActionBuilderBase(C, Args, Inputs, Action::OFK_HIP) {
3810  DefaultCudaArch = CudaArch::GFX803;
3811  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_gpu_bundle_output,
3812  options::OPT_no_gpu_bundle_output))
3813  BundleOutput = Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_gpu_bundle_output,
3814  options::OPT_no_gpu_bundle_output, true);
3815  }
3816 
3817  bool canUseBundlerUnbundler() const override { return true; }
3818 
3819  StringRef getCanonicalOffloadArch(StringRef IdStr) override {
3820  llvm::StringMap<bool> Features;
3821  // getHIPOffloadTargetTriple() is known to return valid value as it has
3822  // been called successfully in the CreateOffloadingDeviceToolChains().
3823  auto ArchStr = parseTargetID(
3824  *getHIPOffloadTargetTriple(C.getDriver(), C.getInputArgs()), IdStr,
3825  &Features);
3826  if (!ArchStr) {
3827  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_bad_target_id) << IdStr;
3828  C.setContainsError();
3829  return StringRef();
3830  }
3831  auto CanId = getCanonicalTargetID(ArchStr.getValue(), Features);
3832  return Args.MakeArgStringRef(CanId);
3833  };
3834 
3835  llvm::Optional<std::pair<llvm::StringRef, llvm::StringRef>>
3836  getConflictOffloadArchCombination(
3837  const std::set<StringRef> &GpuArchs) override {
3838  return getConflictTargetIDCombination(GpuArchs);
3839  }
3840 
3841  ActionBuilderReturnCode
3842  getDeviceDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA,
3843  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
3844  PhasesTy &Phases) override {
3845  if (!IsActive)
3846  return ABRT_Inactive;
3847 
3848  // amdgcn does not support linking of object files, therefore we skip
3849  // backend and assemble phases to output LLVM IR. Except for generating
3850  // non-relocatable device coee, where we generate fat binary for device
3851  // code and pass to host in Backend phase.
3852  if (CudaDeviceActions.empty())
3853  return ABRT_Success;
3854 
3855  assert(((CurPhase == phases::Link && Relocatable) ||
3856  CudaDeviceActions.size() == GpuArchList.size()) &&
3857  "Expecting one action per GPU architecture.");
3858  assert(!CompileHostOnly &&
3859  "Not expecting CUDA actions in host-only compilation.");
3860 
3861  if (!Relocatable && CurPhase == phases::Backend && !EmitLLVM &&
3862  !EmitAsm) {
3863  // If we are in backend phase, we attempt to generate the fat binary.
3864  // We compile each arch to IR and use a link action to generate code
3865  // object containing ISA. Then we use a special "link" action to create
3866  // a fat binary containing all the code objects for different GPU's.
3867  // The fat binary is then an input to the host action.
3868  for (unsigned I = 0, E = GpuArchList.size(); I != E; ++I) {
3869  if (C.getDriver().isUsingLTO(/*IsOffload=*/true)) {
3870  // When LTO is enabled, skip the backend and assemble phases and
3871  // use lld to link the bitcode.
3872  ActionList AL;
3873  AL.push_back(CudaDeviceActions[I]);
3874  // Create a link action to link device IR with device library
3875  // and generate ISA.
3876  CudaDeviceActions[I] =
3877  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(AL, types::TY_Image);
3878  } else {
3879  // When LTO is not enabled, we follow the conventional
3880  // compiler phases, including backend and assemble phases.
3881  ActionList AL;
3882  Action *BackendAction = nullptr;
3883  if (ToolChains.front()->getTriple().isSPIRV()) {
3884  // Emit LLVM bitcode for SPIR-V targets. SPIR-V device tool chain
3885  // (HIPSPVToolChain) runs post-link LLVM IR passes.
3886  types::ID Output = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_S)
3887  ? types::TY_LLVM_IR
3888  : types::TY_LLVM_BC;
3889  BackendAction =
3890  C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(CudaDeviceActions[I], Output);
3891  } else
3892  BackendAction = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
3893  C, Args, phases::Backend, CudaDeviceActions[I],
3894  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3895  auto AssembleAction = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
3896  C, Args, phases::Assemble, BackendAction,
3897  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3898  AL.push_back(AssembleAction);
3899  // Create a link action to link device IR with device library
3900  // and generate ISA.
3901  CudaDeviceActions[I] =
3902  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(AL, types::TY_Image);
3903  }
3904 
3905  // OffloadingActionBuilder propagates device arch until an offload
3906  // action. Since the next action for creating fatbin does
3907  // not have device arch, whereas the above link action and its input
3908  // have device arch, an offload action is needed to stop the null
3909  // device arch of the next action being propagated to the above link
3910  // action.
3911  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDep;
3912  DDep.add(*CudaDeviceActions[I], *ToolChains.front(), GpuArchList[I],
3913  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3914  CudaDeviceActions[I] = C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(
3915  DDep, CudaDeviceActions[I]->getType());
3916  }
3917 
3918  if (!CompileDeviceOnly || !BundleOutput.hasValue() ||
3919  BundleOutput.getValue()) {
3920  // Create HIP fat binary with a special "link" action.
3921  CudaFatBinary = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(CudaDeviceActions,
3922  types::TY_HIP_FATBIN);
3923 
3924  if (!CompileDeviceOnly) {
3925  DA.add(*CudaFatBinary, *ToolChains.front(), /*BoundArch=*/nullptr,
3926  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3927  // Clear the fat binary, it is already a dependence to an host
3928  // action.
3929  CudaFatBinary = nullptr;
3930  }
3931 
3932  // Remove the CUDA actions as they are already connected to an host
3933  // action or fat binary.
3934  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3935  }
3936 
3937  return CompileDeviceOnly ? ABRT_Ignore_Host : ABRT_Success;
3938  } else if (CurPhase == phases::Link) {
3939  // Save CudaDeviceActions to DeviceLinkerInputs for each GPU subarch.
3940  // This happens to each device action originated from each input file.
3941  // Later on, device actions in DeviceLinkerInputs are used to create
3942  // device link actions in appendLinkDependences and the created device
3943  // link actions are passed to the offload action as device dependence.
3944  DeviceLinkerInputs.resize(CudaDeviceActions.size());
3945  auto LI = DeviceLinkerInputs.begin();
3946  for (auto *A : CudaDeviceActions) {
3947  LI->push_back(A);
3948  ++LI;
3949  }
3950 
3951  // We will pass the device action as a host dependence, so we don't
3952  // need to do anything else with them.
3953  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3954  return CompileDeviceOnly ? ABRT_Ignore_Host : ABRT_Success;
3955  }
3956 
3957  // By default, we produce an action for each device arch.
3958  for (Action *&A : CudaDeviceActions)
3959  A = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, CurPhase, A,
3960  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3961 
3962  if (CompileDeviceOnly && CurPhase == FinalPhase &&
3963  BundleOutput.hasValue() && BundleOutput.getValue()) {
3964  for (unsigned I = 0, E = GpuArchList.size(); I != E; ++I) {
3965  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDep;
3966  DDep.add(*CudaDeviceActions[I], *ToolChains.front(), GpuArchList[I],
3967  AssociatedOffloadKind);
3968  CudaDeviceActions[I] = C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(
3969  DDep, CudaDeviceActions[I]->getType());
3970  }
3971  CudaFatBinary =
3972  C.MakeAction<OffloadBundlingJobAction>(CudaDeviceActions);
3973  CudaDeviceActions.clear();
3974  }
3975 
3976  return (CompileDeviceOnly && CurPhase == FinalPhase) ? ABRT_Ignore_Host
3977  : ABRT_Success;
3978  }
3979 
3980  void appendLinkDeviceActions(ActionList &AL) override {
3981  if (DeviceLinkerInputs.size() == 0)
3982  return;
3983 
3984  assert(DeviceLinkerInputs.size() == GpuArchList.size() &&
3985  "Linker inputs and GPU arch list sizes do not match.");
3986 
3987  ActionList Actions;
3988  // Append a new link action for each device.
3989  unsigned I = 0;
3990  for (auto &LI : DeviceLinkerInputs) {
3991  // Each entry in DeviceLinkerInputs corresponds to a GPU arch.
3992  auto *DeviceLinkAction =
3993  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(LI, types::TY_Image);
3994  // Linking all inputs for the current GPU arch.
3995  // LI contains all the inputs for the linker.
3996  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DeviceLinkDeps;
3997  DeviceLinkDeps.add(*DeviceLinkAction, *ToolChains[0],
3998  GpuArchList[I], AssociatedOffloadKind);
3999  Actions.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(
4000  DeviceLinkDeps, DeviceLinkAction->getType()));
4001  ++I;
4002  }
4003  DeviceLinkerInputs.clear();
4004 
4005  // Create a host object from all the device images by embedding them
4006  // in a fat binary for mixed host-device compilation. For device-only
4007  // compilation, creates a fat binary.
4008  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDeps;
4009  if (!CompileDeviceOnly || !BundleOutput.hasValue() ||
4010  BundleOutput.getValue()) {
4011  auto *TopDeviceLinkAction = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(
4012  Actions,
4013  CompileDeviceOnly ? types::TY_HIP_FATBIN : types::TY_Object);
4014  DDeps.add(*TopDeviceLinkAction, *ToolChains[0], nullptr,
4015  AssociatedOffloadKind);
4016  // Offload the host object to the host linker.
4017  AL.push_back(
4018  C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(DDeps, TopDeviceLinkAction->getType()));
4019  } else {
4020  AL.append(Actions);
4021  }
4022  }
4023 
4024  Action* appendLinkHostActions(ActionList &AL) override { return AL.back(); }
4025 
4026  void appendLinkDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA) override {}
4027  };
4028 
4029  /// OpenMP action builder. The host bitcode is passed to the device frontend
4030  /// and all the device linked images are passed to the host link phase.
4031  class OpenMPActionBuilder final : public DeviceActionBuilder {
4032  /// The OpenMP actions for the current input.
4033  ActionList OpenMPDeviceActions;
4034 
4035  /// The linker inputs obtained for each toolchain.
4036  SmallVector<ActionList, 8> DeviceLinkerInputs;
4037 
4038  public:
4039  OpenMPActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
4040  const Driver::InputList &Inputs)
4041  : DeviceActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs, Action::OFK_OpenMP) {}
4042 
4043  ActionBuilderReturnCode
4044  getDeviceDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA,
4045  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
4046  PhasesTy &Phases) override {
4047  if (OpenMPDeviceActions.empty())
4048  return ABRT_Inactive;
4049 
4050  // We should always have an action for each input.
4051  assert(OpenMPDeviceActions.size() == ToolChains.size() &&
4052  "Number of OpenMP actions and toolchains do not match.");
4053 
4054  // The host only depends on device action in the linking phase, when all
4055  // the device images have to be embedded in the host image.
4056  if (CurPhase == phases::Link) {
4057  assert(ToolChains.size() == DeviceLinkerInputs.size() &&
4058  "Toolchains and linker inputs sizes do not match.");
4059  auto LI = DeviceLinkerInputs.begin();
4060  for (auto *A : OpenMPDeviceActions) {
4061  LI->push_back(A);
4062  ++LI;
4063  }
4064 
4065  // We passed the device action as a host dependence, so we don't need to
4066  // do anything else with them.
4067  OpenMPDeviceActions.clear();
4068  return ABRT_Success;
4069  }
4070 
4071  // By default, we produce an action for each device arch.
4072  for (Action *&A : OpenMPDeviceActions)
4073  A = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, CurPhase, A);
4074 
4075  return ABRT_Success;
4076  }
4077 
4078  ActionBuilderReturnCode addDeviceDepences(Action *HostAction) override {
4079 
4080  // If this is an input action replicate it for each OpenMP toolchain.
4081  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(HostAction)) {
4082  OpenMPDeviceActions.clear();
4083  for (unsigned I = 0; I < ToolChains.size(); ++I)
4084  OpenMPDeviceActions.push_back(
4085  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(IA->getInputArg(), IA->getType()));
4086  return ABRT_Success;
4087  }
4088 
4089  // If this is an unbundling action use it as is for each OpenMP toolchain.
4090  if (auto *UA = dyn_cast<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(HostAction)) {
4091  OpenMPDeviceActions.clear();
4092  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(UA->getInputs().back())) {
4093  std::string FileName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
4094  // Check if the type of the file is the same as the action. Do not
4095  // unbundle it if it is not. Do not unbundle .so files, for example,
4096  // which are not object files.
4097  if (IA->getType() == types::TY_Object &&
4098  (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(FileName) ||
4099  types::lookupTypeForExtension(
4100  llvm::sys::path::extension(FileName).drop_front()) !=
4101  types::TY_Object))
4102  return ABRT_Inactive;
4103  }
4104  for (unsigned I = 0; I < ToolChains.size(); ++I) {
4105  OpenMPDeviceActions.push_back(UA);
4106  UA->registerDependentActionInfo(
4107  ToolChains[I], /*BoundArch=*/StringRef(), Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4108  }
4109  return ABRT_Success;
4110  }
4111 
4112  // When generating code for OpenMP we use the host compile phase result as
4113  // a dependence to the device compile phase so that it can learn what
4114  // declarations should be emitted. However, this is not the only use for
4115  // the host action, so we prevent it from being collapsed.
4116  if (isa<CompileJobAction>(HostAction)) {
4117  HostAction->setCannotBeCollapsedWithNextDependentAction();
4118  assert(ToolChains.size() == OpenMPDeviceActions.size() &&
4119  "Toolchains and device action sizes do not match.");
4120  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
4121  *HostAction, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
4122  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4123  auto TC = ToolChains.begin();
4124  for (Action *&A : OpenMPDeviceActions) {
4125  assert(isa<CompileJobAction>(A));
4126  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDep;
4127  DDep.add(*A, **TC, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4128  A = C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(HDep, DDep);
4129  ++TC;
4130  }
4131  }
4132  return ABRT_Success;
4133  }
4134 
4135  void appendTopLevelActions(ActionList &AL) override {
4136  if (OpenMPDeviceActions.empty())
4137  return;
4138 
4139  // We should always have an action for each input.
4140  assert(OpenMPDeviceActions.size() == ToolChains.size() &&
4141  "Number of OpenMP actions and toolchains do not match.");
4142
