4143  // Append all device actions followed by the proper offload action.
4144  auto TI = ToolChains.begin();
4145  for (auto *A : OpenMPDeviceActions) {
4146  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences Dep;
4147  Dep.add(*A, **TI, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4148  AL.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(Dep, A->getType()));
4149  ++TI;
4150  }
4151  // We no longer need the action stored in this builder.
4152  OpenMPDeviceActions.clear();
4153  }
4154 
4155  void appendLinkDeviceActions(ActionList &AL) override {
4156  assert(ToolChains.size() == DeviceLinkerInputs.size() &&
4157  "Toolchains and linker inputs sizes do not match.");
4158 
4159  // Append a new link action for each device.
4160  auto TC = ToolChains.begin();
4161  for (auto &LI : DeviceLinkerInputs) {
4162  auto *DeviceLinkAction =
4163  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(LI, types::TY_Image);
4164  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DeviceLinkDeps;
4165  DeviceLinkDeps.add(*DeviceLinkAction, **TC, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr,
4166  Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4167  AL.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(DeviceLinkDeps,
4168  DeviceLinkAction->getType()));
4169  ++TC;
4170  }
4171  DeviceLinkerInputs.clear();
4172  }
4173 
4174  Action* appendLinkHostActions(ActionList &AL) override {
4175  // Create wrapper bitcode from the result of device link actions and compile
4176  // it to an object which will be added to the host link command.
4177  auto *BC = C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(AL, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4178  auto *ASM = C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(BC, types::TY_PP_Asm);
4179  return C.MakeAction<AssembleJobAction>(ASM, types::TY_Object);
4180  }
4181 
4182  void appendLinkDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA) override {}
4183 
4184  void addDeviceLinkDependencies(OffloadDepsJobAction *DA) override {
4185  for (unsigned I = 0; I < ToolChains.size(); ++I) {
4186  // Register dependent toolchain.
4187  DA->registerDependentActionInfo(
4188  ToolChains[I], /*BoundArch=*/StringRef(), Action::OFK_OpenMP);
4189 
4190  if (!ToolChains[I]->getTriple().isSPIR()) {
4191  // Create object from the deps bitcode.
4192  auto *BA = C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(DA, types::TY_PP_Asm);
4193  auto *AA = C.MakeAction<AssembleJobAction>(BA, types::TY_Object);
4194 
4195  // Add deps object to linker inputs.
4196  DeviceLinkerInputs[I].push_back(AA);
4197  } else
4198  DeviceLinkerInputs[I].push_back(DA);
4199  }
4200  }
4201 
4202  bool initialize() override {
4203  // Get the OpenMP toolchains. If we don't get any, the action builder will
4204  // know there is nothing to do related to OpenMP offloading.
4205  auto OpenMPTCRange = C.getOffloadToolChains<Action::OFK_OpenMP>();
4206  for (auto TI = OpenMPTCRange.first, TE = OpenMPTCRange.second; TI != TE;
4207  ++TI)
4208  ToolChains.push_back(TI->second);
4209 
4210  DeviceLinkerInputs.resize(ToolChains.size());
4211  return false;
4212  }
4213 
4214  bool canUseBundlerUnbundler() const override {
4215  // OpenMP should use bundled files whenever possible.
4216  return true;
4217  }
4218  };
4219 
4220  /// SYCL action builder. The host bitcode is passed to the device frontend
4221  /// and all the device linked images are passed to the host link phase.
4222  /// SPIR related are wrapped before added to the fat binary
4223  class SYCLActionBuilder final : public DeviceActionBuilder {
4224  /// Flag to signal if the user requested device-only compilation.
4225  bool CompileDeviceOnly = false;
4226 
4227  /// Flag to signal if the user requested the device object to be wrapped.
4228  bool WrapDeviceOnlyBinary = false;
4229 
4230  /// Flag to signal if the user requested device code split.
4231  bool DeviceCodeSplit = false;
4232 
4233  /// List of offload device toolchain, bound arch needed to track for
4234  /// different binary constructions.
4235  /// POD to hold information about a SYCL device action.
4236  /// Each Action is bound to a <TC, arch> pair,
4237  /// we keep them together under a struct for clarity.
4238  struct DeviceTargetInfo {
4239  DeviceTargetInfo(const ToolChain *TC, const char *BA)
4240  : TC(TC), BoundArch(BA) {}
4241 
4242  const ToolChain *TC;
4243  const char *BoundArch;
4244  };
4245  SmallVector<DeviceTargetInfo, 4> SYCLTargetInfoList;
4246 
4247  /// The SYCL actions for the current input.
4248  /// One action per triple/boundarch.
4249  SmallVector<Action *, 4> SYCLDeviceActions;
4250 
4251  /// The linker inputs obtained for each input/toolchain/arch.
4252  SmallVector<ActionList, 4> DeviceLinkerInputs;
4253 
4254  /// The SYCL link binary if it was generated for the current input.
4255  Action *SYCLLinkBinary = nullptr;
4256 
4257  /// Running list of SYCL actions specific for device linking.
4258  ActionList SYCLLinkBinaryList;
4259 
4260  /// SYCL ahead of time compilation inputs
4261  SmallVector<std::pair<llvm::Triple, const char *>, 8> SYCLAOTInputs;
4262 
4263  /// List of offload device triples as provided on the CLI.
4264  /// Does not track AOT binary inputs triples.
4265  SmallVector<llvm::Triple, 4> SYCLTripleList;
4266 
4267  /// Type of output file for FPGA device compilation.
4268  types::ID FPGAOutType = types::TY_FPGA_AOCX;
4269 
4270  /// List of objects to extract FPGA dependency info from
4271  ActionList FPGAObjectInputs;
4272 
4273  /// List of static archives to extract FPGA dependency info from
4274  ActionList FPGAArchiveInputs;
4275 
4276  /// List of GPU architectures to use in this compilation with NVPTX/AMDGCN
4277  /// targets.
4278  SmallVector<std::pair<llvm::Triple, const char *>, 8> GpuArchList;
4279 
4280  /// Build the last steps for CUDA after all BC files have been linked.
4281  JobAction *finalizeNVPTXDependences(Action *Input, const llvm::Triple &TT) {
4282  auto *BA = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
4283  C, Args, phases::Backend, Input, AssociatedOffloadKind);
4284  if (TT.getOS() != llvm::Triple::NVCL) {
4285  auto *AA = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
4286  C, Args, phases::Assemble, BA, AssociatedOffloadKind);
4287  ActionList DeviceActions = {BA, AA};
4288  return C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(DeviceActions,
4289  types::TY_CUDA_FATBIN);
4290  }
4291  return cast<JobAction>(BA);
4292  }
4293 
4294  JobAction *finalizeAMDGCNDependences(Action *Input,
4295  const llvm::Triple &TT) {
4296  auto *BA = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(
4297  C, Args, phases::Backend, Input, AssociatedOffloadKind);
4298 
4299  auto *AA = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, phases::Assemble,
4300  BA, AssociatedOffloadKind);
4301 
4302  ActionList AL = {AA};
4303  Action *LinkAction = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(AL, types::TY_Image);
4304  ActionList HIPActions = {LinkAction};
4305  JobAction *HIPFatBinary =
4306  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(HIPActions, types::TY_HIP_FATBIN);
4307  return HIPFatBinary;
4308  }
4309 
4310  public:
4311  SYCLActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
4312  const Driver::InputList &Inputs)
4313  : DeviceActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs, Action::OFK_SYCL) {}
4314 
4315  void withBoundArchForToolChain(const ToolChain *TC,
4316  llvm::function_ref<void(const char *)> Op) {
4317  for (auto &A : GpuArchList) {
4318  if (TC->getTriple() == A.first) {
4319  Op(Args.MakeArgString(A.second));
4320  return;
4321  }
4322  }
4323 
4324  // no bound arch for this toolchain
4325  Op(nullptr);
4326  }
4327 
4328  ActionBuilderReturnCode
4329  getDeviceDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA,
4330  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
4331  PhasesTy &Phases) override {
4332  bool SYCLDeviceOnly = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_only);
4333  if (CurPhase == phases::Preprocess) {
4334  // Do not perform the host compilation when doing preprocessing only
4335  // with -fsycl-device-only.
4336  bool IsPreprocessOnly =
4337  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_E) ||
4338  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_EP, options::OPT__SLASH_P) ||
4339  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_M, options::OPT_MM);
4340  if (IsPreprocessOnly) {
4341  for (auto TargetActionInfo :
4342  llvm::zip(SYCLDeviceActions, SYCLTargetInfoList)) {
4343  Action *&A = std::get<0>(TargetActionInfo);
4344  auto &TargetInfo = std::get<1>(TargetActionInfo);
4345  A = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, CurPhase, A,
4346  AssociatedOffloadKind);
4347  if (SYCLDeviceOnly)
4348  continue;
4349  // Add an additional compile action to generate the integration
4350  // header.
4351  Action *CompileAction =
4352  C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(A, types::TY_Nothing);
4353  DA.add(*CompileAction, *TargetInfo.TC, TargetInfo.BoundArch,
4354  Action::OFK_SYCL);
4355  }
4356  return SYCLDeviceOnly ? ABRT_Ignore_Host : ABRT_Success;
4357  }
4358  }
4359 
4360  // Device compilation generates LLVM BC.
4361  if (CurPhase == phases::Compile && !SYCLTargetInfoList.empty()) {
4362  Action *DeviceCompilerInput = nullptr;
4363  for (Action *&A : SYCLDeviceActions) {
4364  types::ID OutputType = types::TY_LLVM_BC;
4365  if ((SYCLDeviceOnly || Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm)) &&
4366  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_S))
4367  OutputType = types::TY_LLVM_IR;
4368  // Use of -fsycl-device-obj=spirv converts the original LLVM-IR
4369  // file to SPIR-V for later consumption.
4370  if ((SYCLDeviceOnly || FinalPhase != phases::Link) &&
4371  Args.getLastArgValue(options::OPT_fsycl_device_obj_EQ)
4372  .equals_insensitive("spirv")) {
4373  auto *CompileAction =
4374  C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(A, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4375  A = C.MakeAction<SPIRVTranslatorJobAction>(CompileAction,
4376  types::TY_SPIRV);
4377  if (SYCLDeviceOnly)
4378  continue;
4379  } else {
4380  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsyntax_only))
4381  OutputType = types::TY_Nothing;
4382  A = C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(A, OutputType);
4383  }
4384  DeviceCompilerInput = A;
4385  }
4386  const DeviceTargetInfo &DevTarget = SYCLTargetInfoList.back();
4387  DA.add(*DeviceCompilerInput, *DevTarget.TC, DevTarget.BoundArch,
4388  Action::OFK_SYCL);
4389  return SYCLDeviceOnly ? ABRT_Ignore_Host : ABRT_Success;
4390  }
4391 
4392  // Backend/Assemble actions are obsolete for the SYCL device side
4393  if (CurPhase == phases::Backend || CurPhase == phases::Assemble)
4394  return ABRT_Inactive;
4395 
4396  // The host only depends on device action in the linking phase, when all
4397  // the device images have to be embedded in the host image.
4398  if (CurPhase == phases::Link) {
4399  if (!SYCLDeviceActions.empty()) {
4400  assert(SYCLDeviceActions.size() == DeviceLinkerInputs.size() &&
4401  "Device action and device linker inputs sizes do not match.");
4402 
4403  for (auto TargetAction :
4404  llvm::zip(DeviceLinkerInputs, SYCLDeviceActions)) {
4405  ActionList &LinkerList = std::get<0>(TargetAction);
4406  Action *A = std::get<1>(TargetAction);
4407 
4408  LinkerList.push_back(A);
4409  }
4410  }
4411 
4412  // With -fsycl-link-targets, we will take the unbundled binaries
4413  // for each device and link them together to a single binary that will
4414  // be used in a split compilation step.
4415  if (CompileDeviceOnly && !SYCLDeviceActions.empty()) {
4416  for (auto SDA : SYCLDeviceActions)
4417  SYCLLinkBinaryList.push_back(SDA);
4418  if (WrapDeviceOnlyBinary) {
4419  // -fsycl-link behavior does the following to the unbundled device
4420  // binaries:
4421  // 1) Link them together using llvm-link
4422  // 2) Pass the linked binary through sycl-post-link
4423  // 3) Translate final .bc file to .spv
4424  // 4) Wrap the binary with the offload wrapper which can be used
4425  // by any compilation link step.
4426  auto *DeviceLinkAction = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(
4427  SYCLLinkBinaryList, types::TY_Image);
4428  ActionList FullSYCLLinkBinaryList;
4429  bool SYCLDeviceLibLinked = false;
4430  FullSYCLLinkBinaryList.push_back(DeviceLinkAction);
4431  // If used without the FPGA target, -fsycl-link is used to wrap
4432  // device objects for future host link. Device libraries should
4433  // be linked by default to resolve any undefined reference.
4434  const auto *TC = ToolChains.front();
4435  llvm::Triple TT(TC->getTriple());
4436  bool isAOT = TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga ||
4437  TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_gen ||
4438  TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_x86_64;
4439  if (TT.getSubArch() != llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga) {
4440  SYCLDeviceLibLinked =
4441  addSYCLDeviceLibs(TC, FullSYCLLinkBinaryList, true,
4442  C.getDefaultToolChain()
4443  .getTriple()
4444  .isWindowsMSVCEnvironment());
4445  }
4446 
4447  Action *FullDeviceLinkAction = nullptr;
4448  if (SYCLDeviceLibLinked)
4449  FullDeviceLinkAction = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(
4450  FullSYCLLinkBinaryList, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4451  else
4452  FullDeviceLinkAction = DeviceLinkAction;
4453  auto *PostLinkAction = C.MakeAction<SYCLPostLinkJobAction>(
4454  FullDeviceLinkAction, types::TY_LLVM_BC,
4455  types::TY_Tempfiletable);
4456  PostLinkAction->setRTSetsSpecConstants(!isAOT);
4457  auto *ExtractIRFilesAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4458  PostLinkAction, types::TY_Tempfilelist, types::TY_Tempfilelist);
4459  // single column w/o title fits TY_Tempfilelist format
4460  ExtractIRFilesAction->addExtractColumnTform(
4461  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE, false /*drop titles*/);
4462  auto *TranslateAction = C.MakeAction<SPIRVTranslatorJobAction>(
4463  ExtractIRFilesAction, types::TY_Tempfilelist);
4464 
4465  ActionList TformInputs{PostLinkAction, TranslateAction};
4466  auto *ReplaceFilesAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4467  TformInputs, types::TY_Tempfiletable, types::TY_Tempfiletable);
4468  ReplaceFilesAction->addReplaceColumnTform(
4469  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE,
4470  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE);
4471 
4472  SYCLLinkBinary = C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(
4473  ReplaceFilesAction, types::TY_Object);
4474  } else {
4475  auto *Link = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(SYCLLinkBinaryList,
4476  types::TY_Image);
4477  SYCLLinkBinary = C.MakeAction<SPIRVTranslatorJobAction>(
4478  Link, types::TY_Image);
4479  }
4480 
4481  // Remove the SYCL actions as they are already connected to an host
4482  // action or fat binary.
4483  SYCLDeviceActions.clear();
4484  // We avoid creating host action in device-only mode.
4485  return ABRT_Ignore_Host;
4486  }
4487 
4488  // We passed the device action as a host dependence, so we don't need to
4489  // do anything else with them.
4490  SYCLDeviceActions.clear();
4491  return ABRT_Success;
4492  }
4493 
4494  // By default, we produce an action for each device arch.
4495  auto TC = ToolChains.begin();
4496  for (Action *&A : SYCLDeviceActions) {
4497  if ((*TC)->getTriple().isNVPTX() && CurPhase >= phases::Backend) {
4498  // For CUDA, stop to emit LLVM IR so it can be linked later on.
4499  ++TC;
4500  continue;
4501  }
4502 
4503  A = C.getDriver().ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, CurPhase, A,
4504  AssociatedOffloadKind);
4505  ++TC;
4506  }
4507 
4508  return ABRT_Success;
4509  }
4510 
4511  ActionBuilderReturnCode addDeviceDepences(Action *HostAction) override {
4512 
4513  // If this is an input action replicate it for each SYCL toolchain.
4514  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(HostAction)) {
4515  SYCLDeviceActions.clear();
4516 
4517  // Options that are considered LinkerInput are not valid input actions
4518  // to the device tool chain.
4519  if (IA->getInputArg().getOption().hasFlag(options::LinkerInput))
4520  return ABRT_Inactive;
4521 
4522  std::string InputName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
4523  // Objects will be consumed as part of the partial link step when
4524  // dealing with offload static libraries
4525  if (C.getDriver().getOffloadStaticLibSeen() &&
4526  IA->getType() == types::TY_Object && isObjectFile(InputName))
4527  return ABRT_Inactive;
4528 
4529  // Libraries are not processed in the SYCL toolchain
4530  if (IA->getType() == types::TY_Object && !isObjectFile(InputName))
4531  return ABRT_Inactive;
4532 
4533  for (auto &TargetInfo : SYCLTargetInfoList) {
4534  (void)TargetInfo;
4535  SYCLDeviceActions.push_back(
4536  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(IA->getInputArg(), IA->getType()));
4537  }
4538  return ABRT_Success;
4539  }
4540 
4541  // If this is an unbundling action use it as is for each SYCL toolchain.
4542  if (auto *UA = dyn_cast<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(HostAction)) {
4543  SYCLDeviceActions.clear();
4544  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(UA->getInputs().back())) {
4545  // Options that are considered LinkerInput are not valid input actions
4546  // to the device tool chain.
4547  if (IA->getInputArg().getOption().hasFlag(options::LinkerInput))
4548  return ABRT_Inactive;
4549 
4550  std::string FileName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
4551  // Check if the type of the file is the same as the action. Do not
4552  // unbundle it if it is not. Do not unbundle .so files, for example,
4553  // which are not object files.
4554  if (IA->getType() == types::TY_Object) {
4555  if (!isObjectFile(FileName))
4556  return ABRT_Inactive;
4557  // For SYCL device libraries, don't need to add them to
4558  // FPGAObjectInputs as there is no FPGA dep files inside.
4559  const auto *TC = ToolChains.front();
4560  if (TC->getTriple().getSubArch() ==
4561  llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga &&
4562  !IsSYCLDeviceLibObj(FileName, C.getDefaultToolChain()
4563  .getTriple()
4564  .isWindowsMSVCEnvironment()))
4565  FPGAObjectInputs.push_back(IA);
4566  }
4567  }
4568  // Create 1 device action per triple/bound arch
4569  for (auto &TargetInfo : SYCLTargetInfoList) {
4570  SYCLDeviceActions.push_back(UA);
4571  UA->registerDependentActionInfo(TargetInfo.TC, TargetInfo.BoundArch,
4572  Action::OFK_SYCL);
4573  }
4574  return ABRT_Success;
4575  }
4576  return ABRT_Success;
4577  }
4578 
4579  // Actions that can only be appended after all Inputs have been processed
4580  // occur here. Not all offload actions are against single files.
4581  void appendTopLevelLinkAction(ActionList &AL) override {
4582  if (!SYCLLinkBinary)
4583  return;
4584 
4585  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences Dep;
4586  withBoundArchForToolChain(ToolChains.front(), [&](const char *BoundArch) {
4587  Dep.add(*SYCLLinkBinary, *ToolChains.front(), BoundArch,
4588  Action::OFK_SYCL);
4589  });
4590  AL.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(Dep, SYCLLinkBinary->getType()));
4591  SYCLLinkBinary = nullptr;
4592  }
4593 
4594  void appendTopLevelActions(ActionList &AL) override {
4595  if (SYCLDeviceActions.empty())
4596  return;
4597 
4598  // We should always have an action for each input.
4599  assert(SYCLDeviceActions.size() == SYCLTargetInfoList.size() &&
4600  "Number of SYCL actions and toolchains/boundarch pairs do not "
4601  "match.");
4602 
4603  // Append all device actions followed by the proper offload action.
4604  for (auto TargetActionInfo :
4605  llvm::zip(SYCLDeviceActions, SYCLTargetInfoList)) {
4606  Action *A = std::get<0>(TargetActionInfo);
4607  DeviceTargetInfo &TargetInfo = std::get<1>(TargetActionInfo);
4608 
4609  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences Dep;
4610  Dep.add(*A, *TargetInfo.TC, TargetInfo.BoundArch, Action::OFK_SYCL);
4611  AL.push_back(C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(Dep, A->getType()));
4612  }
4613  // We no longer need the action stored in this builder.
4614  SYCLDeviceActions.clear();
4615  }
4616 
4617  bool addSYCLDeviceLibs(const ToolChain *TC, ActionList &DeviceLinkObjects,
4618  bool isSpirvAOT, bool isMSVCEnv) {
4619  struct DeviceLibOptInfo {
4620  StringRef devicelib_name;
4621  StringRef devicelib_option;
4622  };
4623 
4624  bool NoDeviceLibs = false;
4625  int NumOfDeviceLibLinked = 0;
4626  // Currently, all SYCL device libraries will be linked by default. Linkage
4627  // of "internal" libraries cannot be affected via -fno-sycl-device-lib.
4628  llvm::StringMap<bool> devicelib_link_info = {{"libc", true},
4629  {"libm-fp32", true},
4630  {"libm-fp64", true},
4631  {"internal", true}};
4632  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_lib_EQ,
4633  options::OPT_fno_sycl_device_lib_EQ)) {
4634  if (A->getValues().size() == 0)
4635  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::warn_drv_empty_joined_argument)
4636  << A->getAsString(Args);
4637  else {
4638  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_fno_sycl_device_lib_EQ))
4639  NoDeviceLibs = true;
4640 
4641  for (StringRef Val : A->getValues()) {
4642  if (Val == "all") {
4643  for (const auto &K : devicelib_link_info.keys())
4644  devicelib_link_info[K] =
4645  true && (!NoDeviceLibs || K.equals("internal"));
4646  break;
4647  }
4648  auto LinkInfoIter = devicelib_link_info.find(Val);
4649  if (LinkInfoIter == devicelib_link_info.end() ||
4650  Val.equals("internal")) {
4651  // TODO: Move the diagnostic to the SYCL section of
4652  // Driver::CreateOffloadingDeviceToolChains() to minimize code
4653  // duplication.
4654  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_option_argument)
4655  << A->getOption().getName() << Val;
4656  }
4657  devicelib_link_info[Val] = true && !NoDeviceLibs;
4658  }
4659  }
4660  }
4661 
4662  const toolchains::SYCLToolChain *SYCLTC =
4663  static_cast<const toolchains::SYCLToolChain *>(TC);
4664  SmallVector<SmallString<128>, 4> LibLocCandidates;
4665  SYCLTC->SYCLInstallation.getSYCLDeviceLibPath(LibLocCandidates);
4666  StringRef LibSuffix = isMSVCEnv ? ".obj" : ".o";
4667  using SYCLDeviceLibsList = SmallVector<DeviceLibOptInfo, 5>;
4668  const SYCLDeviceLibsList sycl_device_wrapper_libs = {
4669  {"libsycl-crt", "libc"},
4670  {"libsycl-complex", "libm-fp32"},
4671  {"libsycl-complex-fp64", "libm-fp64"},
4672  {"libsycl-cmath", "libm-fp32"},
4673  {"libsycl-cmath-fp64", "libm-fp64"}};
4674  // For AOT compilation, we need to link sycl_device_fallback_libs as
4675  // default too.
4676  const SYCLDeviceLibsList sycl_device_fallback_libs = {
4677  {"libsycl-fallback-cassert", "libc"},
4678  {"libsycl-fallback-cstring", "libc"},
4679  {"libsycl-fallback-complex", "libm-fp32"},
4680  {"libsycl-fallback-complex-fp64", "libm-fp64"},
4681  {"libsycl-fallback-cmath", "libm-fp32"},
4682  {"libsycl-fallback-cmath-fp64", "libm-fp64"}};
4683  // ITT annotation libraries are linked in separately whenever the device
4684  // code instrumentation is enabled.
4685  const SYCLDeviceLibsList sycl_device_annotation_libs = {
4686  {"libsycl-itt-user-wrappers", "internal"},
4687  {"libsycl-itt-compiler-wrappers", "internal"},
4688  {"libsycl-itt-stubs", "internal"}};
4689  auto addInputs = [&](const SYCLDeviceLibsList &LibsList) {
4690  bool LibLocSelected = false;
4691  for (const auto &LLCandidate : LibLocCandidates) {
4692  if (LibLocSelected)
4693  break;
4694  for (const DeviceLibOptInfo &Lib : LibsList) {
4695  if (!devicelib_link_info[Lib.devicelib_option])
4696  continue;
4697  SmallString<128> LibName(LLCandidate);
4698  llvm::sys::path::append(LibName, Lib.devicelib_name);
4699  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(LibName, LibSuffix);
4700  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(LibName)) {
4701  ++NumOfDeviceLibLinked;
4702  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, C.getDriver().getOpts(),
4703  Args.MakeArgString(LibName));
4704  auto *SYCLDeviceLibsInputAction =
4705  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, types::TY_Object);
4706  auto *SYCLDeviceLibsUnbundleAction =
4707  C.MakeAction<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(
4708  SYCLDeviceLibsInputAction);
4709  addDeviceDepences(SYCLDeviceLibsUnbundleAction);
4710  DeviceLinkObjects.push_back(SYCLDeviceLibsUnbundleAction);
4711  if (!LibLocSelected)
4712  LibLocSelected = !LibLocSelected;
4713  }
4714  }
4715  }
4716  };
4717  addInputs(sycl_device_wrapper_libs);
4718  if (isSpirvAOT)
4719  addInputs(sycl_device_fallback_libs);
4720  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_instrument_device_code))
4721  addInputs(sycl_device_annotation_libs);
4722  return NumOfDeviceLibLinked != 0;
4723  }
4724 
4725  void appendLinkDependences(OffloadAction::DeviceDependences &DA) override {
4726  // DeviceLinkerInputs holds binaries per ToolChain (TC) / bound-arch pair
4727  // The following will loop link and post process for each TC / bound-arch
4728  // to produce a final binary.
4729  // They will be bundled per TC before being sent to the Offload Wrapper.
4730  llvm::MapVector<const ToolChain *, ActionList> LinkedInputs;
4731  for (auto LinkInputEnum : enumerate(DeviceLinkerInputs)) {
4732  auto &LI = LinkInputEnum.value();
4733  const ToolChain *TC = SYCLTargetInfoList[LinkInputEnum.index()].TC;
4734  const char *BoundArch =
4735  SYCLTargetInfoList[LinkInputEnum.index()].BoundArch;
4736 
4737  auto TripleIt = llvm::find_if(SYCLTripleList, [&](auto &SYCLTriple) {
4738  return SYCLTriple == TC->getTriple();
4739  });
4740  if (TripleIt == SYCLTripleList.end()) {
4741  // If the toolchain's triple is absent in this "main" triple
4742  // collection, this means it was created specifically for one of
4743  // the SYCL AOT inputs. Those will be handled separately.
4744  continue;
4745  }
4746  if (LI.empty())
4747  // Current list is empty, nothing to process.
4748  continue;
4749 
4750  ActionList DeviceLibObjects;
4751  ActionList LinkObjects;
4752  auto TT = TC->getTriple();
4753  auto isNVPTX = TT.isNVPTX();
4754  auto isAMDGCN = TT.isAMDGCN();
4755  auto isSPIR = TT.isSPIR();
4756  bool isSpirvAOT = TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga ||
4757  TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_gen ||
4758  TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_x86_64;
4759  for (const auto &Input : LI) {
4760  if (TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga &&
4761  types::isFPGA(Input->getType())) {
4762  assert(BoundArch == nullptr &&
4763  "fpga triple bounded arch not nullptr");
4764  // FPGA aoco does not go through the link, everything else does.
4765  if (Input->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCO) {
4766  DeviceLibObjects.push_back(Input);
4767  continue;
4768  }
4769  // FPGA aocr/aocx does not go through the link and is passed
4770  // directly to the backend compilation step (aocr) or wrapper (aocx)
4771  Action *FPGAAOTAction;
4772  if (Input->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR ||
4773  Input->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU)
4774  // Generate AOCX/AOCR
4775  FPGAAOTAction =
4776  C.MakeAction<BackendCompileJobAction>(Input, FPGAOutType);
4777  else if (Input->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCX)
4778  FPGAAOTAction = Input;
4779  else
4780  llvm_unreachable("Unexpected FPGA input type.");
4781  auto *RenameAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4782  FPGAAOTAction, types::TY_Tempfilelist, types::TY_Tempfilelist);
4783  RenameAction->addRenameColumnTform(
4784  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_ZERO,
4785  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE);
4786  auto *DeviceWrappingAction = C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(
4787  RenameAction, types::TY_Object);
4788  DA.add(*DeviceWrappingAction, *TC, BoundArch, Action::OFK_SYCL);
4789  continue;
4790  } else if (!types::isFPGA(Input->getType())) {
4791  // No need for any conversion if we are coming in from the
4792  // clang-offload-deps or regular compilation path.
4793  if (isNVPTX || isAMDGCN || ContainsOffloadDepsAction(Input) ||
4794  ContainsCompileOrAssembleAction(Input)) {
4795  LinkObjects.push_back(Input);
4796  continue;
4797  }
4798  Action *ConvertSPIRVAction =
4799  C.MakeAction<SpirvToIrWrapperJobAction>(
4800  Input, Input->getType() == types::TY_Tempfilelist
4801  ? types::TY_Tempfilelist
4802  : types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4803  LinkObjects.push_back(ConvertSPIRVAction);
4804  }
4805  }
4806  if (LinkObjects.empty())
4807  continue;
4808 
4809  // The linkage actions subgraph leading to the offload wrapper.
4810  // [cond] Means incoming/outgoing dependence is created only when cond
4811  // is true. A function of:
4812  // n - target is NVPTX/AMDGCN
4813  // a - SPIRV AOT compilation is requested
4814  // s - device code split requested
4815  // * - "all other cases"
4816  // - no condition means output/input is "always" present
4817  // First symbol indicates output/input type
4818  // . - single file output (TY_SPIRV, TY_LLVM_BC,...)
4819  // - - TY_Tempfilelist
4820  // + - TY_Tempfiletable
4821  //
4822  // .-----------------.
4823  // |Link(LinkObjects)|
4824  // .-----------------.
4825  // |
4826  // .--------------------------------------.
4827  // | PostLink |
4828  // .--------------------------------------.
4829  // [+*] [+]
4830  // | |
4831  // .-----------------. |
4832  // | FileTableTform | |
4833  // | (extract "Code")| |
4834  // .-----------------. |
4835  // [-] |
4836  // --------------------| |
4837  // [.] [-*] |
4838  // .---------------. .-------------------. |
4839  // | finalizeNVPTX | | SPIRVTranslator | |
4840  // | finalizeAMDGCN | | | |
4841  // .---------------. .-------------------. |
4842  // [.] [-as] [-!a] |
4843  // | | | |
4844  // | [-s] | |
4845  // | .----------------. | |
4846  // | | BackendCompile | | |
4847  // | .----------------. | |
4848  // | [-s] | |
4849  // | | | |
4850  // | [-a] [-!a] [+]
4851  // | .--------------------.
4852  // -----------[-n]| FileTableTform |
4853  // | (replace "Code") |
4854  // .--------------------.
4855  // |
4856  // [+*]
4857  // .--------------------------------------.
4858  // | OffloadWrapper |
4859  // .--------------------------------------.
4860  //
4861  Action *DeviceLinkAction =
4862  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(LinkObjects, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4863  ActionList FullLinkObjects;
4864  bool SYCLDeviceLibLinked = false;
4865  FullLinkObjects.push_back(DeviceLinkAction);
4866 
4867  // FIXME: Link all wrapper and fallback device libraries as default,
4868  // When spv online link is supported by all backends, the fallback
4869  // device libraries are only needed when current toolchain is using
4870  // AOT compilation.
4871  if (isSPIR) {
4872  SYCLDeviceLibLinked = addSYCLDeviceLibs(
4873  TC, FullLinkObjects, isSpirvAOT,
4874  C.getDefaultToolChain().getTriple().isWindowsMSVCEnvironment());
4875  }
4876 
4877  Action *FullDeviceLinkAction = nullptr;
4878  if (SYCLDeviceLibLinked)
4879  FullDeviceLinkAction =
4880  C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(FullLinkObjects, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
4881  else
4882  FullDeviceLinkAction = DeviceLinkAction;
4883 
4884  // reflects whether current target is ahead-of-time and can't support
4885  // runtime setting of specialization constants
4886  bool isAOT = isNVPTX || isAMDGCN || isSpirvAOT;
4887 
4888  ActionList WrapperInputs;
4889  // post link is not optional - even if not splitting, always need to
4890  // process specialization constants
4891 
4892  types::ID PostLinkOutType =
4893  isSPIR ? types::TY_Tempfiletable : FullDeviceLinkAction->getType();
4894  // For SPIR-V targets, force TY_Tempfiletable.
4895  auto *PostLinkAction = C.MakeAction<SYCLPostLinkJobAction>(
4896  FullDeviceLinkAction, PostLinkOutType, types::TY_Tempfiletable);
4897  PostLinkAction->setRTSetsSpecConstants(!isAOT);
4898 
4899  auto *ExtractIRFilesAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4900  PostLinkAction,
4901  isSPIR ? types::TY_Tempfilelist : PostLinkAction->getType(),
4902  types::TY_Tempfilelist);
4903  // single column w/o title fits TY_Tempfilelist format
4904  ExtractIRFilesAction->addExtractColumnTform(
4905  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE, false /*drop titles*/);
4906 
4907  if (isNVPTX || isAMDGCN) {
4908  JobAction *FinAction =
4909  isNVPTX ? finalizeNVPTXDependences(ExtractIRFilesAction,
4910  TC->getTriple())
4911  : finalizeAMDGCNDependences(ExtractIRFilesAction,
4912  TC->getTriple());
4913  auto *ForEachWrapping = C.MakeAction<ForEachWrappingAction>(
4914  ExtractIRFilesAction, FinAction);
4915 
4916  ActionList TformInputs{PostLinkAction, ForEachWrapping};
4917  auto *ReplaceFilesAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4918  TformInputs, types::TY_Tempfiletable, types::TY_Tempfiletable);
4919  ReplaceFilesAction->addReplaceColumnTform(
4920  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE,
4921  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE);
4922 
4923  WrapperInputs.push_back(ReplaceFilesAction);
4924  } else {
4925  // For SPIRV-based targets - translate to SPIRV then optionally
4926  // compile ahead-of-time to native architecture
4927  Action *BuildCodeAction =
4928  (Action *)C.MakeAction<SPIRVTranslatorJobAction>(
4929  ExtractIRFilesAction, types::TY_Tempfilelist);
4930 
4931  // After the Link, wrap the files before the final host link
4932  if (isAOT) {
4933  types::ID OutType = types::TY_Tempfilelist;
4934  if (!DeviceCodeSplit) {
4935  OutType = (TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga)
4936  ? FPGAOutType
4937  : types::TY_Image;
4938  }
4939  // Do the additional Ahead of Time compilation when the specific
4940  // triple calls for it (provided a valid subarch).
4941  ActionList BEInputs;
4942  BEInputs.push_back(BuildCodeAction);
4943  auto unbundleAdd = [&](Action *A, types::ID T) {
4944  ActionList AL;
4945  AL.push_back(A);
4946  Action *UnbundleAction =
4947  C.MakeAction<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(AL, T);
4948  BEInputs.push_back(UnbundleAction);
4949  };
4950  // Send any known objects/archives through the unbundler to grab the
4951  // dependency file associated. This is only done for -fintelfpga.
4952  for (Action *A : FPGAObjectInputs)
4953  unbundleAdd(A, types::TY_FPGA_Dependencies);
4954  for (Action *A : FPGAArchiveInputs)
4955  unbundleAdd(A, types::TY_FPGA_Dependencies_List);
4956  for (const auto &A : DeviceLibObjects)
4957  BEInputs.push_back(A);
4958  BuildCodeAction =
4959  C.MakeAction<BackendCompileJobAction>(BEInputs, OutType);
4960  }
4961  ActionList TformInputs{PostLinkAction, BuildCodeAction};
4962  auto *ReplaceFilesAction = C.MakeAction<FileTableTformJobAction>(
4963  TformInputs, types::TY_Tempfiletable, types::TY_Tempfiletable);
4964  ReplaceFilesAction->addReplaceColumnTform(
4965  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE,
4966  FileTableTformJobAction::COL_CODE);
4967  WrapperInputs.push_back(ReplaceFilesAction);
4968  }
4969 
4970  // After the Link, wrap the files before the final host link
4971  auto *DeviceWrappingAction = C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(
4972  WrapperInputs, types::TY_Object);
4973 
4974  if (isSpirvAOT)
4975  DA.add(*DeviceWrappingAction, *TC, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr,
4976  Action::OFK_SYCL);
4977  else
4978  withBoundArchForToolChain(TC, [&](const char *BoundArch) {
4979  DA.add(*DeviceWrappingAction, *TC, BoundArch, Action::OFK_SYCL);
4980  });
4981  }
4982 
4983  for (auto &SAI : SYCLAOTInputs) {
4984  // Extract binary file name
4985  std::string FN(SAI.second);
4986  const char *FNStr = Args.MakeArgString(FN);
4987  Arg *myArg = Args.MakeSeparateArg(
4988  nullptr, C.getDriver().getOpts().getOption(options::OPT_INPUT),
4989  FNStr);
4990  auto *SYCLAdd =
4991  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*myArg, types::TY_SYCL_FATBIN);
4992  auto *DeviceWrappingAction =
4993  C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(SYCLAdd, types::TY_Object);
4994 
4995  // Extract the target triple for this binary
4996  llvm::Triple TT(SAI.first);
4997  // Extract the toolchain for this target triple
4998  auto SYCLDeviceTC = llvm::find_if(
4999  ToolChains, [&](auto &TC) { return TC->getTriple() == TT; });
5000  assert(SYCLDeviceTC != ToolChains.end() &&
5001  "No toolchain found for this AOT input");
5002 
5003  DA.add(*DeviceWrappingAction, **SYCLDeviceTC,
5004  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Action::OFK_SYCL);
5005  }
5006  }
5007 
5008  void addDeviceLinkDependencies(OffloadDepsJobAction *DA) override {
5009  unsigned I = 0;
5010  for (auto &TargetInfo : SYCLTargetInfoList) {
5011  DA->registerDependentActionInfo(TargetInfo.TC, TargetInfo.BoundArch,
5012  Action::OFK_SYCL);
5013  DeviceLinkerInputs[I++].push_back(DA);
5014  }
5015  }
5016 
5017  /// Initialize the GPU architecture list from arguments - this populates
5018  /// `GpuArchList` from `--offload-arch` flags. Only relevant if compiling to
5019  /// CUDA or AMDGCN. Return true if any initialization errors are found.
5020  /// FIXME: "offload-arch" and the BoundArch mechanism should also be
5021  // used in the SYCLToolChain for SPIR-V AOT to track the offload
5022  // architecture instead of the Triple sub-arch it currently uses.
5023  bool initializeGpuArchMap() {
5024  const OptTable &Opts = C.getDriver().getOpts();
5025  for (auto *A : Args) {
5026  unsigned Index;
5027  llvm::Triple *TargetBE = nullptr;
5028 
5029  auto GetTripleIt = [&, this](llvm::StringRef Triple) {
5030  llvm::Triple TargetTriple{Triple};
5031  auto TripleIt = llvm::find_if(SYCLTripleList, [&](auto &SYCLTriple) {
5032  return SYCLTriple == TargetTriple;
5033  });
5034  return TripleIt != SYCLTripleList.end() ? &*TripleIt : nullptr;
5035  };
5036 
5037  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Xsycl_backend_EQ)) {
5038  TargetBE = GetTripleIt(A->getValue(0));
5039  // Passing device args: -Xsycl-target-backend=<triple> -opt=val.
5040  if (TargetBE)
5041  Index = Args.getBaseArgs().MakeIndex(A->getValue(1));
5042  else
5043  continue;
5044  } else if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_Xsycl_backend)) {
5045  if (SYCLTripleList.size() > 1) {
5046  C.getDriver().Diag(diag::err_drv_Xsycl_target_missing_triple)
5047  << A->getSpelling();
5048  continue;
5049  }
5050  // Passing device args: -Xsycl-target-backend -opt=val.
5051  TargetBE = &SYCLTripleList.front();
5052  Index = Args.getBaseArgs().MakeIndex(A->getValue(0));
5053  } else
5054  continue;
5055 
5056  A->claim();
5057  auto ParsedArg = Opts.ParseOneArg(Args, Index);
5058 
5059  // TODO: Support --no-cuda-gpu-arch, --{,no-}cuda-gpu-arch=all.
5060  if (ParsedArg &&
5061  ParsedArg->getOption().matches(options::OPT_offload_arch_EQ)) {
5062  const char *ArchStr = ParsedArg->getValue(0);
5063  if (TargetBE->isNVPTX()) {
5064  // CUDA arch also applies to AMDGCN ...
5065  CudaArch Arch = StringToCudaArch(ArchStr);
5066  if (Arch == CudaArch::UNKNOWN || !IsNVIDIAGpuArch(Arch)) {
5067  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_cuda_bad_gpu_arch)
5068  << ArchStr;
5069  continue;
5070  }
5071  ArchStr = CudaArchToString(Arch);
5072  } else if (TargetBE->isAMDGCN()) {
5073  llvm::StringMap<bool> Features;
5074  auto Arch = parseTargetID(
5075  *getHIPOffloadTargetTriple(C.getDriver(), C.getInputArgs()),
5076  ArchStr, &Features);
5077  if (!Arch) {
5078  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_bad_target_id) << ArchStr;
5079  continue;
5080  }
5081  auto CanId = getCanonicalTargetID(Arch.getValue(), Features);
5082  ArchStr = Args.MakeArgStringRef(CanId);
5083  }
5084  ParsedArg->claim();
5085  GpuArchList.emplace_back(*TargetBE, ArchStr);
5086  }
5087  }
5088 
5089  // Handle defaults architectures
5090  for (auto &Triple : SYCLTripleList) {
5091  // For NVIDIA use SM_50 as a default
5092  if (Triple.isNVPTX() && llvm::none_of(GpuArchList, [&](auto &P) {
5093  return P.first.isNVPTX();
5094  })) {
5095  const char *DefaultArch = CudaArchToString(CudaArch::SM_50);
5096  GpuArchList.emplace_back(Triple, DefaultArch);
5097  }
5098 
5099  // For AMD require the architecture to be set by the user
5100  if (Triple.isAMDGCN() && llvm::none_of(GpuArchList, [&](auto &P) {
5101  return P.first.isAMDGCN();
5102  })) {
5103  C.getDriver().Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_sycl_missing_amdgpu_arch);
5104  return true;
5105  }
5106  }
5107 
5108  return false;
5109  }
5110 
5111  bool initialize() override {
5112  // Get the SYCL toolchains. If we don't get any, the action builder will
5113  // know there is nothing to do related to SYCL offloading.
5114  auto SYCLTCRange = C.getOffloadToolChains<Action::OFK_SYCL>();
5115  for (auto TI = SYCLTCRange.first, TE = SYCLTCRange.second; TI != TE;
5116  ++TI)
5117  ToolChains.push_back(TI->second);
5118 
5119  // Nothing to offload if no SYCL Toolchain
5120  if (ToolChains.empty())
5121  return false;
5122 
5123  Arg *SYCLLinkTargets = Args.getLastArg(
5124  options::OPT_fsycl_link_targets_EQ);
5125  WrapDeviceOnlyBinary = Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ);
5126  auto *DeviceCodeSplitArg =
5127  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_code_split_EQ);
5128  // -fsycl-device-code-split is an alias to
5129  // -fsycl-device-code-split=auto
5130  DeviceCodeSplit = DeviceCodeSplitArg &&
5131  DeviceCodeSplitArg->getValue() != StringRef("off");
5132  // Gather information about the SYCL Ahead of Time targets. The targets
5133  // are determined on the SubArch values passed along in the triple.
5134  Arg *SYCLTargets =
5135  C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_targets_EQ);
5136  Arg *SYCLAddTargets = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_add_targets_EQ);
5137  bool HasValidSYCLRuntime = C.getInputArgs().hasFlag(
5138  options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false);
5139  bool SYCLfpgaTriple = false;
5140  bool ShouldAddDefaultTriple = true;
5141  bool GpuInitHasErrors = false;
5142  bool HasSYCLTargetsOption =
5143  SYCLAddTargets || SYCLTargets || SYCLLinkTargets;
5144  if (HasSYCLTargetsOption) {
5145  if (SYCLTargets || SYCLLinkTargets) {
5146  Arg *SYCLTargetsValues = SYCLTargets ? SYCLTargets : SYCLLinkTargets;
5147  // Fill SYCLTripleList
5148  llvm::StringMap<StringRef> FoundNormalizedTriples;
5149  for (const char *Val : SYCLTargetsValues->getValues()) {
5150  llvm::Triple TT(C.getDriver().MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(Val));
5151  std::string NormalizedName = TT.normalize();
5152 
5153  // Make sure we don't have a duplicate triple.
5154  auto Duplicate = FoundNormalizedTriples.find(NormalizedName);
5155  if (Duplicate != FoundNormalizedTriples.end())
5156  continue;
5157 
5158  // Store the current triple so that we can check for duplicates in
5159  // the following iterations.
5160  FoundNormalizedTriples[NormalizedName] = Val;
5161 
5162  SYCLTripleList.push_back(TT);
5163  if (TT.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga)
5164  SYCLfpgaTriple = true;
5165  }
5166 
5167  // Fill GpuArchList, end if there are issues in initializingGpuArchMap
5168  GpuInitHasErrors = initializeGpuArchMap();
5169  if (GpuInitHasErrors)
5170  return true;
5171 
5172  int I = 0;
5173  // Fill SYCLTargetInfoList
5174  for (auto TT : SYCLTripleList) {
5175  auto TCIt = llvm::find_if(
5176  ToolChains, [&](auto &TC) { return TT == TC->getTriple(); });
5177  assert(TCIt != ToolChains.end() &&
5178  "Toolchain was not created for this platform");
5179  if (!TT.isNVPTX() && !TT.isAMDGCN())
5180  SYCLTargetInfoList.emplace_back(*TCIt, nullptr);
5181  else {
5182  SYCLTargetInfoList.emplace_back(*TCIt, GpuArchList[I].second);
5183  ++I;
5184  }
5185  }
5186  }
5187  if (SYCLAddTargets) {
5188  for (StringRef Val : SYCLAddTargets->getValues()) {
5189  // Parse out the Triple and Input (triple:binary). At this point,
5190  // the format has already been validated at the Driver level.
5191  // Populate the pairs. Each of these will be wrapped and fed
5192  // into the final binary.
5193  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> I = Val.split(':');
5194  llvm::Triple TT(I.first);
5195 
5196  auto TCIt = llvm::find_if(
5197  ToolChains, [&](auto &TC) { return TT == TC->getTriple(); });
5198  assert(TCIt != ToolChains.end() &&
5199  "Toolchain was not created for this platform");
5200 
5201  const char *TF = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(I.second);
5202  // populate the AOT binary inputs vector.
5203  SYCLAOTInputs.push_back(std::make_pair(TT, TF));
5204  ShouldAddDefaultTriple = false;
5205  }
5206  }
5207  } else if (HasValidSYCLRuntime) {
5208  // -fsycl is provided without -fsycl-*targets.
5209  bool SYCLfpga = C.getInputArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fintelfpga);
5210  // -fsycl -fintelfpga implies spir64_fpga
5211  const char *SYCLTargetArch =
5212  SYCLfpga ? "spir64_fpga" : getDefaultSYCLArch(C);
5213  llvm::Triple TT = C.getDriver().MakeSYCLDeviceTriple(SYCLTargetArch);
5214  auto TCIt = llvm::find_if(
5215  ToolChains, [&](auto &TC) { return TT == TC->getTriple(); });
5216  assert(TCIt != ToolChains.end() &&
5217  "Toolchain was not created for this platform");
5218  SYCLTripleList.push_back(TT);
5219  SYCLTargetInfoList.emplace_back(*TCIt, nullptr);
5220  if (SYCLfpga)
5221  SYCLfpgaTriple = true;
5222  }
5223 
5224  // Device only compilation for -fsycl-link (no FPGA) and
5225  // -fsycl-link-targets
5226  CompileDeviceOnly =
5227  (SYCLLinkTargets || (WrapDeviceOnlyBinary && !SYCLfpgaTriple));
5228 
5229  // Set the FPGA output type based on command line (-fsycl-link).
5230  if (auto *A = C.getInputArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ)) {
5231  FPGAOutType = (A->getValue() == StringRef("early"))
5232  ? types::TY_FPGA_AOCR
5233  : types::TY_FPGA_AOCX;
5234  if (C.getDriver().isFPGAEmulationMode())
5235  FPGAOutType = (A->getValue() == StringRef("early"))
5236  ? types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU
5237  : types::TY_FPGA_AOCX;
5238  }
5239 
5240  // Populate FPGA static archives that could contain dep files to be
5241  // incorporated into the aoc compilation
5242  if (SYCLfpgaTriple && Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fintelfpga)) {
5243  SmallVector<const char *, 16> LinkArgs(getLinkerArgs(C, Args));
5244  for (StringRef LA : LinkArgs) {
5245  if (isStaticArchiveFile(LA) && hasOffloadSections(C, LA, Args)) {
5246  const llvm::opt::OptTable &Opts = C.getDriver().getOpts();
5247  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, Args.MakeArgString(LA));
5248  Action *Current =
5249  C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, types::TY_Archive);
5250  FPGAArchiveInputs.push_back(Current);
5251  }
5252  }
5253  }
5254 
5255  if (ShouldAddDefaultTriple && addSYCLDefaultTriple(C, SYCLTripleList)) {
5256  // If a SYCLDefaultTriple is added to SYCLTripleList,
5257  // add new target to SYCLTargetInfoList
5258  llvm::Triple TT = SYCLTripleList.front();
5259  auto TCIt = llvm::find_if(
5260  ToolChains, [&](auto &TC) { return TT == TC->getTriple(); });
5261  SYCLTargetInfoList.emplace_back(*TCIt, nullptr);
5262  }
5263  if (SYCLTargetInfoList.empty()) {
5264  // If there are no SYCL Targets add the front toolchain, this is for
5265  // `-fsycl-device-only` is provided with no `fsycl` or when all dummy
5266  // targets are given
5267  const auto *TC = ToolChains.front();
5268  SYCLTargetInfoList.emplace_back(TC, nullptr);
5269  }
5270  DeviceLinkerInputs.resize(SYCLTargetInfoList.size());
5271  return false;
5272  }
5273 
5274  bool canUseBundlerUnbundler() const override {
5275  // SYCL should use bundled files whenever possible.
5276  return true;
5277  }
5278  };
5279 
5280  ///
5281  /// TODO: Add the implementation for other specialized builders here.
5282  ///
5283 
5284  /// Specialized builders being used by this offloading action builder.
5285  SmallVector<DeviceActionBuilder *, 4> SpecializedBuilders;
5286 
5287  /// Flag set to true if all valid builders allow file bundling/unbundling.
5288  bool CanUseBundler;
5289 
5290 public:
5291  OffloadingActionBuilder(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
5292  const Driver::InputList &Inputs)
5293  : C(C) {
5294  // Create a specialized builder for each device toolchain.
5295 
5296  IsValid = true;
5297 
5298  // Create a specialized builder for CUDA.
5299  SpecializedBuilders.push_back(new CudaActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs));
5300 
5301  // Create a specialized builder for HIP.
5302  SpecializedBuilders.push_back(new HIPActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs));
5303 
5304  // Create a specialized builder for OpenMP.
5305  SpecializedBuilders.push_back(new OpenMPActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs));
5306 
5307  // Create a specialized builder for SYCL.
5308  SpecializedBuilders.push_back(new SYCLActionBuilder(C, Args, Inputs));
5309 
5310  //
5311  // TODO: Build other specialized builders here.
5312  //
5313 
5314  // Initialize all the builders, keeping track of errors. If all valid
5315  // builders agree that we can use bundling, set the flag to true.
5316  unsigned ValidBuilders = 0u;
5317  unsigned ValidBuildersSupportingBundling = 0u;
5318  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5319  IsValid = IsValid && !SB->initialize();
5320 
5321  // Update the counters if the builder is valid.
5322  if (SB->isValid()) {
5323  ++ValidBuilders;
5324  if (SB->canUseBundlerUnbundler())
5325  ++ValidBuildersSupportingBundling;
5326  }
5327  }
5328  CanUseBundler =
5329  ValidBuilders && ValidBuilders == ValidBuildersSupportingBundling;
5330  }
5331 
5332  ~OffloadingActionBuilder() {
5333  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders)
5334  delete SB;
5335  }
5336 
5337  /// Record a host action and its originating input argument.
5338  void recordHostAction(Action *HostAction, const Arg *InputArg) {
5339  assert(HostAction && "Invalid host action");
5340  assert(InputArg && "Invalid input argument");
5341  auto Loc = HostActionToInputArgMap.find(HostAction);
5342  if (Loc == HostActionToInputArgMap.end())
5343  HostActionToInputArgMap[HostAction] = InputArg;
5344  assert(HostActionToInputArgMap[HostAction] == InputArg &&
5345  "host action mapped to multiple input arguments");
5346  }
5347 
5348  /// Generate an action that adds device dependences (if any) to a host action.
5349  /// If no device dependence actions exist, just return the host action \a
5350  /// HostAction. If an error is found or if no builder requires the host action
5351  /// to be generated, return nullptr.
5352  Action *
5353  addDeviceDependencesToHostAction(Action *HostAction, const Arg *InputArg,
5354  phases::ID CurPhase, phases::ID FinalPhase,
5355  DeviceActionBuilder::PhasesTy &Phases) {
5356  if (!IsValid)
5357  return nullptr;
5358 
5359  if (SpecializedBuilders.empty())
5360  return HostAction;
5361 
5362  assert(HostAction && "Invalid host action!");
5363  recordHostAction(HostAction, InputArg);
5364 
5365  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDeps;
5366  // Check if all the programming models agree we should not emit the host
5367  // action. Also, keep track of the offloading kinds employed.
5368  auto &OffloadKind = InputArgToOffloadKindMap[InputArg];
5369  unsigned InactiveBuilders = 0u;
5370  unsigned IgnoringBuilders = 0u;
5371  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5372  if (!SB->isValid()) {
5373  ++InactiveBuilders;
5374  continue;
5375  }
5376 
5377  auto RetCode =
5378  SB->getDeviceDependences(DDeps, CurPhase, FinalPhase, Phases);
5379 
5380  // If the builder explicitly says the host action should be ignored,
5381  // we need to increment the variable that tracks the builders that request
5382  // the host object to be ignored.
5383  if (RetCode == DeviceActionBuilder::ABRT_Ignore_Host)
5384  ++IgnoringBuilders;
5385 
5386  // Unless the builder was inactive for this action, we have to record the
5387  // offload kind because the host will have to use it.
5388  if (RetCode != DeviceActionBuilder::ABRT_Inactive)
5389  OffloadKind |= SB->getAssociatedOffloadKind();
5390  }
5391 
5392  // If all builders agree that the host object should be ignored, just return
5393  // nullptr.
5394  if (IgnoringBuilders &&
5395  SpecializedBuilders.size() == (InactiveBuilders + IgnoringBuilders))
5396  return nullptr;
5397 
5398  if (DDeps.getActions().empty())
5399  return HostAction;
5400 
5401  // We have dependences we need to bundle together. We use an offload action
5402  // for that.
5403  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
5404  *HostAction, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
5405  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, DDeps);
5406  return C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(HDep, DDeps);
5407  }
5408 
5409  // Update Input action to reflect FPGA device archive specifics based
5410  // on archive contents.
5411  bool updateInputForFPGA(Action *&A, const Arg *InputArg,
5412  DerivedArgList &Args) {
5413  std::string InputName = InputArg->getAsString(Args);
5414  const Driver &D = C.getDriver();
5415  bool IsFPGAEmulation = D.isFPGAEmulationMode();
5416  // Only check for FPGA device information when using fpga SubArch.
5417  if (A->getType() == types::TY_Object && isObjectFile(InputName))
5418  return true;
5419 
5420  auto ArchiveTypeMismatch = [&D, &InputName](bool EmitDiag) {
5421  if (EmitDiag)
5422  D.Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_mismatch_fpga_archive) << InputName;
5423  };
5424  // Type FPGA aoco is a special case for static archives
5425  if (A->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCO) {
5426  if (!hasFPGABinary(C, InputName, types::TY_FPGA_AOCO))
5427  return false;
5428  A = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, types::TY_FPGA_AOCO);
5429  return true;
5430  }
5431 
5432  // Type FPGA aocx is considered the same way for Hardware and Emulation.
5433  if (hasFPGABinary(C, InputName, types::TY_FPGA_AOCX)) {
5434  A = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, types::TY_FPGA_AOCX);
5435  return true;
5436  }
5437 
5438  SmallVector<std::pair<types::ID, bool>, 4> FPGAAOCTypes = {
5439  {types::TY_FPGA_AOCR, false},
5440  {types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU, true}};
5441  for (const auto &ArchiveType : FPGAAOCTypes) {
5442  bool BinaryFound = hasFPGABinary(C, InputName, ArchiveType.first);
5443  if (BinaryFound && ArchiveType.second == IsFPGAEmulation) {
5444  // Binary matches check and emulation type, we keep this one.
5445  A = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, ArchiveType.first);
5446  return true;
5447  }
5448  ArchiveTypeMismatch(BinaryFound && ArchiveType.second != IsFPGAEmulation);
5449  }
5450  return true;
5451  }
5452 
5453  /// Generate an action that adds a host dependence to a device action. The
5454  /// results will be kept in this action builder. Return true if an error was
5455  /// found.
5456  bool addHostDependenceToDeviceActions(Action *&HostAction,
5457  const Arg *InputArg,
5458  DerivedArgList &Args) {
5459  if (!IsValid)
5460  return true;
5461 
5462  // An FPGA AOCX input does not have a host dependence to the unbundler
5463  if (HostAction->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCX)
5464  return false;
5465 
5466  recordHostAction(HostAction, InputArg);
5467 
5468  // If we are supporting bundling/unbundling and the current action is an
5469  // input action of non-source file, we replace the host action by the
5470  // unbundling action. The bundler tool has the logic to detect if an input
5471  // is a bundle or not and if the input is not a bundle it assumes it is a
5472  // host file. Therefore it is safe to create an unbundling action even if
5473  // the input is not a bundle.
5474  bool HasFPGATarget = false;
5475  if (CanUseBundler && isa<InputAction>(HostAction) &&
5476  InputArg->getOption().getKind() == llvm::opt::Option::InputClass &&
5477  !InputArg->getOption().hasFlag(options::LinkerInput) &&
5478  (!types::isSrcFile(HostAction->getType()) ||
5479  HostAction->getType() == types::TY_PP_HIP)) {
5480  ActionList HostActionList;
5481  Action *A(HostAction);
5482  bool HasSPIRTarget = false;
5483  // Only check for FPGA device information when using fpga SubArch.
5484  auto SYCLTCRange = C.getOffloadToolChains<Action::OFK_SYCL>();
5485  for (auto TI = SYCLTCRange.first, TE = SYCLTCRange.second; TI != TE;
5486  ++TI) {
5487  HasFPGATarget |= TI->second->getTriple().getSubArch() ==
5488  llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga;
5489  HasSPIRTarget |= TI->second->getTriple().isSPIR();
5490  }
5491  bool isArchive = !(HostAction->getType() == types::TY_Object &&
5492  isObjectFile(InputArg->getAsString(Args)));
5493  if (!HasFPGATarget && isArchive &&
5494  HostAction->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCO)
5495  // Archive with Non-FPGA target with AOCO type should not be unbundled.
5496  return false;
5497  if (HasFPGATarget && !updateInputForFPGA(A, InputArg, Args))
5498  return false;
5499  auto UnbundlingHostAction = C.MakeAction<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(
5500  A, (HasSPIRTarget && HostAction->getType() == types::TY_Archive)
5501  ? types::TY_Tempfilelist
5502  : A->getType());
5503  UnbundlingHostAction->registerDependentActionInfo(
5504  C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
5505  /*BoundArch=*/StringRef(), Action::OFK_Host);
5506  HostAction = UnbundlingHostAction;
5507  recordHostAction(HostAction, InputArg);
5508  }
5509 
5510  assert(HostAction && "Invalid host action!");
5511 
5512  // Register the offload kinds that are used.
5513  auto &OffloadKind = InputArgToOffloadKindMap[InputArg];
5514  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5515  if (!SB->isValid())
5516  continue;
5517 
5518  auto RetCode = SB->addDeviceDepences(HostAction);
5519 
5520  // Host dependences for device actions are not compatible with that same
5521  // action being ignored.
5522  assert(RetCode != DeviceActionBuilder::ABRT_Ignore_Host &&
5523  "Host dependence not expected to be ignored.!");
5524 
5525  // Unless the builder was inactive for this action, we have to record the
5526  // offload kind because the host will have to use it.
5527  if (RetCode != DeviceActionBuilder::ABRT_Inactive)
5528  OffloadKind |= SB->getAssociatedOffloadKind();
5529  }
5530 
5531  // Do not use unbundler if the Host does not depend on device action.
5532  // Now that we have unbundled the object, when doing -fsycl-link we
5533  // want to continue the host link with the input object.
5534  // For unbundling of an FPGA AOCX binary, we want to link with the original
5535  // FPGA device archive.
5536  if ((OffloadKind == Action::OFK_None && CanUseBundler) ||
5537  (HasFPGATarget && ((Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ) &&
5538  HostAction->getType() == types::TY_Object) ||
5539  HostAction->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCX)))
5540  if (auto *UA = dyn_cast<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(HostAction))
5541  HostAction = UA->getInputs().back();
5542 
5543  return false;
5544  }
5545 
5546  /// Add the offloading top level actions that are specific for unique
5547  /// linking situations where objects are used at only the device link
5548  /// with no intermedate steps.
5549  bool appendTopLevelLinkAction(ActionList &AL) {
5550  // Get the device actions to be appended.
5551  ActionList OffloadAL;
5552  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5553  if (!SB->isValid())
5554  continue;
5555  SB->appendTopLevelLinkAction(OffloadAL);
5556  }
5557  // Append the device actions.
5558  AL.append(OffloadAL.begin(), OffloadAL.end());
5559  return false;
5560  }
5561 
5562  /// Add the offloading top level actions to the provided action list. This
5563  /// function can replace the host action by a bundling action if the
5564  /// programming models allow it.
5565  bool appendTopLevelActions(ActionList &AL, Action *HostAction,
5566  const Arg *InputArg) {
5567  if (HostAction)
5568  recordHostAction(HostAction, InputArg);
5569 
5570  // Get the device actions to be appended.
5571  ActionList OffloadAL;
5572  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5573  if (!SB->isValid())
5574  continue;
5575  SB->appendTopLevelActions(OffloadAL);
5576  }
5577 
5578  // If we can use the bundler, replace the host action by the bundling one in
5579  // the resulting list. Otherwise, just append the device actions. For
5580  // device only compilation, HostAction is a null pointer, therefore only do
5581  // this when HostAction is not a null pointer.
5582  if (CanUseBundler && HostAction &&
5583  HostAction->getType() != types::TY_Nothing && !OffloadAL.empty()) {
5584  // Add the host action to the list in order to create the bundling action.
5585  OffloadAL.push_back(HostAction);
5586 
5587  // We expect that the host action was just appended to the action list
5588  // before this method was called.
5589  assert(HostAction == AL.back() && "Host action not in the list??");
5590  HostAction = C.MakeAction<OffloadBundlingJobAction>(OffloadAL);
5591  recordHostAction(HostAction, InputArg);
5592  AL.back() = HostAction;
5593  } else
5594  AL.append(OffloadAL.begin(), OffloadAL.end());
5595 
5596  // Propagate to the current host action (if any) the offload information
5597  // associated with the current input.
5598  if (HostAction)
5599  HostAction->propagateHostOffloadInfo(InputArgToOffloadKindMap[InputArg],
5600  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
5601  return false;
5602  }
5603 
5604  /// Create link job from the given host inputs and feed the result to offload
5605  /// deps job which fetches device dependencies from the linked host image.
5606  /// Offload deps output is then forwarded to active device action builders so
5607  /// they can add it to the device linker inputs.
5608  void addDeviceLinkDependenciesFromHost(ActionList &LinkerInputs) {
5609  // Link image for reading dependencies from it.
5610  auto *LA = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(LinkerInputs,
5611  types::TY_Host_Dependencies_Image);
5612 
5613  // Calculate all the offload kinds used in the current compilation.
5614  unsigned ActiveOffloadKinds = 0u;
5615  for (auto &I : InputArgToOffloadKindMap)
5616  ActiveOffloadKinds |= I.second;
5617 
5618  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
5619  *LA, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
5620  /*BoundArch*/ nullptr, ActiveOffloadKinds);
5621 
5622  auto *DA = C.MakeAction<OffloadDepsJobAction>(HDep, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
5623 
5624  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5625  if (!SB->isValid())
5626  continue;
5627  SB->addDeviceLinkDependencies(DA);
5628  }
5629  }
5630 
5631  void appendDeviceLinkActions(ActionList &AL) {
5632  for (DeviceActionBuilder *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5633  if (!SB->isValid())
5634  continue;
5635  SB->appendLinkDeviceActions(AL);
5636  }
5637  }
5638 
5639  void makeHostLinkAction(ActionList &LinkerInputs) {
5640  // Build a list of device linking actions.
5641  ActionList DeviceAL;
5642  appendDeviceLinkActions(DeviceAL);
5643  if (DeviceAL.empty())
5644  return;
5645 
5646  // Let builders add host linking actions.
5647  Action* HA = nullptr;
5648  for (DeviceActionBuilder *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5649  if (!SB->isValid())
5650  continue;
5651  HA = SB->appendLinkHostActions(DeviceAL);
5652  // This created host action has no originating input argument, therefore
5653  // needs to set its offloading kind directly.
5654  if (HA) {
5655  HA->propagateHostOffloadInfo(SB->getAssociatedOffloadKind(),
5656  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
5657  LinkerInputs.push_back(HA);
5658  }
5659  }
5660  }
5661 
5662  /// Processes the host linker action. This currently consists of replacing it
5663  /// with an offload action if there are device link objects and propagate to
5664  /// the host action all the offload kinds used in the current compilation. The
5665  /// resulting action is returned.
5666  Action *processHostLinkAction(Action *HostAction) {
5667  // Add all the dependences from the device linking actions.
5668  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDeps;
5669  for (auto *SB : SpecializedBuilders) {
5670  if (!SB->isValid())
5671  continue;
5672 
5673  SB->appendLinkDependences(DDeps);
5674  }
5675 
5676  // Calculate all the offload kinds used in the current compilation.
5677  unsigned ActiveOffloadKinds = 0u;
5678  for (auto &I : InputArgToOffloadKindMap)
5679  ActiveOffloadKinds |= I.second;
5680 
5681  // If we don't have device dependencies, we don't have to create an offload
5682  // action.
5683  if (DDeps.getActions().empty()) {
5684  // Set all the active offloading kinds to the link action. Given that it
5685  // is a link action it is assumed to depend on all actions generated so
5686  // far.
5687  HostAction->setHostOffloadInfo(ActiveOffloadKinds,
5688  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
5689  // Propagate active offloading kinds for each input to the link action.
5690  // Each input may have different active offloading kind.
5691  for (auto A : HostAction->inputs()) {
5692  auto ArgLoc = HostActionToInputArgMap.find(A);
5693  if (ArgLoc == HostActionToInputArgMap.end())
5694  continue;
5695  auto OFKLoc = InputArgToOffloadKindMap.find(ArgLoc->second);
5696  if (OFKLoc == InputArgToOffloadKindMap.end())
5697  continue;
5698  A->propagateHostOffloadInfo(OFKLoc->second, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
5699  }
5700  return HostAction;
5701  }
5702 
5703  // Create the offload action with all dependences. When an offload action
5704  // is created the kinds are propagated to the host action, so we don't have
5705  // to do that explicitly here.
5706  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
5707  *HostAction, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
5708  /*BoundArch*/ nullptr, ActiveOffloadKinds);
5709  return C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(HDep, DDeps);
5710  }
5711 
5712  void unbundleStaticArchives(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
5713  DeviceActionBuilder::PhasesTy &PL) {
5714  if (!Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false))
5715  return;
5716 
5717  // Go through all of the args, and create a Linker specific argument list.
5718  // When dealing with fat static archives each archive is individually
5719  // unbundled.
5720  SmallVector<const char *, 16> LinkArgs(getLinkerArgs(C, Args));
5721  const llvm::opt::OptTable &Opts = C.getDriver().getOpts();
5722  auto unbundleStaticLib = [&](types::ID T, const StringRef &A) {
5723  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, Opts, Args.MakeArgString(A));
5724  Action *Current = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, T);
5725  addHostDependenceToDeviceActions(Current, InputArg, Args);
5726  addDeviceDependencesToHostAction(Current, InputArg, phases::Link,
5727  PL.back(), PL);
5728  };
5729  for (StringRef LA : LinkArgs) {
5730  // At this point, we will process the archives for FPGA AOCO and
5731  // individual archive unbundling for Windows.
5732  if (!isStaticArchiveFile(LA))
5733  continue;
5734  // FPGA AOCX/AOCR files are archives, but we do not want to unbundle them
5735  // here as they have already been unbundled and processed for linking.
5736  // TODO: The multiple binary checks for FPGA types getting a little out
5737  // of hand. Improve this by doing a single scan of the args and holding
5738  // that in a data structure for reference.
5739  if (hasFPGABinary(C, LA.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCX) ||
5740  hasFPGABinary(C, LA.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCR) ||
5741  hasFPGABinary(C, LA.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU))
5742  continue;
5743  // For offload-static-libs we add an unbundling action for each static
5744  // archive which produces list files with extracted objects. Device lists
5745  // are then added to the appropriate device link actions and host list is
5746  // ignored since we are adding offload-static-libs as normal libraries to
5747  // the host link command.
5748  if (hasOffloadSections(C, LA, Args)) {
5749  // Pass along the static libraries to check if we need to add them for
5750  // unbundling for FPGA AOT static lib usage. Uses FPGA aoco type to
5751  // differentiate if aoco unbundling is needed. Unbundling of aoco is
5752  // not needed for emulation, as these are treated as regular archives.
5753  if (!C.getDriver().isFPGAEmulationMode())
5754  unbundleStaticLib(types::TY_FPGA_AOCO, LA);
5755  // Do not unbundle any AOCO archive as a regular archive when we are
5756  // in FPGA Hardware/Simulation mode.
5757  if (!C.getDriver().isFPGAEmulationMode() &&
5758  hasFPGABinary(C, LA.str(), types::TY_FPGA_AOCO))
5759  continue;
5760  unbundleStaticLib(types::TY_Archive, LA);
5761  }
5762  }
5763  }
5764 };
5765 } // anonymous namespace.
5766 
5767 void Driver::handleArguments(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
5768  const InputList &Inputs,
5769  ActionList &Actions) const {
5770 
5771  // Ignore /Yc/Yu if both /Yc and /Yu passed but with different filenames.
5772  Arg *YcArg = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yc);
5773  Arg *YuArg = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yu);
5774  if (YcArg && YuArg && strcmp(YcArg->getValue(), YuArg->getValue()) != 0) {
5775  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_ycyu_different_arg_clang_cl);
5776  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yc);
5777  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yu);
5778  YcArg = YuArg = nullptr;
5779  }
5780  if (YcArg && Inputs.size() > 1) {
5781  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_yc_multiple_inputs_clang_cl);
5782  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yc);
5783  YcArg = nullptr;
5784  }
5785 
5786  Arg *FinalPhaseArg;
5787  phases::ID FinalPhase = getFinalPhase(Args, &FinalPhaseArg);
5788 
5789  if (FinalPhase == phases::Link) {
5790  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm))
5791  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_emit_llvm_link);
5792  if (IsCLMode() && LTOMode != LTOK_None &&
5793  !Args.getLastArgValue(options::OPT_fuse_ld_EQ)
5794  .equals_insensitive("lld"))
5795  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_lto_without_lld);
5796  }
5797 
5798  if (FinalPhase == phases::Preprocess || Args.hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Y_)) {
5799  // If only preprocessing or /Y- is used, all pch handling is disabled.
5800  // Rather than check for it everywhere, just remove clang-cl pch-related
5801  // flags here.
5802  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fp);
5803  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yc);
5804  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yu);
5805  YcArg = YuArg = nullptr;
5806  }
5807 
5808  unsigned LastPLSize = 0;
5809  for (auto &I : Inputs) {
5810  types::ID InputType = I.first;
5811  const Arg *InputArg = I.second;
5812 
5813  auto PL = types::getCompilationPhases(InputType);
5814  LastPLSize = PL.size();
5815 
5816  // If the first step comes after the final phase we are doing as part of
5817  // this compilation, warn the user about it.
5818  phases::ID InitialPhase = PL[0];
5819  if (InitialPhase > FinalPhase) {
5820  if (InputArg->isClaimed())
5821  continue;
5822 
5823  // Claim here to avoid the more general unused warning.
5824  InputArg->claim();
5825 
5826  // Suppress all unused style warnings with -Qunused-arguments
5827  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_Qunused_arguments))
5828  continue;
5829 
5830  // Special case when final phase determined by binary name, rather than
5831  // by a command-line argument with a corresponding Arg.
5832  if (CCCIsCPP())
5833  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_input_file_unused_by_cpp)
5834  << InputArg->getAsString(Args) << getPhaseName(InitialPhase);
5835  // Special case '-E' warning on a previously preprocessed file to make
5836  // more sense.
5837  else if (InitialPhase == phases::Compile &&
5838  (Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_EP,
5839  options::OPT__SLASH_P) ||
5840  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_E) ||
5841  Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_M, options::OPT_MM)) &&
5842  getPreprocessedType(InputType) == types::TY_INVALID)
5843  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_preprocessed_input_file_unused)
5844  << InputArg->getAsString(Args) << !!FinalPhaseArg
5845  << (FinalPhaseArg ? FinalPhaseArg->getOption().getName() : "");
5846  else
5847  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_input_file_unused)
5848  << InputArg->getAsString(Args) << getPhaseName(InitialPhase)
5849  << !!FinalPhaseArg
5850  << (FinalPhaseArg ? FinalPhaseArg->getOption().getName() : "");
5851  continue;
5852  }
5853 
5854  if (YcArg) {
5855  // Add a separate precompile phase for the compile phase.
5856  if (FinalPhase >= phases::Compile) {
5857  const types::ID HeaderType = lookupHeaderTypeForSourceType(InputType);
5858  // Build the pipeline for the pch file.
5859  Action *ClangClPch = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, HeaderType);
5860  for (phases::ID Phase : types::getCompilationPhases(HeaderType))
5861  ClangClPch = ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, Phase, ClangClPch);
5862  assert(ClangClPch);
5863  Actions.push_back(ClangClPch);
5864  // The driver currently exits after the first failed command. This
5865  // relies on that behavior, to make sure if the pch generation fails,
5866  // the main compilation won't run.
5867  // FIXME: If the main compilation fails, the PCH generation should
5868  // probably not be considered successful either.
5869  }
5870  }
5871  }
5872 
5873  // If we are linking, claim any options which are obviously only used for
5874  // compilation.
5875  // FIXME: Understand why the last Phase List length is used here.
5876  if (FinalPhase == phases::Link && LastPLSize == 1) {
5877  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_CompileOnly_Group);
5878  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_cl_compile_Group);
5879  }
5880 }
5881 
5882 void Driver::BuildActions(Compilation &C, DerivedArgList &Args,
5883  const InputList &Inputs, ActionList &Actions) const {
5884  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Building compilation actions");
5885 
5886  if (!SuppressMissingInputWarning && Inputs.empty()) {
5887  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_no_input_files);
5888  return;
5889  }
5890 
5891  // Reject -Z* at the top level, these options should never have been exposed
5892  // by gcc.
5893  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_Z_Joined))
5894  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_use_of_Z_option) << A->getAsString(Args);
5895 
5896  // Diagnose misuse of /Fo.
5897  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo)) {
5898  StringRef V = A->getValue();
5899  if (Inputs.size() > 1 && !V.empty() &&
5900  !llvm::sys::path::is_separator(V.back())) {
5901  // Check whether /Fo tries to name an output file for multiple inputs.
5902  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_out_file_argument_with_multiple_sources)
5903  << A->getSpelling() << V;
5904  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo);
5905  }
5906  }
5907 
5908  // Diagnose misuse of /Fa.
5909  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fa)) {
5910  StringRef V = A->getValue();
5911  if (Inputs.size() > 1 && !V.empty() &&
5912  !llvm::sys::path::is_separator(V.back())) {
5913  // Check whether /Fa tries to name an asm file for multiple inputs.
5914  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_out_file_argument_with_multiple_sources)
5915  << A->getSpelling() << V;
5916  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fa);
5917  }
5918  }
5919 
5920  // Diagnose misuse of /o.
5921  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_o)) {
5922  if (A->getValue()[0] == '\0') {
5923  // It has to have a value.
5924  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_missing_argument) << A->getSpelling() << 1;
5925  Args.eraseArg(options::OPT__SLASH_o);
5926  }
5927  }
5928 
5929  handleArguments(C, Args, Inputs, Actions);
5930 
5931  // When compiling for -fsycl, generate the integration header files and the
5932  // Unique ID that will be used during the compilation.
5933  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsycl, options::OPT_fno_sycl, false)) {
5934  const bool IsSaveTemps = isSaveTempsEnabled();
5935  SmallString<128> OutFileDir;
5936  if (IsSaveTemps) {
5937  if (SaveTemps == SaveTempsObj) {
5938  auto *OptO = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_o);
5939  OutFileDir = (OptO ? OptO->getValues()[0] : "");
5940  llvm::sys::path::remove_filename(OutFileDir);
5941  if (!OutFileDir.empty())
5942  OutFileDir.append(llvm::sys::path::get_separator());
5943  }
5944  }
5945  for (auto &I : Inputs) {
5946  std::string SrcFileName(I.second->getAsString(Args));
5947  if (I.first == types::TY_PP_C || I.first == types::TY_PP_CXX ||
5948  types::isSrcFile(I.first)) {
5949  // Unique ID is generated for source files and preprocessed files.
5950  SmallString<128> ResultID;
5951  llvm::sys::fs::createUniquePath("%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%", ResultID, false);
5952  addSYCLUniqueID(Args.MakeArgString(ResultID.str()), SrcFileName);
5953  }
5954  if (!types::isSrcFile(I.first))
5955  continue;
5956 
5957  std::string TmpFileNameHeader;
5958  std::string TmpFileNameFooter;
5959  auto StemmedSrcFileName = llvm::sys::path::stem(SrcFileName).str();
5960  if (IsSaveTemps) {
5961  TmpFileNameHeader.append(C.getDriver().GetUniquePath(
5962  OutFileDir.c_str() + StemmedSrcFileName + "-header", "h"));
5963  TmpFileNameFooter.append(C.getDriver().GetUniquePath(
5964  OutFileDir.c_str() + StemmedSrcFileName + "-footer", "h"));
5965  } else {
5966  TmpFileNameHeader.assign(C.getDriver().GetTemporaryPath(
5967  StemmedSrcFileName + "-header", "h"));
5968  TmpFileNameFooter =
5969  C.getDriver().GetTemporaryPath(StemmedSrcFileName + "-footer", "h");
5970  }
5971  StringRef TmpFileHeader =
5972  C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpFileNameHeader));
5973  StringRef TmpFileFooter =
5974  C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpFileNameFooter));
5975  // Use of -fsycl-footer-path puts the integration footer into that
5976  // specified location.
5977  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_footer_path_EQ)) {
5978  SmallString<128> OutName(A->getValue());
5979  llvm::sys::path::append(OutName,
5980  llvm::sys::path::filename(TmpFileNameFooter));
5981  TmpFileFooter = C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(OutName));
5982  }
5983  addIntegrationFiles(TmpFileHeader, TmpFileFooter, SrcFileName);
5984  }
5985  }
5986 
5987  // Builder to be used to build offloading actions.
5988  OffloadingActionBuilder OffloadBuilder(C, Args, Inputs);
5989 
5990  // Construct the actions to perform.
5991  HeaderModulePrecompileJobAction *HeaderModuleAction = nullptr;
5992  ExtractAPIJobAction *ExtractAPIAction = nullptr;
5993  ActionList LinkerInputs;
5994  ActionList MergerInputs;
5995 
5996  llvm::SmallVector<phases::ID, phases::MaxNumberOfPhases> PL;
5997  for (auto &I : Inputs) {
5998  types::ID InputType = I.first;
5999  const Arg *InputArg = I.second;
6000 
6001  PL = types::getCompilationPhases(*this, Args, InputType);
6002  if (PL.empty())
6003  continue;
6004 
6005  auto FullPL = types::getCompilationPhases(InputType);
6006 
6007  // Build the pipeline for this file.
6008  Action *Current = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, InputType);
6009 
6010  // Use the current host action in any of the offloading actions, if
6011  // required.
6012  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6013  if (OffloadBuilder.addHostDependenceToDeviceActions(Current, InputArg,
6014  Args))
6015  break;
6016 
6017  for (phases::ID Phase : PL) {
6018 
6019  // Add any offload action the host action depends on.
6020  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6021  Current = OffloadBuilder.addDeviceDependencesToHostAction(
6022  Current, InputArg, Phase, PL.back(), FullPL);
6023  if (!Current)
6024  break;
6025 
6026  // Queue linker inputs.
6027  if (Phase == phases::Link) {
6028  assert(Phase == PL.back() && "linking must be final compilation step.");
6029  LinkerInputs.push_back(Current);
6030  Current = nullptr;
6031  break;
6032  }
6033 
6034  // TODO: Consider removing this because the merged may not end up being
6035  // the final Phase in the pipeline. Perhaps the merged could just merge
6036  // and then pass an artifact of some sort to the Link Phase.
6037  // Queue merger inputs.
6038  if (Phase == phases::IfsMerge) {
6039  assert(Phase == PL.back() && "merging must be final compilation step.");
6040  MergerInputs.push_back(Current);
6041  Current = nullptr;
6042  break;
6043  }
6044 
6045  // Each precompiled header file after a module file action is a module
6046  // header of that same module file, rather than being compiled to a
6047  // separate PCH.
6048  if (Phase == phases::Precompile && HeaderModuleAction &&
6049  getPrecompiledType(InputType) == types::TY_PCH) {
6050  HeaderModuleAction->addModuleHeaderInput(Current);
6051  Current = nullptr;
6052  break;
6053  }
6054 
6055  // When performing -fsycl based compilations and generating dependency
6056  // information, perform a specific dependency generation compilation which
6057  // is not based on the source + footer compilation.
6058  if (Phase == phases::Preprocess && Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl) &&
6059  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_M_Group) &&
6060  !Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fno_sycl_use_footer)) {
6061  Action *PreprocessAction =
6062  C.MakeAction<PreprocessJobAction>(Current, types::TY_Dependencies);
6063  PreprocessAction->propagateHostOffloadInfo(Action::OFK_SYCL,
6064  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
6065  Actions.push_back(PreprocessAction);
6066  }
6067 
6068  if (Phase == phases::Precompile && ExtractAPIAction) {
6069  ExtractAPIAction->addHeaderInput(Current);
6070  Current = nullptr;
6071  break;
6072  }
6073 
6074  // Try to build the offloading actions and add the result as a dependency
6075  // to the host.
6076  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6077  Current = BuildOffloadingActions(C, Args, I, Current);
6078 
6079  // FIXME: Should we include any prior module file outputs as inputs of
6080  // later actions in the same command line?
6081 
6082  // Otherwise construct the appropriate action.
6083  Action *NewCurrent = ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, Phase, Current);
6084 
6085  // We didn't create a new action, so we will just move to the next phase.
6086  if (NewCurrent == Current)
6087  continue;
6088 
6089  if (auto *HMA = dyn_cast<HeaderModulePrecompileJobAction>(NewCurrent))
6090  HeaderModuleAction = HMA;
