6091  else if (auto *EAA = dyn_cast<ExtractAPIJobAction>(NewCurrent))
6092  ExtractAPIAction = EAA;
6093 
6094  Current = NewCurrent;
6095 
6096  // Use the current host action in any of the offloading actions, if
6097  // required.
6098  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6099  if (OffloadBuilder.addHostDependenceToDeviceActions(Current, InputArg,
6100  Args))
6101  break;
6102 
6103  if (Current->getType() == types::TY_Nothing)
6104  break;
6105  }
6106 
6107  // If we ended with something, add to the output list.
6108  if (Current)
6109  Actions.push_back(Current);
6110 
6111  // Add any top level actions generated for offloading.
6112  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6113  OffloadBuilder.appendTopLevelActions(Actions, Current, InputArg);
6114  else if (Current)
6115  Current->propagateHostOffloadInfo(C.getActiveOffloadKinds(),
6116  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
6117  }
6118 
6119  OffloadBuilder.appendTopLevelLinkAction(Actions);
6120 
6121  // With static fat archives we need to create additional steps for
6122  // generating dependence objects for device link actions.
6123  if (!LinkerInputs.empty() && C.getDriver().getOffloadStaticLibSeen())
6124  OffloadBuilder.addDeviceLinkDependenciesFromHost(LinkerInputs);
6125 
6126  OffloadBuilder.unbundleStaticArchives(C, Args, PL);
6127 
6128  // For an FPGA archive, we add the unbundling step above to take care of
6129  // the device side, but also unbundle here to extract the host side
6130  bool EarlyLink = false;
6131  if (const Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ))
6132  EarlyLink = A->getValue() == StringRef("early");
6133  for (auto &LI : LinkerInputs) {
6134  Action *UnbundlerInput = nullptr;
6135  auto wrapObject = [&] {
6136  if (EarlyLink && Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fintelfpga)) {
6137  // Only wrap the object with -fsycl-link=early
6138  auto *BC = C.MakeAction<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(LI, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
6139  auto *ASM = C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(BC, types::TY_PP_Asm);
6140  LI = C.MakeAction<AssembleJobAction>(ASM, types::TY_Object);
6141  }
6142  };
6143  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(LI)) {
6144  if (IA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR ||
6145  IA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCX ||
6146  IA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU) {
6147  // Add to unbundler.
6148  UnbundlerInput = LI;
6149  } else {
6150  std::string FileName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
6151  if ((IA->getType() == types::TY_Object && !isObjectFile(FileName)) ||
6152  IA->getInputArg().getOption().hasFlag(options::LinkerInput))
6153  continue;
6154  wrapObject();
6155  }
6156  } else {
6157  wrapObject();
6158  }
6159  if (UnbundlerInput && !PL.empty()) {
6160  if (auto *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(UnbundlerInput)) {
6161  std::string FileName = IA->getInputArg().getAsString(Args);
6162  Arg *InputArg = MakeInputArg(Args, getOpts(), FileName);
6163  OffloadBuilder.addHostDependenceToDeviceActions(UnbundlerInput,
6164  InputArg, Args);
6165  }
6166  }
6167  }
6168 
6169  // Add a link action if necessary.
6170 
6171  if (LinkerInputs.empty()) {
6172  Arg *FinalPhaseArg;
6173  if (getFinalPhase(Args, &FinalPhaseArg) == phases::Link)
6174  OffloadBuilder.appendDeviceLinkActions(Actions);
6175  }
6176 
6177  if (!LinkerInputs.empty()) {
6178  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6179  OffloadBuilder.makeHostLinkAction(LinkerInputs);
6180  types::ID LinkType(types::TY_Image);
6181  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ))
6182  LinkType = types::TY_Archive;
6183  Action *LA;
6184  // Check if this Linker Job should emit a static library.
6185  if (ShouldEmitStaticLibrary(Args)) {
6186  LA = C.MakeAction<StaticLibJobAction>(LinkerInputs, LinkType);
6187  } else if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver) &&
6188  C.getActiveOffloadKinds() != Action::OFK_None) {
6189  LA = C.MakeAction<LinkerWrapperJobAction>(LinkerInputs, types::TY_Image);
6190  LA->propagateHostOffloadInfo(C.getActiveOffloadKinds(),
6191  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr);
6192  } else {
6193  LA = C.MakeAction<LinkJobAction>(LinkerInputs, LinkType);
6194  }
6195  if (!Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fopenmp_new_driver))
6196  LA = OffloadBuilder.processHostLinkAction(LA);
6197  Actions.push_back(LA);
6198  }
6199 
6200  // Add an interface stubs merge action if necessary.
6201  if (!MergerInputs.empty())
6202  Actions.push_back(
6203  C.MakeAction<IfsMergeJobAction>(MergerInputs, types::TY_Image));
6204 
6205  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_interface_stubs)) {
6206  auto PhaseList = types::getCompilationPhases(
6207  types::TY_IFS_CPP,
6208  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_c) ? phases::Compile : phases::IfsMerge);
6209 
6210  ActionList MergerInputs;
6211 
6212  for (auto &I : Inputs) {
6213  types::ID InputType = I.first;
6214  const Arg *InputArg = I.second;
6215 
6216  // Currently clang and the llvm assembler do not support generating symbol
6217  // stubs from assembly, so we skip the input on asm files. For ifs files
6218  // we rely on the normal pipeline setup in the pipeline setup code above.
6219  if (InputType == types::TY_IFS || InputType == types::TY_PP_Asm ||
6220  InputType == types::TY_Asm)
6221  continue;
6222 
6223  Action *Current = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, InputType);
6224 
6225  for (auto Phase : PhaseList) {
6226  switch (Phase) {
6227  default:
6228  llvm_unreachable(
6229  "IFS Pipeline can only consist of Compile followed by IfsMerge.");
6230  case phases::Compile: {
6231  // Only IfsMerge (llvm-ifs) can handle .o files by looking for ifs
6232  // files where the .o file is located. The compile action can not
6233  // handle this.
6234  if (InputType == types::TY_Object)
6235  break;
6236 
6237  Current = C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Current, types::TY_IFS_CPP);
6238  break;
6239  }
6240  case phases::IfsMerge: {
6241  assert(Phase == PhaseList.back() &&
6242  "merging must be final compilation step.");
6243  MergerInputs.push_back(Current);
6244  Current = nullptr;
6245  break;
6246  }
6247  }
6248  }
6249 
6250  // If we ended with something, add to the output list.
6251  if (Current)
6252  Actions.push_back(Current);
6253  }
6254 
6255  // Add an interface stubs merge action if necessary.
6256  if (!MergerInputs.empty())
6257  Actions.push_back(
6258  C.MakeAction<IfsMergeJobAction>(MergerInputs, types::TY_Image));
6259  }
6260 
6261  // If --print-supported-cpus, -mcpu=? or -mtune=? is specified, build a custom
6262  // Compile phase that prints out supported cpu models and quits.
6263  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_print_supported_cpus)) {
6264  // Use the -mcpu=? flag as the dummy input to cc1.
6265  Actions.clear();
6266  Action *InputAc = C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*A, types::TY_C);
6267  Actions.push_back(
6268  C.MakeAction<PrecompileJobAction>(InputAc, types::TY_Nothing));
6269  for (auto &I : Inputs)
6270  I.second->claim();
6271  }
6272 
6273  // Claim ignored clang-cl options.
6274  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_cl_ignored_Group);
6275 
6276  // Claim --cuda-host-only and --cuda-compile-host-device, which may be passed
6277  // to non-CUDA compilations and should not trigger warnings there.
6278  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_cuda_host_only);
6279  Args.ClaimAllArgs(options::OPT_cuda_compile_host_device);
6280 }
6281 
6282 Action *Driver::BuildOffloadingActions(Compilation &C,
6283  llvm::opt::DerivedArgList &Args,
6284  const InputTy &Input,
6285  Action *HostAction) const {
6286  if (!isa<CompileJobAction>(HostAction))
6287  return HostAction;
6288 
6289  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDeps;
6290 
6291  types::ID InputType = Input.first;
6292  const Arg *InputArg = Input.second;
6293 
6294  const Action::OffloadKind OffloadKinds[] = {Action::OFK_OpenMP};
6295 
6296  for (Action::OffloadKind Kind : OffloadKinds) {
6297  SmallVector<const ToolChain *, 2> ToolChains;
6298  ActionList DeviceActions;
6299 
6300  auto TCRange = C.getOffloadToolChains(Kind);
6301  for (auto TI = TCRange.first, TE = TCRange.second; TI != TE; ++TI)
6302  ToolChains.push_back(TI->second);
6303 
6304  if (ToolChains.empty())
6305  continue;
6306 
6307  for (unsigned I = 0; I < ToolChains.size(); ++I)
6308  DeviceActions.push_back(C.MakeAction<InputAction>(*InputArg, InputType));
6309 
6310  if (DeviceActions.empty())
6311  return HostAction;
6312 
6313  auto PL = types::getCompilationPhases(*this, Args, InputType);
6314 
6315  for (phases::ID Phase : PL) {
6316  if (Phase == phases::Link) {
6317  assert(Phase == PL.back() && "linking must be final compilation step.");
6318  break;
6319  }
6320 
6321  auto TC = ToolChains.begin();
6322  for (Action *&A : DeviceActions) {
6323  A = ConstructPhaseAction(C, Args, Phase, A, Kind);
6324 
6325  if (isa<CompileJobAction>(A) && Kind == Action::OFK_OpenMP) {
6326  HostAction->setCannotBeCollapsedWithNextDependentAction();
6327  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
6328  *HostAction, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
6329  /*BourdArch=*/nullptr, Action::OFK_OpenMP);
6330  OffloadAction::DeviceDependences DDep;
6331  DDep.add(*A, **TC, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Kind);
6332  A = C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(HDep, DDep);
6333  }
6334  ++TC;
6335  }
6336  }
6337 
6338  auto TC = ToolChains.begin();
6339  for (Action *A : DeviceActions) {
6340  DDeps.add(*A, **TC, /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, Kind);
6341  TC++;
6342  }
6343  }
6344 
6345  OffloadAction::HostDependence HDep(
6346  *HostAction, *C.getSingleOffloadToolChain<Action::OFK_Host>(),
6347  /*BoundArch=*/nullptr, DDeps);
6348  return C.MakeAction<OffloadAction>(HDep, DDeps);
6349 }
6350 
6351 Action *Driver::ConstructPhaseAction(
6352  Compilation &C, const ArgList &Args, phases::ID Phase, Action *Input,
6353  Action::OffloadKind TargetDeviceOffloadKind) const {
6354  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Constructing phase actions");
6355 
6356  // Some types skip the assembler phase (e.g., llvm-bc), but we can't
6357  // encode this in the steps because the intermediate type depends on
6358  // arguments. Just special case here.
6359  if (Phase == phases::Assemble && Input->getType() != types::TY_PP_Asm)
6360  return Input;
6361 
6362  // Build the appropriate action.
6363  switch (Phase) {
6364  case phases::Link:
6365  llvm_unreachable("link action invalid here.");
6366  case phases::IfsMerge:
6367  llvm_unreachable("ifsmerge action invalid here.");
6368  case phases::Preprocess: {
6369  types::ID OutputTy;
6370  // -M and -MM specify the dependency file name by altering the output type,
6371  // -if -MD and -MMD are not specified.
6372  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_M, options::OPT_MM) &&
6373  !Args.hasArg(options::OPT_MD, options::OPT_MMD)) {
6374  OutputTy = types::TY_Dependencies;
6375  } else {
6376  OutputTy = Input->getType();
6377  if (!Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_frewrite_includes,
6378  options::OPT_fno_rewrite_includes, false) &&
6379  !Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_frewrite_imports,
6380  options::OPT_fno_rewrite_imports, false) &&
6381  !CCGenDiagnostics)
6382  OutputTy = types::getPreprocessedType(OutputTy);
6383  assert(OutputTy != types::TY_INVALID &&
6384  "Cannot preprocess this input type!");
6385  }
6386  types::ID HostPPType = types::getPreprocessedType(Input->getType());
6387  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl) && HostPPType != types::TY_INVALID &&
6388  !Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fno_sycl_use_footer) &&
6389  TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_None) {
6390  // Performing a host compilation with -fsycl. Append the integration
6391  // footer to the source file.
6392  auto *AppendFooter =
6393  C.MakeAction<AppendFooterJobAction>(Input, types::TY_CXX);
6394  // FIXME: There are 2 issues with dependency generation in regards to
6395  // the integration footer that need to be addressed.
6396  // 1) Input file referenced on the RHS of a dependency is based on the
6397  // input src, which is a temporary. We want this to be the true
6398  // user input src file.
6399  // 2) When generating dependencies against a preprocessed file, header
6400  // file information (using -MD or-MMD) is not provided.
6401  return C.MakeAction<PreprocessJobAction>(AppendFooter, OutputTy);
6402  }
6403  return C.MakeAction<PreprocessJobAction>(Input, OutputTy);
6404  }
6405  case phases::Precompile: {
6406  // API extraction should not generate an actual precompilation action.
6407  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_extract_api))
6408  return C.MakeAction<ExtractAPIJobAction>(Input, types::TY_API_INFO);
6409 
6410  types::ID OutputTy = getPrecompiledType(Input->getType());
6411  assert(OutputTy != types::TY_INVALID &&
6412  "Cannot precompile this input type!");
6413 
6414  // If we're given a module name, precompile header file inputs as a
6415  // module, not as a precompiled header.
6416  const char *ModName = nullptr;
6417  if (OutputTy == types::TY_PCH) {
6418  if (Arg *A = Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fmodule_name_EQ))
6419  ModName = A->getValue();
6420  if (ModName)
6421  OutputTy = types::TY_ModuleFile;
6422  }
6423 
6424  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsyntax_only)) {
6425  // Syntax checks should not emit a PCH file
6426  OutputTy = types::TY_Nothing;
6427  }
6428 
6429  if (ModName)
6430  return C.MakeAction<HeaderModulePrecompileJobAction>(Input, OutputTy,
6431  ModName);
6432  return C.MakeAction<PrecompileJobAction>(Input, OutputTy);
6433  }
6434  case phases::Compile: {
6435  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsyntax_only))
6436  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input, types::TY_Nothing);
6437  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_rewrite_objc))
6438  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input, types::TY_RewrittenObjC);
6439  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_rewrite_legacy_objc))
6440  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input,
6441  types::TY_RewrittenLegacyObjC);
6442  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT__analyze))
6443  return C.MakeAction<AnalyzeJobAction>(Input, types::TY_Plist);
6444  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT__migrate))
6445  return C.MakeAction<MigrateJobAction>(Input, types::TY_Remap);
6446  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_ast))
6447  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input, types::TY_AST);
6448  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_module_file_info))
6449  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input, types::TY_ModuleFile);
6450  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_verify_pch))
6451  return C.MakeAction<VerifyPCHJobAction>(Input, types::TY_Nothing);
6452  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_extract_api))
6453  return C.MakeAction<ExtractAPIJobAction>(Input, types::TY_API_INFO);
6454  return C.MakeAction<CompileJobAction>(Input, types::TY_LLVM_BC);
6455  }
6456  case phases::Backend: {
6457  if (isUsingLTO() && TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_None) {
6458  types::ID Output =
6459  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_S) ? types::TY_LTO_IR : types::TY_LTO_BC;
6460  return C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(Input, Output);
6461  }
6462  if (isUsingLTO(/* IsOffload */ true) &&
6463  TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_OpenMP) {
6464  types::ID Output =
6465  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_S) ? types::TY_LTO_IR : types::TY_LTO_BC;
6466  return C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(Input, Output);
6467  }
6468  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm) ||
6469  (TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP &&
6470  Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fgpu_rdc, options::OPT_fno_gpu_rdc,
6471  false))) {
6472  types::ID Output =
6473  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_S) ? types::TY_LLVM_IR : types::TY_LLVM_BC;
6474  return C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(Input, Output);
6475  }
6476  return C.MakeAction<BackendJobAction>(Input, types::TY_PP_Asm);
6477  }
6478  case phases::Assemble:
6479  return C.MakeAction<AssembleJobAction>(std::move(Input), types::TY_Object);
6480  }
6481 
6482  llvm_unreachable("invalid phase in ConstructPhaseAction");
6483 }
6484 
6485 void Driver::BuildJobs(Compilation &C) const {
6486  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Building compilation jobs");
6487 
6488  Arg *FinalOutput = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_o);
6489 
6490  // It is an error to provide a -o option if we are making multiple output
6491  // files. There are exceptions:
6492  //
6493  // IfsMergeJob: when generating interface stubs enabled we want to be able to
6494  // generate the stub file at the same time that we generate the real
6495  // library/a.out. So when a .o, .so, etc are the output, with clang interface
6496  // stubs there will also be a .ifs and .ifso at the same location.
6497  //
6498  // CompileJob of type TY_IFS_CPP: when generating interface stubs is enabled
6499  // and -c is passed, we still want to be able to generate a .ifs file while
6500  // we are also generating .o files. So we allow more than one output file in
6501  // this case as well.
6502  //
6503  // Preprocessing job performed for -fsycl enabled compilation specifically
6504  // for dependency generation (TY_Dependencies)
6505  //
6506  if (FinalOutput) {
6507  unsigned NumOutputs = 0;
6508  unsigned NumIfsOutputs = 0;
6509  for (const Action *A : C.getActions())
6510  if (A->getType() != types::TY_Nothing &&
6511  !(A->getKind() == Action::IfsMergeJobClass ||
6512  (A->getType() == clang::driver::types::TY_IFS_CPP &&
6513  A->getKind() == clang::driver::Action::CompileJobClass &&
6514  0 == NumIfsOutputs++) ||
6515  (A->getKind() == Action::BindArchClass && A->getInputs().size() &&
6516  A->getInputs().front()->getKind() == Action::IfsMergeJobClass) ||
6517  (A->getKind() == Action::PreprocessJobClass &&
6518  A->getType() == types::TY_Dependencies &&
6519  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl))))
6520  ++NumOutputs;
6521 
6522  if (NumOutputs > 1) {
6523  Diag(clang::diag::err_drv_output_argument_with_multiple_files);
6524  FinalOutput = nullptr;
6525  }
6526  }
6527 
6528  const llvm::Triple &RawTriple = C.getDefaultToolChain().getTriple();
6529  if (RawTriple.isOSAIX()) {
6530  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_G))
6531  Diag(diag::err_drv_unsupported_opt_for_target)
6532  << A->getSpelling() << RawTriple.str();
6533  if (LTOMode == LTOK_Thin)
6534  Diag(diag::err_drv_clang_unsupported) << "thinLTO on AIX";
6535  }
6536 
6537  // Collect the list of architectures.
6538  llvm::StringSet<> ArchNames;
6539  if (RawTriple.isOSBinFormatMachO())
6540  for (const Arg *A : C.getArgs())
6541  if (A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_arch))
6542  ArchNames.insert(A->getValue());
6543 
6544  // Set of (Action, canonical ToolChain triple) pairs we've built jobs for.
6545  std::map<std::pair<const Action *, std::string>, InputInfoList> CachedResults;
6546  for (Action *A : C.getActions()) {
6547  // If we are linking an image for multiple archs then the linker wants
6548  // -arch_multiple and -final_output <final image name>. Unfortunately, this
6549  // doesn't fit in cleanly because we have to pass this information down.
6550  //
6551  // FIXME: This is a hack; find a cleaner way to integrate this into the
6552  // process.
6553  const char *LinkingOutput = nullptr;
6554  if (isa<LipoJobAction>(A)) {
6555  if (FinalOutput)
6556  LinkingOutput = FinalOutput->getValue();
6557  else
6558  LinkingOutput = getDefaultImageName();
6559  }
6560 
6561  BuildJobsForAction(C, A, &C.getDefaultToolChain(),
6562  /*BoundArch*/ StringRef(),
6563  /*AtTopLevel*/ true,
6564  /*MultipleArchs*/ ArchNames.size() > 1,
6565  /*LinkingOutput*/ LinkingOutput, CachedResults,
6566  /*TargetDeviceOffloadKind*/ Action::OFK_None);
6567  }
6568 
6569  // If we have more than one job, then disable integrated-cc1 for now. Do this
6570  // also when we need to report process execution statistics.
6571  if (C.getJobs().size() > 1 || CCPrintProcessStats)
6572  for (auto &J : C.getJobs())
6573  J.InProcess = false;
6574 
6575  if (CCPrintProcessStats) {
6576  C.setPostCallback([=](const Command &Cmd, int Res) {
6577  Optional<llvm::sys::ProcessStatistics> ProcStat =
6578  Cmd.getProcessStatistics();
6579  if (!ProcStat)
6580  return;
6581 
6582  const char *LinkingOutput = nullptr;
6583  if (FinalOutput)
6584  LinkingOutput = FinalOutput->getValue();
6585  else if (!Cmd.getOutputFilenames().empty())
6586  LinkingOutput = Cmd.getOutputFilenames().front().c_str();
6587  else
6588  LinkingOutput = getDefaultImageName();
6589 
6590  if (CCPrintStatReportFilename.empty()) {
6591  using namespace llvm;
6592  // Human readable output.
6593  outs() << sys::path::filename(Cmd.getExecutable()) << ": "
6594  << "output=" << LinkingOutput;
6595  outs() << ", total="
6596  << format("%.3f", ProcStat->TotalTime.count() / 1000.) << " ms"
6597  << ", user="
6598  << format("%.3f", ProcStat->UserTime.count() / 1000.) << " ms"
6599  << ", mem=" << ProcStat->PeakMemory << " Kb\n";
6600  } else {
6601  // CSV format.
6602  std::string Buffer;
6603  llvm::raw_string_ostream Out(Buffer);
6604  llvm::sys::printArg(Out, llvm::sys::path::filename(Cmd.getExecutable()),
6605  /*Quote*/ true);
6606  Out << ',';
6607  llvm::sys::printArg(Out, LinkingOutput, true);
6608  Out << ',' << ProcStat->TotalTime.count() << ','
6609  << ProcStat->UserTime.count() << ',' << ProcStat->PeakMemory
6610  << '\n';
6611  Out.flush();
6612  std::error_code EC;
6613  llvm::raw_fd_ostream OS(CCPrintStatReportFilename, EC,
6614  llvm::sys::fs::OF_Append |
6615  llvm::sys::fs::OF_Text);
6616  if (EC)
6617  return;
6618  auto L = OS.lock();
6619  if (!L) {
6620  llvm::errs() << "ERROR: Cannot lock file "
6621  << CCPrintStatReportFilename << ": "
6622  << toString(L.takeError()) << "\n";
6623  return;
6624  }
6625  OS << Buffer;
6626  OS.flush();
6627  }
6628  });
6629  }
6630 
6631  // If the user passed -Qunused-arguments or there were errors, don't warn
6632  // about any unused arguments.
6633  if (Diags.hasErrorOccurred() ||
6634  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_Qunused_arguments))
6635  return;
6636 
6637  // Claim -### here.
6638  (void)C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__HASH_HASH_HASH);
6639 
6640  // Claim --driver-mode, --rsp-quoting, it was handled earlier.
6641  (void)C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_driver_mode);
6642  (void)C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_rsp_quoting);
6643 
6644  for (Arg *A : C.getArgs()) {
6645  // FIXME: It would be nice to be able to send the argument to the
6646  // DiagnosticsEngine, so that extra values, position, and so on could be
6647  // printed.
6648  if (!A->isClaimed()) {
6649  if (A->getOption().hasFlag(options::NoArgumentUnused))
6650  continue;
6651 
6652  // Suppress the warning automatically if this is just a flag, and it is an
6653  // instance of an argument we already claimed.
6654  const Option &Opt = A->getOption();
6655  if (Opt.getKind() == Option::FlagClass) {
6656  bool DuplicateClaimed = false;
6657 
6658  for (const Arg *AA : C.getArgs().filtered(&Opt)) {
6659  if (AA->isClaimed()) {
6660  DuplicateClaimed = true;
6661  break;
6662  }
6663  }
6664 
6665  if (DuplicateClaimed)
6666  continue;
6667  }
6668 
6669  // In clang-cl, don't mention unknown arguments here since they have
6670  // already been warned about.
6671  if (!IsCLMode() || !A->getOption().matches(options::OPT_UNKNOWN))
6672  Diag(clang::diag::warn_drv_unused_argument)
6673  << A->getAsString(C.getArgs());
6674  }
6675  }
6676 }
6677 
6678 namespace {
6679 /// Utility class to control the collapse of dependent actions and select the
6680 /// tools accordingly.
6681 class ToolSelector final {
6682  /// The tool chain this selector refers to.
6683  const ToolChain &TC;
6684 
6685  /// The compilation this selector refers to.
6686  const Compilation &C;
6687 
6688  /// The base action this selector refers to.
6689  const JobAction *BaseAction;
6690 
6691  /// Set to true if the current toolchain refers to host actions.
6692  bool IsHostSelector;
6693 
6694  /// Set to true if save-temps and embed-bitcode functionalities are active.
6695  bool SaveTemps;
6696  bool EmbedBitcode;
6697 
6698  /// Get previous dependent action or null if that does not exist. If
6699  /// \a CanBeCollapsed is false, that action must be legal to collapse or
6700  /// null will be returned.
6701  const JobAction *getPrevDependentAction(const ActionList &Inputs,
6702  ActionList &SavedOffloadAction,
6703  bool CanBeCollapsed = true) {
6704  // An option can be collapsed only if it has a single input.
6705  if (Inputs.size() != 1)
6706  return nullptr;
6707 
6708  Action *CurAction = *Inputs.begin();
6709  if (CanBeCollapsed &&
6710  !CurAction->isCollapsingWithNextDependentActionLegal())
6711  return nullptr;
6712 
6713  // If the input action is an offload action. Look through it and save any
6714  // offload action that can be dropped in the event of a collapse.
6715  if (auto *OA = dyn_cast<OffloadAction>(CurAction)) {
6716  // If the dependent action is a device action, we will attempt to collapse
6717  // only with other device actions. Otherwise, we would do the same but
6718  // with host actions only.
6719  if (!IsHostSelector) {
6720  if (OA->hasSingleDeviceDependence(/*DoNotConsiderHostActions=*/true)) {
6721  CurAction =
6722  OA->getSingleDeviceDependence(/*DoNotConsiderHostActions=*/true);
6723  if (CanBeCollapsed &&
6724  !CurAction->isCollapsingWithNextDependentActionLegal())
6725  return nullptr;
6726  SavedOffloadAction.push_back(OA);
6727  return dyn_cast<JobAction>(CurAction);
6728  }
6729  } else if (OA->hasHostDependence()) {
6730  CurAction = OA->getHostDependence();
6731  if (CanBeCollapsed &&
6732  !CurAction->isCollapsingWithNextDependentActionLegal())
6733  return nullptr;
6734  SavedOffloadAction.push_back(OA);
6735  return dyn_cast<JobAction>(CurAction);
6736  }
6737  return nullptr;
6738  }
6739 
6740  return dyn_cast<JobAction>(CurAction);
6741  }
6742 
6743  /// Return true if an assemble action can be collapsed.
6744  bool canCollapseAssembleAction() const {
6745  return TC.useIntegratedAs() && !SaveTemps &&
6746  !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_via_file_asm) &&
6747  !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_FA) &&
6748  !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fa);
6749  }
6750 
6751  /// Return true if a preprocessor action can be collapsed.
6752  bool canCollapsePreprocessorAction() const {
6753  return !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_no_integrated_cpp) &&
6754  !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_traditional_cpp) && !SaveTemps &&
6755  !C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_rewrite_objc);
6756  }
6757 
6758  /// Struct that relates an action with the offload actions that would be
6759  /// collapsed with it.
6760  struct JobActionInfo final {
6761  /// The action this info refers to.
6762  const JobAction *JA = nullptr;
6763  /// The offload actions we need to take care off if this action is
6764  /// collapsed.
6765  ActionList SavedOffloadAction;
6766  };
6767 
6768  /// Append collapsed offload actions from the give nnumber of elements in the
6769  /// action info array.
6770  static void AppendCollapsedOffloadAction(ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction,
6771  ArrayRef<JobActionInfo> &ActionInfo,
6772  unsigned ElementNum) {
6773  assert(ElementNum <= ActionInfo.size() && "Invalid number of elements.");
6774  for (unsigned I = 0; I < ElementNum; ++I)
6775  CollapsedOffloadAction.append(ActionInfo[I].SavedOffloadAction.begin(),
6776  ActionInfo[I].SavedOffloadAction.end());
6777  }
6778 
6779  /// Functions that attempt to perform the combining. They detect if that is
6780  /// legal, and if so they update the inputs \a Inputs and the offload action
6781  /// that were collapsed in \a CollapsedOffloadAction. A tool that deals with
6782  /// the combined action is returned. If the combining is not legal or if the
6783  /// tool does not exist, null is returned.
6784  /// Currently three kinds of collapsing are supported:
6785  /// - Assemble + Backend + Compile;
6786  /// - Assemble + Backend ;
6787  /// - Backend + Compile.
6788  const Tool *
6789  combineAssembleBackendCompile(ArrayRef<JobActionInfo> ActionInfo,
6790  ActionList &Inputs,
6791  ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction) {
6792  if (ActionInfo.size() < 3 || !canCollapseAssembleAction())
6793  return nullptr;
6794  auto *AJ = dyn_cast<AssembleJobAction>(ActionInfo[0].JA);
6795  auto *BJ = dyn_cast<BackendJobAction>(ActionInfo[1].JA);
6796  auto *CJ = dyn_cast<CompileJobAction>(ActionInfo[2].JA);
6797  if (!AJ || !BJ || !CJ)
6798  return nullptr;
6799 
6800  // Get compiler tool.
6801  const Tool *T = TC.SelectTool(*CJ);
6802  if (!T)
6803  return nullptr;
6804 
6805  // Can't collapse if we don't have codegen support unless we are
6806  // emitting LLVM IR.
6807  bool OutputIsLLVM = types::isLLVMIR(ActionInfo[0].JA->getType());
6808  if (!T->hasIntegratedBackend() && !(OutputIsLLVM && T->canEmitIR()))
6809  return nullptr;
6810 
6811  // When using -fembed-bitcode, it is required to have the same tool (clang)
6812  // for both CompilerJA and BackendJA. Otherwise, combine two stages.
6813  if (EmbedBitcode) {
6814  const Tool *BT = TC.SelectTool(*BJ);
6815  if (BT == T)
6816  return nullptr;
6817  }
6818 
6819  if (!T->hasIntegratedAssembler())
6820  return nullptr;
6821 
6822  Inputs = CJ->getInputs();
6823  AppendCollapsedOffloadAction(CollapsedOffloadAction, ActionInfo,
6824  /*NumElements=*/3);
6825  return T;
6826  }
6827  const Tool *combineAssembleBackend(ArrayRef<JobActionInfo> ActionInfo,
6828  ActionList &Inputs,
6829  ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction) {
6830  if (ActionInfo.size() < 2 || !canCollapseAssembleAction())
6831  return nullptr;
6832  auto *AJ = dyn_cast<AssembleJobAction>(ActionInfo[0].JA);
6833  auto *BJ = dyn_cast<BackendJobAction>(ActionInfo[1].JA);
6834  if (!AJ || !BJ)
6835  return nullptr;
6836 
6837  // Get backend tool.
6838  const Tool *T = TC.SelectTool(*BJ);
6839  if (!T)
6840  return nullptr;
6841 
6842  if (!T->hasIntegratedAssembler())
6843  return nullptr;
6844 
6845  Inputs = BJ->getInputs();
6846  AppendCollapsedOffloadAction(CollapsedOffloadAction, ActionInfo,
6847  /*NumElements=*/2);
6848  return T;
6849  }
6850  const Tool *combineBackendCompile(ArrayRef<JobActionInfo> ActionInfo,
6851  ActionList &Inputs,
6852  ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction) {
6853  if (ActionInfo.size() < 2)
6854  return nullptr;
6855  auto *BJ = dyn_cast<BackendJobAction>(ActionInfo[0].JA);
6856  auto *CJ = dyn_cast<CompileJobAction>(ActionInfo[1].JA);
6857  if (!BJ || !CJ)
6858  return nullptr;
6859 
6860  // Check if the initial input (to the compile job or its predessor if one
6861  // exists) is LLVM bitcode. In that case, no preprocessor step is required
6862  // and we can still collapse the compile and backend jobs when we have
6863  // -save-temps. I.e. there is no need for a separate compile job just to
6864  // emit unoptimized bitcode.
6865  bool InputIsBitcode = true;
6866  for (size_t i = 1; i < ActionInfo.size(); i++)
6867  if (ActionInfo[i].JA->getType() != types::TY_LLVM_BC &&
6868  ActionInfo[i].JA->getType() != types::TY_LTO_BC) {
6869  InputIsBitcode = false;
6870  break;
6871  }
6872  if (!InputIsBitcode && !canCollapsePreprocessorAction())
6873  return nullptr;
6874 
6875  // Get compiler tool.
6876  const Tool *T = TC.SelectTool(*CJ);
6877  if (!T)
6878  return nullptr;
6879 
6880  // Can't collapse if we don't have codegen support unless we are
6881  // emitting LLVM IR.
6882  bool OutputIsLLVM = types::isLLVMIR(ActionInfo[0].JA->getType());
6883  if (!T->hasIntegratedBackend() && !(OutputIsLLVM && T->canEmitIR()))
6884  return nullptr;
6885 
6886  if (T->canEmitIR() && ((SaveTemps && !InputIsBitcode) || EmbedBitcode))
6887  return nullptr;
6888 
6889  Inputs = CJ->getInputs();
6890  AppendCollapsedOffloadAction(CollapsedOffloadAction, ActionInfo,
6891  /*NumElements=*/2);
6892  return T;
6893  }
6894 
6895  /// Updates the inputs if the obtained tool supports combining with
6896  /// preprocessor action, and the current input is indeed a preprocessor
6897  /// action. If combining results in the collapse of offloading actions, those
6898  /// are appended to \a CollapsedOffloadAction.
6899  void combineWithPreprocessor(const Tool *T, ActionList &Inputs,
6900  ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction) {
6901  if (!T || !canCollapsePreprocessorAction() || !T->hasIntegratedCPP())
6902  return;
6903 
6904  // Attempt to get a preprocessor action dependence.
6905  ActionList PreprocessJobOffloadActions;
6906  ActionList NewInputs;
6907  for (Action *A : Inputs) {
6908  auto *PJ = getPrevDependentAction({A}, PreprocessJobOffloadActions);
6909  if (!PJ || !isa<PreprocessJobAction>(PJ)) {
6910  NewInputs.push_back(A);
6911  continue;
6912  }
6913 
6914  // This is legal to combine. Append any offload action we found and add the
6915  // current input to preprocessor inputs.
6916  CollapsedOffloadAction.append(PreprocessJobOffloadActions.begin(),
6917  PreprocessJobOffloadActions.end());
6918  NewInputs.append(PJ->input_begin(), PJ->input_end());
6919  }
6920  Inputs = NewInputs;
6921  }
6922 
6923 public:
6924  ToolSelector(const JobAction *BaseAction, const ToolChain &TC,
6925  const Compilation &C, bool SaveTemps, bool EmbedBitcode)
6926  : TC(TC), C(C), BaseAction(BaseAction), SaveTemps(SaveTemps),
6927  EmbedBitcode(EmbedBitcode) {
6928  assert(BaseAction && "Invalid base action.");
6929  IsHostSelector = BaseAction->getOffloadingDeviceKind() == Action::OFK_None;
6930  }
6931 
6932  /// Check if a chain of actions can be combined and return the tool that can
6933  /// handle the combination of actions. The pointer to the current inputs \a
6934  /// Inputs and the list of offload actions \a CollapsedOffloadActions
6935  /// connected to collapsed actions are updated accordingly. The latter enables
6936  /// the caller of the selector to process them afterwards instead of just
6937  /// dropping them. If no suitable tool is found, null will be returned.
6938  const Tool *getTool(ActionList &Inputs,
6939  ActionList &CollapsedOffloadAction) {
6940  //
6941  // Get the largest chain of actions that we could combine.
6942  //
6943 
6944  SmallVector<JobActionInfo, 5> ActionChain(1);
6945  ActionChain.back().JA = BaseAction;
6946  while (ActionChain.back().JA) {
6947  const Action *CurAction = ActionChain.back().JA;
6948 
6949  // Grow the chain by one element.
6950  ActionChain.resize(ActionChain.size() + 1);
6951  JobActionInfo &AI = ActionChain.back();
6952 
6953  // Attempt to fill it with the
6954  AI.JA =
6955  getPrevDependentAction(CurAction->getInputs(), AI.SavedOffloadAction);
6956  }
6957 
6958  // Pop the last action info as it could not be filled.
6959  ActionChain.pop_back();
6960 
6961  //
6962  // Attempt to combine actions. If all combining attempts failed, just return
6963  // the tool of the provided action. At the end we attempt to combine the
6964  // action with any preprocessor action it may depend on.
6965  //
6966 
6967  const Tool *T = combineAssembleBackendCompile(ActionChain, Inputs,
6968  CollapsedOffloadAction);
6969  if (!T)
6970  T = combineAssembleBackend(ActionChain, Inputs, CollapsedOffloadAction);
6971  if (!T)
6972  T = combineBackendCompile(ActionChain, Inputs, CollapsedOffloadAction);
6973  if (!T) {
6974  Inputs = BaseAction->getInputs();
6975  T = TC.SelectTool(*BaseAction);
6976  }
6977 
6978  combineWithPreprocessor(T, Inputs, CollapsedOffloadAction);
6979  return T;
6980  }
6981 };
6982 }
6983 
6984 /// Return a string that uniquely identifies the result of a job. The bound arch
6985 /// is not necessarily represented in the toolchain's triple -- for example,
6986 /// armv7 and armv7s both map to the same triple -- so we need both in our map.
6987 /// Also, we need to add the offloading device kind, as the same tool chain can
6988 /// be used for host and device for some programming models, e.g. OpenMP.
6989 static std::string GetTriplePlusArchString(const ToolChain *TC,
6990  StringRef BoundArch,
6991  Action::OffloadKind OffloadKind) {
6992  std::string TriplePlusArch = TC->getTriple().normalize();
6993  if (!BoundArch.empty()) {
6994  TriplePlusArch += "-";
6995  TriplePlusArch += BoundArch;
6996  }
6997  TriplePlusArch += "-";
6998  TriplePlusArch += Action::GetOffloadKindName(OffloadKind);
6999  return TriplePlusArch;
7000 }
7001 
7002 static void CollectForEachInputs(
7003  InputInfoList &InputInfos, const Action *SourceAction, const ToolChain *TC,
7004  StringRef BoundArch, Action::OffloadKind TargetDeviceOffloadKind,
7005  const std::map<std::pair<const Action *, std::string>, InputInfoList>
7006  &CachedResults) {
7007  for (const Action *Input : SourceAction->getInputs()) {
7008  // Search for the Input, if not in the cache assume actions were collapsed
7009  // so recurse.
7010  auto Lookup = CachedResults.find(
7011  {Input,
7012  GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)});
7013  if (Lookup != CachedResults.end()) {
7014  InputInfos.append(Lookup->second);
7015  } else {
7016  CollectForEachInputs(InputInfos, Input, TC, BoundArch,
7017  TargetDeviceOffloadKind, CachedResults);
7018  }
7019  }
7020 }
7021 
7022 InputInfoList Driver::BuildJobsForAction(
7023  Compilation &C, const Action *A, const ToolChain *TC, StringRef BoundArch,
7024  bool AtTopLevel, bool MultipleArchs, const char *LinkingOutput,
7025  std::map<std::pair<const Action *, std::string>, InputInfoList>
7026  &CachedResults,
7027  Action::OffloadKind TargetDeviceOffloadKind) const {
7028  std::pair<const Action *, std::string> ActionTC = {
7029  A, GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)};
7030  auto CachedResult = CachedResults.find(ActionTC);
7031  if (CachedResult != CachedResults.end()) {
7032  return CachedResult->second;
7033  }
7034  InputInfoList Result = BuildJobsForActionNoCache(
7035  C, A, TC, BoundArch, AtTopLevel, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput,
7036  CachedResults, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7037  CachedResults[ActionTC] = Result;
7038  return Result;
7039 }
7040 
7041 InputInfoList Driver::BuildJobsForActionNoCache(
7042  Compilation &C, const Action *A, const ToolChain *TC, StringRef BoundArch,
7043  bool AtTopLevel, bool MultipleArchs, const char *LinkingOutput,
7044  std::map<std::pair<const Action *, std::string>, InputInfoList>
7045  &CachedResults,
7046  Action::OffloadKind TargetDeviceOffloadKind) const {
7047  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Building compilation jobs");
7048 
7049  InputInfoList OffloadDependencesInputInfo;
7050  bool BuildingForOffloadDevice = TargetDeviceOffloadKind != Action::OFK_None;
7051  if (const OffloadAction *OA = dyn_cast<OffloadAction>(A)) {
7052  // The 'Darwin' toolchain is initialized only when its arguments are
7053  // computed. Get the default arguments for OFK_None to ensure that
7054  // initialization is performed before processing the offload action.
7055  // FIXME: Remove when darwin's toolchain is initialized during construction.
7056  C.getArgsForToolChain(TC, BoundArch, Action::OFK_None);
7057 
7058  // The offload action is expected to be used in four different situations.
7059  //
7060  // a) Set a toolchain/architecture/kind for a host action:
7061  // Host Action 1 -> OffloadAction -> Host Action 2
7062  //
7063  // b) Set a toolchain/architecture/kind for a device action;
7064  // Device Action 1 -> OffloadAction -> Device Action 2
7065  //
7066  // c) Specify a device dependence to a host action;
7067  // Device Action 1 _
7068  // \
7069  // Host Action 1 ---> OffloadAction -> Host Action 2
7070  //
7071  // d) Specify a host dependence to a device action.
7072  // Host Action 1 _
7073  // \
7074  // Device Action 1 ---> OffloadAction -> Device Action 2
7075  //
7076  // For a) and b), we just return the job generated for the dependence. For
7077  // c) and d) we override the current action with the host/device dependence
7078  // if the current toolchain is host/device and set the offload dependences
7079  // info with the jobs obtained from the device/host dependence(s).
7080 
7081  // If there is a single device option, just generate the job for it.
7082  if (OA->hasSingleDeviceDependence()) {
7083  InputInfoList DevA;
7084  OA->doOnEachDeviceDependence([&](Action *DepA, const ToolChain *DepTC,
7085  const char *DepBoundArch) {
7086  DevA =
7087  BuildJobsForAction(C, DepA, DepTC, DepBoundArch, AtTopLevel,
7088  /*MultipleArchs*/ !!DepBoundArch, LinkingOutput,
7089  CachedResults, DepA->getOffloadingDeviceKind());
7090  });
7091  return DevA;
7092  }
7093 
7094  // If 'Action 2' is host, we generate jobs for the device dependences and
7095  // override the current action with the host dependence. Otherwise, we
7096  // generate the host dependences and override the action with the device
7097  // dependence. The dependences can't therefore be a top-level action.
7098  OA->doOnEachDependence(
7099  /*IsHostDependence=*/BuildingForOffloadDevice,
7100  [&](Action *DepA, const ToolChain *DepTC, const char *DepBoundArch) {
7101  OffloadDependencesInputInfo.append(BuildJobsForAction(
7102  C, DepA, DepTC, DepBoundArch, /*AtTopLevel=*/false,
7103  /*MultipleArchs*/ !!DepBoundArch, LinkingOutput, CachedResults,
7104  DepA->getOffloadingDeviceKind()));
7105  });
7106 
7107  A = BuildingForOffloadDevice
7108  ? OA->getSingleDeviceDependence(/*DoNotConsiderHostActions=*/true)
7109  : OA->getHostDependence();
7110 
7111  // We may have already built this action as a part of the offloading
7112  // toolchain, return the cached input if so.
7113  std::pair<const Action *, std::string> ActionTC = {
7114  OA->getHostDependence(),
7115  GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)};
7116  if (CachedResults.find(ActionTC) != CachedResults.end()) {
7117  InputInfoList Inputs = CachedResults[ActionTC];
7118  Inputs.append(OffloadDependencesInputInfo);
7119  return Inputs;
7120  }
7121  }
7122 
7123  if (const InputAction *IA = dyn_cast<InputAction>(A)) {
7124  // FIXME: It would be nice to not claim this here; maybe the old scheme of
7125  // just using Args was better?
7126  const Arg &Input = IA->getInputArg();
7127  Input.claim();
7128  if (Input.getOption().matches(options::OPT_INPUT)) {
7129  const char *Name = Input.getValue();
7130  return {InputInfo(A, Name, /* _BaseInput = */ Name)};
7131  }
7132  return {InputInfo(A, &Input, /* _BaseInput = */ "")};
7133  }
7134  if (const BindArchAction *BAA = dyn_cast<BindArchAction>(A)) {
7135  const ToolChain *TC;
7136  StringRef ArchName = BAA->getArchName();
7137 
7138  if (!ArchName.empty())
7139  TC = &getToolChain(C.getArgs(),
7140  computeTargetTriple(*this, TargetTriple,
7141  C.getArgs(), ArchName));
7142  else
7143  TC = &C.getDefaultToolChain();
7144 
7145  return BuildJobsForAction(C, *BAA->input_begin(), TC, ArchName, AtTopLevel,
7146  MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput, CachedResults,
7147  TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7148  }
7149 
7150  if (const ForEachWrappingAction *FEA = dyn_cast<ForEachWrappingAction>(A)) {
7151  // Check that the main action wasn't already processed.
7152  auto MainActionOutput = CachedResults.find(
7153  {FEA->getJobAction(),
7154  GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)});
7155  if (MainActionOutput != CachedResults.end()) {
7156  // The input was processed on behalf of another foreach.
7157  // Add entry in cache and return.
7158  CachedResults[{FEA, GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch,
7159  TargetDeviceOffloadKind)}] =
7160  MainActionOutput->second;
7161  return MainActionOutput->second;
7162  }
7163 
7164  // Build commands for the TFormInput then take any command added after as
7165  // needing a llvm-foreach wrapping.
7166  BuildJobsForAction(C, FEA->getTFormInput(), TC, BoundArch,
7167  /*AtTopLevel=*/false, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput,
7168  CachedResults, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7169  unsigned OffsetIdx = C.getJobs().size();
7170  BuildJobsForAction(C, FEA->getJobAction(), TC, BoundArch,
7171  /*AtTopLevel=*/false, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput,
7172  CachedResults, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7173 
7174  auto begin = C.getJobs().getJobsForOverride().begin() + OffsetIdx;
7175  auto end = C.getJobs().getJobsForOverride().end();
7176 
7177  // Steal the commands.
7178  llvm::SmallVector<std::unique_ptr<Command>, 4> JobsToWrap(
7179  std::make_move_iterator(begin), std::make_move_iterator(end));
7180  C.getJobs().getJobsForOverride().erase(begin, end);
7181 
7182  InputInfo ActionResult;
7183  for (std::unique_ptr<Command> Cmd :
7184  llvm::make_range(std::make_move_iterator(JobsToWrap.begin()),
7185  std::make_move_iterator(JobsToWrap.end()))) {
7186  const JobAction *SourceAction = cast<JobAction>(&Cmd->getSource());
7187 
7188  ActionResult = CachedResults.at(
7189  {SourceAction,
7190  GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)}).front();
7191  InputInfoList InputInfos;
7192  CollectForEachInputs(InputInfos, SourceAction, TC, BoundArch,
7193  TargetDeviceOffloadKind, CachedResults);
7194  const Tool *Creator = &Cmd->getCreator();
7195 
7196  tools::SYCL::constructLLVMForeachCommand(
7197  C, *SourceAction, std::move(Cmd), InputInfos, ActionResult, Creator,
7198  "", types::getTypeTempSuffix(ActionResult.getType()));
7199  }
7200  return { ActionResult };
7201  }
7202 
7203  ActionList Inputs = A->getInputs();
7204 
7205  const JobAction *JA = cast<JobAction>(A);
7206  ActionList CollapsedOffloadActions;
7207 
7208  auto *DA = dyn_cast<OffloadDepsJobAction>(JA);
7209  const ToolChain *JATC = DA ? DA->getHostTC() : TC;
7210 
7211  ToolSelector TS(JA, *JATC, C, isSaveTempsEnabled(),
7212  embedBitcodeInObject() && !isUsingLTO());
7213  const Tool *T = TS.getTool(Inputs, CollapsedOffloadActions);
7214 
7215  if (!T)
7216  return {InputInfo()};
7217 
7218  if (BuildingForOffloadDevice &&
7219  A->getOffloadingDeviceKind() == Action::OFK_OpenMP) {
7220  if (TC->getTriple().isAMDGCN()) {
7221  // AMDGCN treats backend and assemble actions as no-op because
7222  // linker does not support object files.
7223  if (const BackendJobAction *BA = dyn_cast<BackendJobAction>(A)) {
7224  return BuildJobsForAction(C, *BA->input_begin(), TC, BoundArch,
7225  AtTopLevel, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput,
7226  CachedResults, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7227  }
7228 
7229  if (const AssembleJobAction *AA = dyn_cast<AssembleJobAction>(A)) {
7230  return BuildJobsForAction(C, *AA->input_begin(), TC, BoundArch,
7231  AtTopLevel, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput,
7232  CachedResults, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
7233  }
7234  }
7235  }
7236 
7237  // If we've collapsed action list that contained OffloadAction we
7238  // need to build jobs for host/device-side inputs it may have held.
7239  for (const auto *OA : CollapsedOffloadActions)
7240  cast<OffloadAction>(OA)->doOnEachDependence(
7241  /*IsHostDependence=*/BuildingForOffloadDevice,
7242  [&](Action *DepA, const ToolChain *DepTC, const char *DepBoundArch) {
7243  OffloadDependencesInputInfo.append(BuildJobsForAction(
7244  C, DepA, DepTC, DepBoundArch, /* AtTopLevel */ false,
7245  /*MultipleArchs=*/!!DepBoundArch, LinkingOutput, CachedResults,
7246  DepA->getOffloadingDeviceKind()));
7247  });
7248 
7249  // Only use pipes when there is exactly one input.
7250  InputInfoList InputInfos;
7251  for (const Action *Input : Inputs) {
7252  // Treat dsymutil and verify sub-jobs as being at the top-level too, they
7253  // shouldn't get temporary output names.
7254  // FIXME: Clean this up.
7255  bool SubJobAtTopLevel =
7256  AtTopLevel && (isa<DsymutilJobAction>(A) || isa<VerifyJobAction>(A));
7257  InputInfos.append(BuildJobsForAction(
7258  C, Input, JATC, DA ? DA->getOffloadingArch() : BoundArch,
7259  SubJobAtTopLevel, MultipleArchs, LinkingOutput, CachedResults,
7260  A->getOffloadingDeviceKind()));
7261  }
7262 
7263  // Always use the first file input as the base input.
7264  const char *BaseInput = InputInfos[0].getBaseInput();
7265  for (auto &Info : InputInfos) {
7266  if (Info.isFilename()) {
7267  BaseInput = Info.getBaseInput();
7268  break;
7269  }
7270  }
7271 
7272  // ... except dsymutil actions, which use their actual input as the base
7273  // input.
7274  if (JA->getType() == types::TY_dSYM)
7275  BaseInput = InputInfos[0].getFilename();
7276 
7277  // ... and in header module compilations, which use the module name.
7278  if (auto *ModuleJA = dyn_cast<HeaderModulePrecompileJobAction>(JA))
7279  BaseInput = ModuleJA->getModuleName();
7280 
7281  // Append outputs of offload device jobs to the input list
7282  if (!OffloadDependencesInputInfo.empty())
7283  InputInfos.append(OffloadDependencesInputInfo.begin(),
7284  OffloadDependencesInputInfo.end());
7285 
7286  // Set the effective triple of the toolchain for the duration of this job.
7287  llvm::Triple EffectiveTriple;
7288  const ToolChain &ToolTC = T->getToolChain();
7289  const ArgList &Args =
7290  C.getArgsForToolChain(TC, BoundArch, A->getOffloadingDeviceKind());
7291  if (InputInfos.size() != 1) {
7292  EffectiveTriple = llvm::Triple(ToolTC.ComputeEffectiveClangTriple(Args));
7293  } else {
7294  // Pass along the input type if it can be unambiguously determined.
7295  EffectiveTriple = llvm::Triple(
7296  ToolTC.ComputeEffectiveClangTriple(Args, InputInfos[0].getType()));
7297  }
7298  RegisterEffectiveTriple TripleRAII(ToolTC, EffectiveTriple);
7299 
7300  // Determine the place to write output to, if any.
7301  InputInfo Result;
7302  InputInfoList UnbundlingResults;
7303  if (auto *UA = dyn_cast<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(JA)) {
7304  // If we have an unbundling job, we need to create results for all the
7305  // outputs. We also update the results cache so that other actions using
7306  // this unbundling action can get the right results.
7307  for (auto &UI : UA->getDependentActionsInfo()) {
7308  assert(UI.DependentOffloadKind != Action::OFK_None &&
7309  "Unbundling with no offloading??");
7310 
7311  // Unbundling actions are never at the top level. When we generate the
7312  // offloading prefix, we also do that for the host file because the
7313  // unbundling action does not change the type of the output which can
7314  // cause a overwrite.
7315  InputInfo CurI;
7316  bool IsFPGAObjLink =
7317  (JA->getType() == types::TY_Object &&
7318  EffectiveTriple.getSubArch() == llvm::Triple::SPIRSubArch_fpga &&
7319  C.getInputArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ));
7320  if (C.getDriver().getOffloadStaticLibSeen() &&
7321  (JA->getType() == types::TY_Archive ||
7322  JA->getType() == types::TY_Tempfilelist)) {
7323  // Host part of the unbundled static archive is not used.
7324  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host)
7325  continue;
7326  // Host part of the unbundled object is not used when using the
7327  // FPGA target and -fsycl-link is enabled.
7328  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host && IsFPGAObjLink)
7329  continue;
7330  std::string TmpFileName = C.getDriver().GetTemporaryPath(
7331  llvm::sys::path::stem(BaseInput),
7332  JA->getType() == types::TY_Archive ? "a" : "txt");
7333  const char *TmpFile =
7334  C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpFileName));
7335  CurI = InputInfo(JA->getType(), TmpFile, TmpFile);
7336  } else if (types::isFPGA(JA->getType())) {
7337  std::string Ext(types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA->getType()));
7338  types::ID TI = types::TY_Object;
7339  if (EffectiveTriple.isSPIR()) {
7340  if (!UI.DependentToolChain->getTriple().isSPIR())
7341  continue;
7342  // Output file from unbundle is FPGA device. Name the file
7343  // accordingly.
7344  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host) {
7345  // Do not add the current info for Host with FPGA device. The host
7346  // side isn't used
7347  continue;
7348  }
7349  if (JA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCO) {
7350  TI = types::TY_TempAOCOfilelist;
7351  Ext = "txt";
7352  }
7353  if (JA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR ||
7354  JA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_AOCR_EMU)
7355  // AOCR files are always unbundled into a list file.
7356  TI = types::TY_Tempfilelist;
7357  } else {
7358  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_SYCL)
7359  // Do not add the current info for device with FPGA device. The
7360  // device side isn't used
7361  continue;
7362  TI = types::TY_Tempfilelist;
7363  Ext = "txt";
7364  }
7365  std::string TmpFileName = C.getDriver().GetTemporaryPath(
7366  llvm::sys::path::stem(BaseInput), Ext);
7367  const char *TmpFile =
7368  C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpFileName));
7369  CurI = InputInfo(TI, TmpFile, TmpFile);
7370  } else {
7371  // Host part of the unbundled object is not used when -fsycl-link is
7372  // enabled with FPGA target
7373  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host && IsFPGAObjLink)
7374  continue;
7375  std::string OffloadingPrefix = Action::GetOffloadingFileNamePrefix(
7376  UI.DependentOffloadKind,
7377  UI.DependentToolChain->getTriple().normalize(),
7378  /*CreatePrefixForHost=*/true);
7379  CurI = InputInfo(
7380  UA,
7381  GetNamedOutputPath(C, *UA, BaseInput, UI.DependentBoundArch,
7382  /*AtTopLevel=*/false,
7383  MultipleArchs ||
7384  UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP,
7385  OffloadingPrefix),
7386  BaseInput);
7387  }
7388  // Save the unbundling result.
7389  UnbundlingResults.push_back(CurI);
7390 
7391  // Get the unique string identifier for this dependence and cache the
7392  // result.
7393  StringRef Arch;
7394  if (TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP ||
7395  TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_SYCL) {
7396  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host)
7397  Arch = StringRef();
7398  else
7399  Arch = UI.DependentBoundArch;
7400  } else
7401  Arch = BoundArch;
7402  // When unbundling for SYCL and there is no Target offload, assume
7403  // Host as the dependent offload, as the host path has been stripped
7404  // in this instance
7405  Action::OffloadKind DependentOffloadKind;
7406  if (UI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_SYCL &&
7407  TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_None)
7408  DependentOffloadKind = Action::OFK_Host;
7409  else
7410  DependentOffloadKind = UI.DependentOffloadKind;
7411 
7412  CachedResults[{A, GetTriplePlusArchString(UI.DependentToolChain, Arch,
7413  DependentOffloadKind)}] = {
7414  CurI};
7415  }
7416  // Do a check for a dependency file unbundle for FPGA. This is out of line
7417  // from a regular unbundle, so just create and return the name of the
7418  // unbundled file.
7419  if (JA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_Dependencies ||
7420  JA->getType() == types::TY_FPGA_Dependencies_List) {
7421  std::string Ext(types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA->getType()));
7422  std::string TmpFileName =
7423  C.getDriver().GetTemporaryPath(llvm::sys::path::stem(BaseInput), Ext);
7424  const char *TmpFile =
7425  C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpFileName));
7426  Result = InputInfo(JA->getType(), TmpFile, TmpFile);
7427  UnbundlingResults.push_back(Result);
7428  } else {
7429  // Now that we have all the results generated, select the one that should
7430  // be returned for the current depending action.
7431  std::pair<const Action *, std::string> ActionTC = {
7432  A, GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)};
7433  assert(CachedResults.find(ActionTC) != CachedResults.end() &&
7434  "Result does not exist??");
7435  Result = CachedResults[ActionTC].front();
7436  }
7437  } else if (auto *DA = dyn_cast<OffloadDepsJobAction>(JA)) {
7438  for (auto &DI : DA->getDependentActionsInfo()) {
7439  assert(DI.DependentOffloadKind != Action::OFK_None &&
7440  "Deps job with no offloading");
7441 
7442  std::string OffloadingPrefix = Action::GetOffloadingFileNamePrefix(
7443  DI.DependentOffloadKind,
7444  DI.DependentToolChain->getTriple().normalize(),
7445  /*CreatePrefixForHost=*/true);
7446  auto CurI = InputInfo(
7447  DA,
7448  GetNamedOutputPath(C, *DA, BaseInput, DI.DependentBoundArch,
7449  /*AtTopLevel=*/false,
7450  MultipleArchs ||
7451  DI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP,
7452  OffloadingPrefix),
7453  BaseInput);
7454  // Save the result.
7455  UnbundlingResults.push_back(CurI);
7456 
7457  // Get the unique string identifier for this dependence and cache the
7458  // result.
7459  StringRef Arch = TargetDeviceOffloadKind == Action::OFK_HIP
7460  ? DI.DependentOffloadKind == Action::OFK_Host
7461  ? StringRef()
7462  : DI.DependentBoundArch
7463  : BoundArch;
7464 
7465  CachedResults[{A, GetTriplePlusArchString(DI.DependentToolChain, Arch,
7466  DI.DependentOffloadKind)}] = {
7467  CurI};
7468  }
7469 
7470  // Now that we have all the results generated, select the one that should be
7471  // returned for the current depending action.
7472  std::pair<const Action *, std::string> ActionTC = {
7473  A, GetTriplePlusArchString(TC, BoundArch, TargetDeviceOffloadKind)};
7474  auto It = CachedResults.find(ActionTC);
7475  assert(It != CachedResults.end() && "Result does not exist??");
7476  Result = It->second.front();
7477  } else if (JA->getType() == types::TY_Nothing)
7478  Result = {InputInfo(A, BaseInput)};
7479  else {
7480  std::string OffloadingPrefix;
7481  // When generating binaries with -fsycl-link-target or -fsycl-link, the
7482  // output file prefix is the triple arch only. Do not add the arch when
7483  // compiling for host.
7484  if (!A->getOffloadingHostActiveKinds() &&
7485  (Args.getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_targets_EQ) ||
7486  Args.hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_link_EQ))) {
7487  OffloadingPrefix = "-";
7488  OffloadingPrefix += TC->getTriple().getArchName();
7489  } else {
7490  // We only have to generate a prefix for the host if this is not a
7491  // top-level action.
7492  OffloadingPrefix = Action::GetOffloadingFileNamePrefix(
7493  A->getOffloadingDeviceKind(), TC->getTriple().normalize(),
7494  /*CreatePrefixForHost=*/!!A->getOffloadingHostActiveKinds() &&
7495  !AtTopLevel);
7496  }
7497  if (isa<OffloadWrapperJobAction>(JA)) {
7498  if (Arg *FinalOutput = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_o))
7499  BaseInput = FinalOutput->getValue();
7500  else
7501  BaseInput = getDefaultImageName();
7502  BaseInput =
7503  C.getArgs().MakeArgString(std::string(BaseInput) + "-wrapper");
7504  }
7505  Result = InputInfo(A, GetNamedOutputPath(C, *JA, BaseInput, BoundArch,
7506  AtTopLevel, MultipleArchs,
7507  OffloadingPrefix),
7508  BaseInput);
7509  }
7510 
7511  if (CCCPrintBindings && !CCGenDiagnostics) {
7512  llvm::errs() << "# \"" << T->getToolChain().getTripleString() << '"'
7513  << " - \"" << T->getName() << "\", inputs: [";
7514  for (unsigned i = 0, e = InputInfos.size(); i != e; ++i) {
7515  llvm::errs() << InputInfos[i].getAsString();
7516  if (i + 1 != e)
7517  llvm::errs() << ", ";
7518  }
7519  if (UnbundlingResults.empty())
7520  llvm::errs() << "], output: " << Result.getAsString() << "\n";
7521  else {
7522  llvm::errs() << "], outputs: [";
7523  for (unsigned i = 0, e = UnbundlingResults.size(); i != e; ++i) {
7524  llvm::errs() << UnbundlingResults[i].getAsString();
7525  if (i + 1 != e)
7526  llvm::errs() << ", ";
7527  }
7528  llvm::errs() << "] \n";
7529  }
7530  } else {
7531  if (UnbundlingResults.empty())
7532  T->ConstructJob(
7533  C, *JA, Result, InputInfos,
7534  C.getArgsForToolChain(TC, BoundArch, JA->getOffloadingDeviceKind()),
7535  LinkingOutput);
7536  else
7537  T->ConstructJobMultipleOutputs(
7538  C, *JA, UnbundlingResults, InputInfos,
7539  C.getArgsForToolChain(TC, BoundArch, JA->getOffloadingDeviceKind()),
7540  LinkingOutput);
7541  }
7542  return {Result};
7543 }
7544 
7545 const char *Driver::getDefaultImageName() const {
7546  llvm::Triple Target(llvm::Triple::normalize(TargetTriple));
7547  return Target.isOSWindows() ? "a.exe" : "a.out";
7548 }
7549 
7550 /// Create output filename based on ArgValue, which could either be a
7551 /// full filename, filename without extension, or a directory. If ArgValue
7552 /// does not provide a filename, then use BaseName, and use the extension
7553 /// suitable for FileType.
7554 static const char *MakeCLOutputFilename(const ArgList &Args, StringRef ArgValue,
7555  StringRef BaseName,
7556  types::ID FileType) {
7557  SmallString<128> Filename = ArgValue;
7558 
7559  if (ArgValue.empty()) {
7560  // If the argument is empty, output to BaseName in the current dir.
7561  Filename = BaseName;
7562  } else if (llvm::sys::path::is_separator(Filename.back())) {
7563  // If the argument is a directory, output to BaseName in that dir.
7564  llvm::sys::path::append(Filename, BaseName);
7565  }
7566 
7567  if (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(ArgValue)) {
7568  // If the argument didn't provide an extension, then set it.
7569  const char *Extension = types::getTypeTempSuffix(FileType, true);
7570 
7571  if (FileType == types::TY_Image &&
7572  Args.hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_LD, options::OPT__SLASH_LDd)) {
7573  // The output file is a dll.
7574  Extension = "dll";
7575  }
7576 
7577  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(Filename, Extension);
7578  }
7579 
7580  return Args.MakeArgString(Filename.c_str());
7581 }
7582 
7583 static bool HasPreprocessOutput(const Action &JA) {
7584  if (isa<PreprocessJobAction>(JA))
7585  return true;
7586  if (isa<OffloadAction>(JA) && isa<PreprocessJobAction>(JA.getInputs()[0]))
7587  return true;
7588  if (isa<OffloadBundlingJobAction>(JA) &&
7589  HasPreprocessOutput(*(JA.getInputs()[0])))
7590  return true;
7591  return false;
7592 }
7593 
7594 const char *Driver::GetNamedOutputPath(Compilation &C, const JobAction &JA,
7595  const char *BaseInput,
7596  StringRef OrigBoundArch, bool AtTopLevel,
7597  bool MultipleArchs,
7598  StringRef OffloadingPrefix) const {
7599  std::string BoundArch = OrigBoundArch.str();
7600  if (is_style_windows(llvm::sys::path::Style::native)) {
7601  // BoundArch may contains ':', which is invalid in file names on Windows,
7602  // therefore replace it with '%'.
7603  std::replace(BoundArch.begin(), BoundArch.end(), ':', '@');
7604  }
7605 
7606  llvm::PrettyStackTraceString CrashInfo("Computing output path");
7607  // Output to a user requested destination?
7608  if (AtTopLevel && !isa<DsymutilJobAction>(JA) && !isa<VerifyJobAction>(JA)) {
7609  if (Arg *FinalOutput = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_o))
7610  return C.addResultFile(FinalOutput->getValue(), &JA);
7611  // Output to destination for -fsycl-device-only and Windows -o
7612  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_fsycl_device_only))
7613  if (Arg *FinalOutput = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_o))
7614  return C.addResultFile(FinalOutput->getValue(), &JA);
7615  }
7616 
7617  // For /P, preprocess to file named after BaseInput.
7618  if (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_P) &&
7619  ((AtTopLevel && isa<PreprocessJobAction>(JA)) ||
7620  isa<OffloadBundlingJobAction>(JA))) {
7621  StringRef BaseName = llvm::sys::path::filename(BaseInput);
7622  StringRef NameArg;
7623  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fi))
7624  NameArg = A->getValue();
7625  return C.addResultFile(
7626  MakeCLOutputFilename(C.getArgs(), NameArg, BaseName, types::TY_PP_C),
7627  &JA);
7628  }
7629 
7630  // Redirect output for the generated source + integration footer.
7631  if (isa<AppendFooterJobAction>(JA)) {
7632  if (Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fsycl_footer_path_EQ)) {
7633  SmallString<128> OutName(A->getValue());
7634  StringRef BaseName = llvm::sys::path::filename(BaseInput);
7635  if (isSaveTempsEnabled()) {
7636  // Retain the location specified by the user with -save-temps.
7637  const char *Suffix = types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType());
7638  std::string::size_type End = std::string::npos;
7639  if (!types::appendSuffixForType(JA.getType()))
7640  End = BaseName.rfind('.');
7641  SmallString<128> Suffixed(BaseName.substr(0, End));
7642  Suffixed += OffloadingPrefix;
7643  Suffixed += '.';
7644  Suffixed += Suffix;
7645  llvm::sys::path::append(OutName, Suffixed.c_str());
7646  } else {
7647  std::string TmpName =
7648  GetTemporaryPath(llvm::sys::path::stem(BaseName),
7649  types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType()));
7650  llvm::sys::path::append(OutName, llvm::sys::path::filename(TmpName));
7651  }
7652  return C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(OutName));
7653  }
7654  }
7655 
7656  // Default to writing to stdout?
7657  if (AtTopLevel && !CCGenDiagnostics && HasPreprocessOutput(JA)) {
7658  return "-";
7659  }
7660 
7661  if (JA.getType() == types::TY_ModuleFile &&
7662  C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_module_file_info)) {
7663  return "-";
7664  }
7665 
7666  // Is this the assembly listing for /FA?
7667  if (JA.getType() == types::TY_PP_Asm &&
7668  (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_FA) ||
7669  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fa))) {
7670  // Use /Fa and the input filename to determine the asm file name.
7671  StringRef BaseName = llvm::sys::path::filename(BaseInput);
7672  StringRef FaValue = C.getArgs().getLastArgValue(options::OPT__SLASH_Fa);
7673  return C.addResultFile(
7674  MakeCLOutputFilename(C.getArgs(), FaValue, BaseName, JA.getType()),
7675  &JA);
7676  }
7677 
7678  // Output to a temporary file?
7679  if ((!AtTopLevel && !isSaveTempsEnabled() &&
7680  (!C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo) ||
7681  // FIXME - The use of /Fo is limited when offloading is enabled. When
7682  // compiling to exe use of /Fo does not produce the named obj. We also
7683  // should not use the named output when performing unbundling.
7684  (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo) &&
7685  (!JA.isOffloading(Action::OFK_None) ||
7686  isa<OffloadUnbundlingJobAction>(JA) ||
7687  JA.getOffloadingHostActiveKinds() > Action::OFK_Host)))) ||
7688  CCGenDiagnostics) {
7689  StringRef Name = llvm::sys::path::filename(BaseInput);
7690  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> Split = Name.split('.');
7691  SmallString<128> TmpName;
7692  const char *Suffix = types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType(), IsCLMode());
7693  Arg *A = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_fcrash_diagnostics_dir);
7694  if (CCGenDiagnostics && A) {
7695  SmallString<128> CrashDirectory(A->getValue());
7696  if (!getVFS().exists(CrashDirectory))
7697  llvm::sys::fs::create_directories(CrashDirectory);
7698  llvm::sys::path::append(CrashDirectory, Split.first);
7699  const char *Middle = Suffix ? "-%%%%%%." : "-%%%%%%";
7700  std::error_code EC = llvm::sys::fs::createUniqueFile(
7701  CrashDirectory + Middle + Suffix, TmpName);
7702  if (EC) {
7703  Diag(clang::diag::err_unable_to_make_temp) << EC.message();
7704  return "";
7705  }
7706  } else {
7707  if (MultipleArchs && !BoundArch.empty()) {
7708  TmpName = GetTemporaryDirectory(Split.first);
7709  llvm::sys::path::append(TmpName,
7710  Split.first + "-" + BoundArch + "." + Suffix);
7711  } else {
7712  TmpName = GetTemporaryPath(Split.first, Suffix);
7713  }
7714  }
7715  return C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpName), JA.getType());
7716  }
7717 
7718  SmallString<128> BasePath(BaseInput);
7719  SmallString<128> ExternalPath("");
7720  StringRef BaseName;
7721 
7722  // Dsymutil actions should use the full path.
7723  if (isa<DsymutilJobAction>(JA) && C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_dsym_dir)) {
7724  ExternalPath += C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_dsym_dir)->getValue();
7725  // We use posix style here because the tests (specifically
7726  // darwin-dsymutil.c) demonstrate that posix style paths are acceptable
7727  // even on Windows and if we don't then the similar test covering this
7728  // fails.
7729  llvm::sys::path::append(ExternalPath, llvm::sys::path::Style::posix,
7730  llvm::sys::path::filename(BasePath));
7731  BaseName = ExternalPath;
7732  } else if (isa<DsymutilJobAction>(JA) || isa<VerifyJobAction>(JA))
7733  BaseName = BasePath;
7734  else
7735  BaseName = llvm::sys::path::filename(BasePath);
7736 
7737  // Determine what the derived output name should be.
7738  const char *NamedOutput;
7739 
7740  if ((JA.getType() == types::TY_Object || JA.getType() == types::TY_LTO_BC ||
7741  JA.getType() == types::TY_Archive) &&
7742  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo, options::OPT__SLASH_o)) {
7743  // The /Fo or /o flag decides the object filename.
7744  StringRef Val =
7745  C.getArgs()
7746  .getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fo, options::OPT__SLASH_o)
7747  ->getValue();
7748  NamedOutput =
7749  MakeCLOutputFilename(C.getArgs(), Val, BaseName, types::TY_Object);
7750  } else if (JA.getType() == types::TY_Image &&
7751  C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fe,
7752  options::OPT__SLASH_o)) {
7753  // The /Fe or /o flag names the linked file.
7754  StringRef Val =
7755  C.getArgs()
7756  .getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fe, options::OPT__SLASH_o)
7757  ->getValue();
7758  NamedOutput =
7759  MakeCLOutputFilename(C.getArgs(), Val, BaseName, types::TY_Image);
7760  } else if (JA.getType() == types::TY_Image) {
7761  if (IsCLMode()) {
7762  // clang-cl uses BaseName for the executable name.
7763  NamedOutput =
7764  MakeCLOutputFilename(C.getArgs(), "", BaseName, types::TY_Image);
7765  } else {
7766  SmallString<128> Output(getDefaultImageName());
7767  // HIP image for device compilation with -fno-gpu-rdc is per compilation
7768  // unit.
7769  bool IsHIPNoRDC = JA.getOffloadingDeviceKind() == Action::OFK_HIP &&
7770  !C.getArgs().hasFlag(options::OPT_fgpu_rdc,
7771  options::OPT_fno_gpu_rdc, false);
7772  if (IsHIPNoRDC) {
7773  Output = BaseName;
7774  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(Output, "");
7775  }
7776  Output += OffloadingPrefix;
7777  if (MultipleArchs && !BoundArch.empty()) {
7778  Output += "-";
7779  Output.append(BoundArch);
7780  }
7781  if (IsHIPNoRDC)
7782  Output += ".out";
7783  NamedOutput = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Output.c_str());
7784  }
7785  } else if (JA.getType() == types::TY_PCH && IsCLMode()) {
7786  NamedOutput = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(GetClPchPath(C, BaseName));
7787  } else {
7788  const char *Suffix = types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType(), IsCLMode());
7789  assert(Suffix && "All types used for output should have a suffix.");
7790 
7791  std::string::size_type End = std::string::npos;
7792  if (!types::appendSuffixForType(JA.getType()))
7793  End = BaseName.rfind('.');
7794  SmallString<128> Suffixed(BaseName.substr(0, End));
7795  Suffixed += OffloadingPrefix;
7796  if (MultipleArchs && !BoundArch.empty()) {
7797  Suffixed += "-";
7798  Suffixed.append(BoundArch);
7799  }
7800  // When using both -save-temps and -emit-llvm, use a ".tmp.bc" suffix for
7801  // the unoptimized bitcode so that it does not get overwritten by the ".bc"
7802  // optimized bitcode output.
7803  auto IsHIPRDCInCompilePhase = [](const JobAction &JA,
7804  const llvm::opt::DerivedArgList &Args) {
7805  // The relocatable compilation in HIP implies -emit-llvm. Similarly, use a
7806  // ".tmp.bc" suffix for the unoptimized bitcode (generated in the compile
7807  // phase.)
7808  return isa<CompileJobAction>(JA) &&
7809  JA.getOffloadingDeviceKind() == Action::OFK_HIP &&
7810  Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fgpu_rdc, options::OPT_fno_gpu_rdc,
7811  false);
7812  };
7813  if (!AtTopLevel && JA.getType() == types::TY_LLVM_BC &&
7814  (C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_emit_llvm) ||
7815  IsHIPRDCInCompilePhase(JA, C.getArgs())))
7816  Suffixed += ".tmp";
7817  Suffixed += '.';
7818  Suffixed += Suffix;
7819  NamedOutput = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(Suffixed.c_str());
7820  }
7821 
7822  // Prepend object file path if -save-temps=obj
7823  if (!AtTopLevel && isSaveTempsObj() && C.getArgs().hasArg(options::OPT_o) &&
7824  JA.getType() != types::TY_PCH) {
7825  Arg *FinalOutput = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT_o);
7826  SmallString<128> TempPath(FinalOutput->getValue());
7827  llvm::sys::path::remove_filename(TempPath);
7828  StringRef OutputFileName = llvm::sys::path::filename(NamedOutput);
7829  llvm::sys::path::append(TempPath, OutputFileName);
7830  NamedOutput = C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TempPath.c_str());
7831  }
7832 
7833  if (isSaveTempsEnabled()) {
7834  // If we're saving temps and the temp file conflicts with any
7835  // input/resulting file, then avoid overwriting.
7836  if (!AtTopLevel) {
7837  bool SameFile = false;
7838  SmallString<256> Result;
7839  llvm::sys::fs::current_path(Result);
7840  llvm::sys::path::append(Result, BaseName);
7841  llvm::sys::fs::equivalent(BaseInput, Result.c_str(), SameFile);
7842  // Must share the same path to conflict.
7843  if (SameFile) {
7844  StringRef Name = llvm::sys::path::filename(BaseInput);
7845  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> Split = Name.split('.');
7846  std::string TmpName = GetTemporaryPath(
7847  Split.first, types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType(), IsCLMode()));
7848  return C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(TmpName));
7849  }
7850  }
7851 
7852  const auto &ResultFiles = C.getResultFiles();
7853  const auto CollidingFilenameIt =
7854  llvm::find_if(ResultFiles, [NamedOutput](const auto &It) {
7855  return StringRef(NamedOutput).equals(It.second);
7856  });
7857  if (CollidingFilenameIt != ResultFiles.end()) {
7858  // Upon any collision, a unique hash will be appended to the filename,
7859  // similar to what is done for temporary files in the regular flow.
7860  StringRef CollidingName(CollidingFilenameIt->second);
7861  std::pair<StringRef, StringRef> Split = CollidingName.split('.');
7862  std::string UniqueName = GetUniquePath(
7863  Split.first, types::getTypeTempSuffix(JA.getType(), IsCLMode()));
7864  return C.addTempFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(UniqueName));
7865  }
7866  }
7867 
7868  // As an annoying special case, PCH generation doesn't strip the pathname.
7869  if (JA.getType() == types::TY_PCH && !IsCLMode()) {
7870  llvm::sys::path::remove_filename(BasePath);
7871  if (BasePath.empty())
7872  BasePath = NamedOutput;
7873  else
7874  llvm::sys::path::append(BasePath, NamedOutput);
7875  return C.addResultFile(C.getArgs().MakeArgString(BasePath.c_str()), &JA);
7876  } else {
7877  return C.addResultFile(NamedOutput, &JA);
7878  }
7879 }
7880 
7881 std::string Driver::GetFilePath(StringRef Name, const ToolChain &TC) const {
7882  // Search for Name in a list of paths.
7883  auto SearchPaths = [&](const llvm::SmallVectorImpl<std::string> &P)
7884  -> llvm::Optional<std::string> {
7885  // Respect a limited subset of the '-Bprefix' functionality in GCC by
7886  // attempting to use this prefix when looking for file paths.
7887  for (const auto &Dir : P) {
7888  if (Dir.empty())
7889  continue;
7890  SmallString<128> P(Dir[0] == '=' ? SysRoot + Dir.substr(1) : Dir);
7891  llvm::sys::path::append(P, Name);
7892  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(Twine(P)))
7893  return std::string(P);
7894  }
7895  return None;
7896  };
7897 
7898  if (auto P = SearchPaths(PrefixDirs))
7899  return *P;
7900 
7901  SmallString<128> R(ResourceDir);
7902  llvm::sys::path::append(R, Name);
7903  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(Twine(R)))
7904  return std::string(R.str());
7905 
7906  SmallString<128> P(TC.getCompilerRTPath());
7907  llvm::sys::path::append(P, Name);
7908  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(Twine(P)))
7909  return std::string(P.str());
7910 
7911  SmallString<128> D(Dir);
7912  llvm::sys::path::append(D, "..", Name);
7913  if (llvm::sys::fs::exists(Twine(D)))
7914  return std::string(D.str());
7915 
7916  if (auto P = SearchPaths(TC.getLibraryPaths()))
7917  return *P;
7918 
7919  if (auto P = SearchPaths(TC.getFilePaths()))
7920  return *P;
7921 
7922  return std::string(Name);
7923 }
7924 
7925 void Driver::generatePrefixedToolNames(
7926  StringRef Tool, const ToolChain &TC,
7927  SmallVectorImpl<std::string> &Names) const {
7928  // FIXME: Needs a better variable than TargetTriple
7929  Names.emplace_back((TargetTriple + "-" + Tool).str());
7930  Names.emplace_back(Tool);
7931 }
7932 
7933 static bool ScanDirForExecutable(SmallString<128> &Dir, StringRef Name) {
7934  llvm::sys::path::append(Dir, Name);
7935  if (llvm::sys::fs::can_execute(Twine(Dir)))
7936  return true;
7937  llvm::sys::path::remove_filename(Dir);
7938  return false;
7939 }
7940 
7941 std::string Driver::GetProgramPath(StringRef Name, const ToolChain &TC) const {
7942  SmallVector<std::string, 2> TargetSpecificExecutables;
7943  generatePrefixedToolNames(Name, TC, TargetSpecificExecutables);
7944 
7945  // Respect a limited subset of the '-Bprefix' functionality in GCC by
7946  // attempting to use this prefix when looking for program paths.
7947  for (const auto &PrefixDir : PrefixDirs) {
7948  if (llvm::sys::fs::is_directory(PrefixDir)) {
7949  SmallString<128> P(PrefixDir);
7950  if (ScanDirForExecutable(P, Name))
7951  return std::string(P.str());
7952  } else {
7953  SmallString<128> P((PrefixDir + Name).str());
7954  if (llvm::sys::fs::can_execute(Twine(P)))
7955  return std::string(P.str());
7956  }
7957  }
7958 
7959  const ToolChain::path_list &List = TC.getProgramPaths();
7960  for (const auto &TargetSpecificExecutable : TargetSpecificExecutables) {
7961  // For each possible name of the tool look for it in
7962  // program paths first, then the path.
7963  // Higher priority names will be first, meaning that
7964  // a higher priority name in the path will be found
7965  // instead of a lower priority name in the program path.
7966  // E.g. <triple>-gcc on the path will be found instead
7967  // of gcc in the program path
7968  for (const auto &Path : List) {
7969  SmallString<128> P(Path);
7970  if (ScanDirForExecutable(P, TargetSpecificExecutable))
7971  return std::string(P.str());
7972  }
7973 
7974  // Fall back to the path
7975  if (llvm::ErrorOr<std::string> P =
7976  llvm::sys::findProgramByName(TargetSpecificExecutable))
7977  return *P;
7978  }
7979 
7980  return std::string(Name);
7981 }
7982 
7983 std::string Driver::GetTemporaryPath(StringRef Prefix, StringRef Suffix) const {
7984  SmallString<128> Path;
7985  std::error_code EC = llvm::sys::fs::createTemporaryFile(Prefix, Suffix, Path);
7986  if (EC) {
7987  Diag(clang::diag::err_unable_to_make_temp) << EC.message();
7988  return "";
7989  }
7990 
7991  return std::string(Path.str());
7992 }
7993 
7994 std::string Driver::GetUniquePath(StringRef BaseName, StringRef Ext) const {
7995  SmallString<128> Path;
7996  std::error_code EC = llvm::sys::fs::getPotentiallyUniqueFileName(
7997  Twine(BaseName) + Twine("-%%%%%%.") + Ext, Path);
7998  if (EC) {
7999  Diag(clang::diag::err_unable_to_make_temp) << EC.message();
8000  return "";
8001  }
8002 
8003  return std::string(Path.str());
8004 }
8005 
8006 std::string Driver::GetTemporaryDirectory(StringRef Prefix) const {
8007  SmallString<128> Path;
8008  std::error_code EC = llvm::sys::fs::createUniqueDirectory(Prefix, Path);
8009  if (EC) {
8010  Diag(clang::diag::err_unable_to_make_temp) << EC.message();
8011  return "";
8012  }
8013 
8014  return std::string(Path.str());
8015 }
8016 
8017 std::string Driver::GetClPchPath(Compilation &C, StringRef BaseName) const {
8018  SmallString<128> Output;
8019  if (Arg *FpArg = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Fp)) {
8020  // FIXME: If anybody needs it, implement this obscure rule:
8021  // "If you specify a directory without a file name, the default file name
8022  // is VCx0.pch., where x is the major version of Visual C++ in use."
8023  Output = FpArg->getValue();
8024 
8025  // "If you do not specify an extension as part of the path name, an
8026  // extension of .pch is assumed. "
8027  if (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(Output))
8028  Output += ".pch";
8029  } else {
8030  if (Arg *YcArg = C.getArgs().getLastArg(options::OPT__SLASH_Yc))
8031  Output = YcArg->getValue();
8032  if (Output.empty())
8033  Output = BaseName;
8034  llvm::sys::path::replace_extension(Output, ".pch");
8035  }
8036  return std::string(Output.str());
8037 }
8038 
8039 const ToolChain &Driver::getToolChain(const ArgList &Args,
8040  const llvm::Triple &Target) const {
8041 
8042  auto &TC = ToolChains[Target.str()];
8043  if (!TC) {
8044  switch (Target.getOS()) {
8045  case llvm::Triple::AIX:
8046  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::AIX>(*this, Target, Args);
8047  break;
8048  case llvm::Triple::Haiku:
8049  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Haiku>(*this, Target, Args);
8050  break;
8051  case llvm::Triple::Ananas:
8052  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Ananas>(*this, Target, Args);
8053  break;
8054  case llvm::Triple::CloudABI:
8055  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CloudABI>(*this, Target, Args);
8056  break;
8057  case llvm::Triple::Darwin:
8058  case llvm::Triple::MacOSX:
8059  case llvm::Triple::IOS:
8060  case llvm::Triple::TvOS:
