8061  case llvm::Triple::WatchOS:
8062  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::DarwinClang>(*this, Target, Args);
8063  break;
8064  case llvm::Triple::DragonFly:
8065  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::DragonFly>(*this, Target, Args);
8066  break;
8067  case llvm::Triple::OpenBSD:
8068  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::OpenBSD>(*this, Target, Args);
8069  break;
8070  case llvm::Triple::NetBSD:
8071  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::NetBSD>(*this, Target, Args);
8072  break;
8073  case llvm::Triple::FreeBSD:
8074  if (Target.isPPC())
8075  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::PPCFreeBSDToolChain>(*this, Target,
8076  Args);
8077  else
8078  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::FreeBSD>(*this, Target, Args);
8079  break;
8080  case llvm::Triple::Minix:
8081  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Minix>(*this, Target, Args);
8082  break;
8083  case llvm::Triple::Linux:
8084  case llvm::Triple::ELFIAMCU:
8085  if (Target.getArch() == llvm::Triple::hexagon)
8086  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::HexagonToolChain>(*this, Target,
8087  Args);
8088  else if ((Target.getVendor() == llvm::Triple::MipsTechnologies) &&
8089  !Target.hasEnvironment())
8090  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::MipsLLVMToolChain>(*this, Target,
8091  Args);
8092  else if (Target.isPPC())
8093  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::PPCLinuxToolChain>(*this, Target,
8094  Args);
8095  else if (Target.getArch() == llvm::Triple::ve)
8096  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::VEToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8097 
8098  else
8099  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Linux>(*this, Target, Args);
8100  break;
8101  case llvm::Triple::NaCl:
8102  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::NaClToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8103  break;
8104  case llvm::Triple::Fuchsia:
8105  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Fuchsia>(*this, Target, Args);
8106  break;
8107  case llvm::Triple::Solaris:
8108  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Solaris>(*this, Target, Args);
8109  break;
8110  case llvm::Triple::AMDHSA:
8111  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::ROCMToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8112  break;
8113  case llvm::Triple::AMDPAL:
8114  case llvm::Triple::Mesa3D:
8115  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::AMDGPUToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8116  break;
8117  case llvm::Triple::Win32:
8118  switch (Target.getEnvironment()) {
8119  default:
8120  if (Target.isOSBinFormatELF())
8121  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Generic_ELF>(*this, Target, Args);
8122  else if (Target.isOSBinFormatMachO())
8123  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::MachO>(*this, Target, Args);
8124  else
8125  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Generic_GCC>(*this, Target, Args);
8126  break;
8127  case llvm::Triple::GNU:
8128  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::MinGW>(*this, Target, Args);
8129  break;
8130  case llvm::Triple::Itanium:
8131  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CrossWindowsToolChain>(*this, Target,
8132  Args);
8133  break;
8134  case llvm::Triple::MSVC:
8135  case llvm::Triple::UnknownEnvironment:
8136  if (Args.getLastArgValue(options::OPT_fuse_ld_EQ)
8137  .startswith_insensitive("bfd"))
8138  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CrossWindowsToolChain>(
8139  *this, Target, Args);
8140  else
8141  TC =
8142  std::make_unique<toolchains::MSVCToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8143  break;
8144  }
8145  break;
8146  case llvm::Triple::PS4:
8147  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::PS4CPU>(*this, Target, Args);
8148  break;
8149  case llvm::Triple::Contiki:
8150  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Contiki>(*this, Target, Args);
8151  break;
8152  case llvm::Triple::Hurd:
8153  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Hurd>(*this, Target, Args);
8154  break;
8155  case llvm::Triple::ZOS:
8156  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::ZOS>(*this, Target, Args);
8157  break;
8158  default:
8159  // Of these targets, Hexagon is the only one that might have
8160  // an OS of Linux, in which case it got handled above already.
8161  switch (Target.getArch()) {
8162  case llvm::Triple::tce:
8163  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::TCEToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8164  break;
8165  case llvm::Triple::tcele:
8166  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::TCELEToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8167  break;
8168  case llvm::Triple::hexagon:
8169  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::HexagonToolChain>(*this, Target,
8170  Args);
8171  break;
8172  case llvm::Triple::lanai:
8173  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::LanaiToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8174  break;
8175  case llvm::Triple::xcore:
8176  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::XCoreToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8177  break;
8178  case llvm::Triple::wasm32:
8179  case llvm::Triple::wasm64:
8180  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::WebAssembly>(*this, Target, Args);
8181  break;
8182  case llvm::Triple::avr:
8183  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::AVRToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8184  break;
8185  case llvm::Triple::msp430:
8186  TC =
8187  std::make_unique<toolchains::MSP430ToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8188  break;
8189  case llvm::Triple::riscv32:
8190  case llvm::Triple::riscv64:
8191  if (toolchains::RISCVToolChain::hasGCCToolchain(*this, Args))
8192  TC =
8193  std::make_unique<toolchains::RISCVToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8194  else
8195  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::BareMetal>(*this, Target, Args);
8196  break;
8197  case llvm::Triple::ve:
8198  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::VEToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8199  break;
8200  case llvm::Triple::spirv32:
8201  case llvm::Triple::spirv64:
8202  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::SPIRVToolChain>(*this, Target, Args);
8203  break;
8204  default:
8205  if (Target.getVendor() == llvm::Triple::Myriad)
8206  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::MyriadToolChain>(*this, Target,
8207  Args);
8208  else if (toolchains::BareMetal::handlesTarget(Target))
8209  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::BareMetal>(*this, Target, Args);
8210  else if (Target.isOSBinFormatELF())
8211  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Generic_ELF>(*this, Target, Args);
8212  else if (Target.isOSBinFormatMachO())
8213  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::MachO>(*this, Target, Args);
8214  else
8215  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::Generic_GCC>(*this, Target, Args);
8216  }
8217  }
8218  }
8219 
8220  // Intentionally omitted from the switch above: llvm::Triple::CUDA. CUDA
8221  // compiles always need two toolchains, the CUDA toolchain and the host
8222  // toolchain. So the only valid way to create a CUDA toolchain is via
8223  // CreateOffloadingDeviceToolChains.
8224 
8225  return *TC;
8226 }
8227 
8228 const ToolChain &Driver::getOffloadingDeviceToolChain(const ArgList &Args,
8229  const llvm::Triple &Target, const ToolChain &HostTC,
8230  const Action::OffloadKind &TargetDeviceOffloadKind) const {
8231  // Use device / host triples as the key into the ToolChains map because the
8232  // device ToolChain we create depends on both.
8233  auto &TC = ToolChains[Target.str() + "/" + HostTC.getTriple().str()];
8234  if (!TC) {
8235  // Categorized by offload kind > arch rather than OS > arch like
8236  // the normal getToolChain call, as it seems a reasonable way to categorize
8237  // things.
8238  switch (TargetDeviceOffloadKind) {
8239  case Action::OFK_Cuda:
8240  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CudaToolChain>(
8241  *this, Target, HostTC, Args, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
8242  break;
8243  case Action::OFK_HIP: {
8244  if (Target.getArch() == llvm::Triple::amdgcn &&
8245  Target.getVendor() == llvm::Triple::AMD &&
8246  Target.getOS() == llvm::Triple::AMDHSA)
8247  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::HIPAMDToolChain>(
8248  *this, Target, HostTC, Args, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
8249  else if (Target.getArch() == llvm::Triple::spirv64 &&
8250  Target.getVendor() == llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor &&
8251  Target.getOS() == llvm::Triple::UnknownOS)
8252  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::HIPSPVToolChain>(*this, Target,
8253  HostTC, Args);
8254  break;
8255  }
8256  case Action::OFK_OpenMP:
8257  // omp + nvptx
8258  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CudaToolChain>(
8259  *this, Target, HostTC, Args, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
8260  break;
8261  case Action::OFK_SYCL:
8262  switch (Target.getArch()) {
8263  case llvm::Triple::spir:
8264  case llvm::Triple::spir64:
8265  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::SYCLToolChain>(
8266  *this, Target, HostTC, Args);
8267  break;
8268  case llvm::Triple::nvptx:
8269  case llvm::Triple::nvptx64:
8270  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::CudaToolChain>(
8271  *this, Target, HostTC, Args, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
8272  break;
8273  case llvm::Triple::amdgcn:
8274  TC = std::make_unique<toolchains::HIPAMDToolChain>(
8275  *this, Target, HostTC, Args, TargetDeviceOffloadKind);
8276  break;
8277  default:
8278  break;
8279  }
8280  break;
8281  default:
8282  break;
8283  }
8284  }
8285 
8286  return *TC;
8287 }
8288 
8289 bool Driver::ShouldUseClangCompiler(const JobAction &JA) const {
8290  // Say "no" if there is not exactly one input of a type clang understands.
8291  if (JA.size() != 1 ||
8292  !types::isAcceptedByClang((*JA.input_begin())->getType()))
8293  return false;
8294 
8295  // And say "no" if this is not a kind of action clang understands.
8296  if (!isa<PreprocessJobAction>(JA) && !isa<PrecompileJobAction>(JA) &&
8297  !isa<CompileJobAction>(JA) && !isa<BackendJobAction>(JA) &&
8298  !isa<ExtractAPIJobAction>(JA))
8299  return false;
8300 
8301  return true;
8302 }
8303 
8304 bool Driver::ShouldUseFlangCompiler(const JobAction &JA) const {
8305  // Say "no" if there is not exactly one input of a type flang understands.
8306  if (JA.size() != 1 ||
8307  !types::isFortran((*JA.input_begin())->getType()))
8308  return false;
8309 
8310  // And say "no" if this is not a kind of action flang understands.
8311  if (!isa<PreprocessJobAction>(JA) && !isa<CompileJobAction>(JA) && !isa<BackendJobAction>(JA))
8312  return false;
8313 
8314  return true;
8315 }
8316 
8317 bool Driver::ShouldEmitStaticLibrary(const ArgList &Args) const {
8318  // Only emit static library if the flag is set explicitly.
8319  if (Args.hasArg(options::OPT_emit_static_lib))
8320  return true;
8321  return false;
8322 }
8323 
8324 /// GetReleaseVersion - Parse (([0-9]+)(.([0-9]+)(.([0-9]+)?))?)? and return the
8325 /// grouped values as integers. Numbers which are not provided are set to 0.
8326 ///
8327 /// \return True if the entire string was parsed (9.2), or all groups were
8328 /// parsed (10.3.5extrastuff).
8329 bool Driver::GetReleaseVersion(StringRef Str, unsigned &Major, unsigned &Minor,
8330  unsigned &Micro, bool &HadExtra) {
8331  HadExtra = false;
8332 
8333  Major = Minor = Micro = 0;
8334  if (Str.empty())
8335  return false;
8336 
8337  if (Str.consumeInteger(10, Major))
8338  return false;
8339  if (Str.empty())
8340  return true;
8341  if (Str[0] != '.')
8342  return false;
8343 
8344  Str = Str.drop_front(1);
8345 
8346  if (Str.consumeInteger(10, Minor))
8347  return false;
8348  if (Str.empty())
8349  return true;
8350  if (Str[0] != '.')
8351  return false;
8352  Str = Str.drop_front(1);
8353 
8354  if (Str.consumeInteger(10, Micro))
8355  return false;
8356  if (!Str.empty())
8357  HadExtra = true;
8358  return true;
8359 }
8360 
8361 /// Parse digits from a string \p Str and fulfill \p Digits with
8362 /// the parsed numbers. This method assumes that the max number of
8363 /// digits to look for is equal to Digits.size().
8364 ///
8365 /// \return True if the entire string was parsed and there are
8366 /// no extra characters remaining at the end.
8367 bool Driver::GetReleaseVersion(StringRef Str,
8368  MutableArrayRef<unsigned> Digits) {
8369  if (Str.empty())
8370  return false;
8371 
8372  unsigned CurDigit = 0;
8373  while (CurDigit < Digits.size()) {
8374  unsigned Digit;
8375  if (Str.consumeInteger(10, Digit))
8376  return false;
8377  Digits[CurDigit] = Digit;
8378  if (Str.empty())
8379  return true;
8380  if (Str[0] != '.')
8381  return false;
8382  Str = Str.drop_front(1);
8383  CurDigit++;
8384  }
8385 
8386  // More digits than requested, bail out...
8387  return false;
8388 }
8389 
8390 std::pair<unsigned, unsigned>
8391 Driver::getIncludeExcludeOptionFlagMasks(bool IsClCompatMode) const {
8392  unsigned IncludedFlagsBitmask = 0;
8393  unsigned ExcludedFlagsBitmask = options::NoDriverOption;
8394 
8395  if (IsClCompatMode) {
8396  // Include CL and Core options.
8397  IncludedFlagsBitmask |= options::CLOption;
8398  IncludedFlagsBitmask |= options::CoreOption;
8399  } else {
8400  ExcludedFlagsBitmask |= options::CLOption;
8401  }
8402 
8403  return std::make_pair(IncludedFlagsBitmask, ExcludedFlagsBitmask);
8404 }
8405 
8406 bool clang::driver::isOptimizationLevelFast(const ArgList &Args) {
8407  return Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_Ofast, options::OPT_O_Group, false);
8408 }
8409 
8410 bool clang::driver::isObjectFile(std::string FileName) {
8411  if (llvm::sys::fs::is_directory(FileName))
8412  return false;
8413  if (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(FileName))
8414  // Any file with no extension should be considered an Object. Take into
8415  // account -lsomelib library filenames.
8416  return FileName.rfind("-l", 0) != 0;
8417  std::string Ext(llvm::sys::path::extension(FileName).drop_front());
8418  // We cannot rely on lookupTypeForExtension solely as that has 'lib'
8419  // marked as an object.
8420  return (Ext != "lib" &&
8421  types::lookupTypeForExtension(Ext) == types::TY_Object);
8422 }
8423 
8424 bool clang::driver::isStaticArchiveFile(const StringRef &FileName) {
8425  if (!llvm::sys::path::has_extension(FileName))
8426  // Any file with no extension should not be considered an Archive.
8427  return false;
8428  llvm::file_magic Magic;
8429  llvm::identify_magic(FileName, Magic);
8430  // Only .lib and archive files are to be considered.
8431  return (Magic == llvm::file_magic::archive);
8432 }
8433 
8434 bool clang::driver::willEmitRemarks(const ArgList &Args) {
8435  // -fsave-optimization-record enables it.
8436  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsave_optimization_record,
8437  options::OPT_fno_save_optimization_record, false))
8438  return true;
8439 
8440  // -fsave-optimization-record=<format> enables it as well.
8441  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_fsave_optimization_record_EQ,
8442  options::OPT_fno_save_optimization_record, false))
8443  return true;
8444 
8445  // -foptimization-record-file alone enables it too.
8446  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_foptimization_record_file_EQ,
8447  options::OPT_fno_save_optimization_record, false))
8448  return true;
8449 
8450  // -foptimization-record-passes alone enables it too.
8451  if (Args.hasFlag(options::OPT_foptimization_record_passes_EQ,
8452  options::OPT_fno_save_optimization_record, false))
8453  return true;
8454  return false;
8455 }
8456 
8457 llvm::StringRef clang::driver::getDriverMode(StringRef ProgName,
8458  ArrayRef<const char *> Args) {
8459  static const std::string OptName =
8460  getDriverOptTable().getOption(options::OPT_driver_mode).getPrefixedName();
8461  llvm::StringRef Opt;
8462  for (StringRef Arg : Args) {
8463  if (!Arg.startswith(OptName))
8464  continue;
8465  Opt = Arg;
8466  }
8467  if (Opt.empty())
8468  Opt = ToolChain::getTargetAndModeFromProgramName(ProgName).DriverMode;
8469  return Opt.consume_front(OptName) ? Opt : "";
8470 }
8471
